original: @94b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @94b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i sam pu ti ti la k'a n'a ma yo g'i n'i tantra r'a dza s+ya t'i k'a smri ti sam darsha n'a lo ka n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i sam pu ti ti la k'a n'a ma yo g'i n'i tantra r'a dza s+ya t'i k'a smri ti sam darsha n'a lo ka n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-samputi-tilaka-nāma-yoginī-tantra-rāja-tīkā-smṛti-sandarśana-loka-nāma.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal kha sbyor thig le zhes bya ba rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa yang dag par lta ba'i dran pa'i snang ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal kha sbyor thig le zhes bya ba rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa yang dag par lta ba'i dran pa'i snang ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The glorious Samputa Tantra: A Commentary on the Queen of Yoginī Tantras, called The Appearance of Memory of the Correct View.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po padma dkar po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po padma dkar po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Padmapāṇi.🔽All forms, without exception,

original: skye ba dang ni 'jig pa yi //🔽gzugs ni ma lus pa rnams ni //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'jig pa yi // gzugs ni ma lus pa rnams ni //
translated: of arising and ceasing,🔽are the bindu,

original: gnyi ga sdang phyir thig le ni //
analyzed: gnyi ga sdang phyir thig le ni //
translated: because of the aversion to both.

original: bde chen de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde chen de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to that great bliss.

original: phyag rgya chen po zhes bya las //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po zhes bya las //
translated: From the so-called mahāmudrā,

original: rang gi spyod pa ston byed pa //
analyzed: rang gi spyod pa ston byed pa //
translated: revealing one's own conduct,

original: stong pa snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: stong pa snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: emptiness and compassion inseparable,

original: mchog tu rtag pa de phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: mchog tu rtag pa de phyag 'tshal //
translated: supremely constant, homage to that.🔽Able to go beyond

original: 'dod chags me yi rgya mtsho las //🔽pha rol du ni 'gro nus pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags me yi rgya mtsho las //🔽pha rol du ni 'gro nus pa //
translated: the ocean of the fire of passion,

original: bla ma'i zhabs la spyi bo yis //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhabs la spyi bo yis //
translated: One should prostrate with one’s head to the guru’s feet

original: phyag 'tshal 'jigs pa'i dbang gis te //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal 'jigs pa'i dbang gis te //
translated: out of fear.

original: rnal 'byor rnal 'byor ma phun tshogs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnal 'byor ma phun tshogs //
translated: The complete yoga and yoginī

original: rgyud 'di rten dang brten pa las //
analyzed: rgyud 'di rten dang brten pa las //
translated: in this tantra, from the support and the supported,

original: mtshan ma thob nas sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob nas sbyor ba ni //
translated: having obtained the sign, the application

original: yang dag lta ba'i dran snang ba //
analyzed: yang dag lta ba'i dran snang ba //
translated: is the appearance of the mindfulness of the correct view.

original: bstan pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of the words of the teaching,

original: skal ldan sems can don phyir ro //🔽byis ba mkhas par mngon rgyal can //
analyzed: skal ldan sems can don phyir ro // byis ba mkhas par mngon rgyal can //
translated: it is for the sake of fortunate sentient beings.

original: rnams la bstan pa nyid mi sbyar //🔽gal te shes rab 'chal ston byed //
analyzed: rnams la bstan pa nyid mi sbyar // gal te shes rab 'chal ston byed //
translated: One should not apply the teaching to🔽the childish, the proud, the conceited,🔽or those who display bad wisdom.

original: mkha' 'gro ma sogs nyer gtses te //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma sogs nyer gtses te //
translated: If one does, one will be harmed by the ḍākinīs, and so on.

original: sems ni 'khrugs par du 'bod dam //
analyzed: sems ni 'khrugs par du 'bod dam //
translated: One’s mind will be disturbed and one will go

original: mnar med la sogs par ni 'gro //
analyzed: mnar med la sogs par ni 'gro //
translated: to the Hell of Screaming and so on.

original: de phyir bla gus ser sna med //
analyzed: de phyir bla gus ser sna med //
translated: Therefore, one should be respectful to the guru, not be stingy,

original: dbang po thul zhing dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: dbang po thul zhing dbang bskur ba //
translated: control the senses, and be initiated.

original: brtan zhing yang dag lam smra byed //
analyzed: brtan zhing yang dag lam smra byed //
translated: One should be steadfast and speak of the correct path.

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po'i snod //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po'i snod //
translated: This is a vessel of the Great Vehicle

original: rgyal ba'i bka' rnams rab skyong byed //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bka' rnams rab skyong byed //
translated: who protects the speech of the Victor.

original: yang dag sbyin la rtag chags shing //
analyzed: yang dag sbyin la rtag chags shing //
translated: Always attached to true generosity,

original: bdag nyid dam ni gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid dam ni gzhan dag ni //
translated: one engages oneself or others

original: 'jug cing 'di ni ston byed la'o //
analyzed: 'jug cing 'di ni ston byed la'o //
translated: in this teaching.

original: 'dir nges par brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa sngon du 'gro ba mngon par blta ste /
analyzed: 'dir nges par brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa sngon du 'gro ba mngon par blta ste /
translated: Here, one should first look at the statement, the object of statement, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose.

original: 'dir re zhig rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rgyas pa 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug las byung ba rgyud nyung du brtag pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid can kha sbyor thig le zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa dang / de las rgyu dang 'bras bu sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir gzhung gi tshogs ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir re zhig rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rgyas pa 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug las byung ba rgyud nyung du brtag pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid can kha sbyor thig le zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa dang / de las rgyu dang 'bras bu sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir gzhung gi tshogs ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the concise tantra with the nature of eleven chapters, called the Union Drop, which arises from the extensive yoga and yoginī tantras of thirty-six hundred thousand, is the statement, and the collection of texts is the object of statement, because it precedes the cause and effect.

original: @95a * // smra bya dang smra byed kyi mtshan nyid la 'bras bu nye bar brtag pa'i phyir 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: @95a * // smra bya dang smra byed kyi mtshan nyid la 'bras bu nye bar brtag pa'i phyir 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection is for the sake of examining the result of the characteristics of the speaker and the spoken.

original: phyi ma las phyi ma'i dbang byin pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma las phyi ma'i dbang byin pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the bestowal of power from the later to the earlier.

original: las kyi tshogs kyi rigs pa dang / bskyed bya dang / skyed byed kyi 'brel pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo khong du chud pa dang / yan lag bcu gnyis spangs pa dang // bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis kyis phyag rgya chen po thob pa ni dgos pa'i dgos par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi tshogs kyi rigs pa dang / bskyed bya dang / skyed byed kyi 'brel pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo khong du chud pa dang / yan lag bcu gnyis spangs pa dang // bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis kyis phyag rgya chen po thob pa ni dgos pa'i dgos par bstan pa'o //
translated: The reason for the collection of rites, the relation between what is generated and what generates, the comprehension of the maṇḍala wheel, the abandonment of the twelve branches, and the attainment of the great seal through the two collections of merit and wisdom are taught as the ultimate purpose.

original: 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the concise meaning.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni rgyas pa'i rgyud kyi rigs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni rgyas pa'i rgyud kyi rigs pas gsungs so //
translated: This is taught by the reasoning of the extensive tantra.

original: da ni brjod par bya ba brjod de gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa nyid kyis tshe 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba phyag rgya chen po'i bde ba'i gnas rdo rje sems dpas
analyzed: da ni brjod par bya ba brjod de gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa nyid kyis tshe 'di la sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu rab tu ster ba phyag rgya chen po'i bde ba'i gnas rdo rje sems dpas
translated: Now, having expressed what is to be expressed, Vajrasattva, the abode of the bliss of the great seal that bestows the fruit of buddhahood in this very life by one's own mental intention for those beings to be tamed who are free from certainty,

original: gsungs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor bas bsgrub bya dang / sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa po rab tu ston par byed pa /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor bas bsgrub bya dang / sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa po rab tu ston par byed pa /
translated: The great maṇḍala of the king of tantras is taught by means of the practice of the object of attainment, the means of attainment, and the attainer.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa /
translated: It is based on the worldly and transcendent truths.

original: mngon par byang chub pa bzhi dang / rdo rje bzhis yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa bzhi dang / rdo rje bzhis yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is purified by the four awakenings and the four vajras.

original: rigs bzhi dang / rigs drug la sogs pa mtha' med pa'i mthar thug pa dang / bden pa bcu gnyis dang / de kho na nyid bcu drug dang / stong pa nyid bcu drug dang / snying rje bcu drug dang / mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa nyid shu'i bdag nyid can dus lnga dang ldan pa 'di ni brjod par bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: rigs bzhi dang / rigs drug la sogs pa mtha' med pa'i mthar thug pa dang / bden pa bcu gnyis dang / de kho na nyid bcu drug dang / stong pa nyid bcu drug dang / snying rje bcu drug dang / mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa nyid shu'i bdag nyid can dus lnga dang ldan pa 'di ni brjod par bya bar bstan to //
translated: It has the four families, the six families, and so on, without end. It has the twelve truths, the sixteen realities, the sixteen emptinesses, the sixteen compassions, and the five times endowed with the nature of the sixteen aspects of awakening. This is taught to be the subject matter.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān also declares in the Web of Magic:

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis bden pa'i don //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis bden pa'i don //
translated: The meaning of the truths has twelve aspects.

original: rnam pa bcu drug de nyid rig / rnam pa nyi shu mngon byang chub //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug de nyid rig / rnam pa nyi shu mngon byang chub //
translated: The sixteen aspects are the knowledge of reality, the twenty aspects are the enlightenment.🔽The aspect of complete Buddhahood is the knowledge of all.

original: rnam par sangs rgyas thams cad rig / ces pa 'dis sngags kyi theg pas 'khyud pa'i dbang por bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par sangs rgyas thams cad rig / ces pa 'dis sngags kyi theg pas 'khyud pa'i dbang por bstan to //
translated: This teaches the embracing of the faculties by the Mantra Vehicle.

original: 'di'i gzhung gi tshogs brtag pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid ba sbyor thig le yang rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhung gi tshogs brtag pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid ba sbyor thig le yang rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The text of this [tantra] is the Essence of the Eleven Chapters, which is also called the Drop of Union.

original: de yang yang brtag pa bcu gcig gi rang bzhin 'di bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpar kun du gnas te /
analyzed: de yang yang brtag pa bcu gcig gi rang bzhin 'di bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpar kun du gnas te /
translated: Moreover, this [tantra] with the nature of eleven chapters abides as the Bhagavān Vajrasattva.

original: dang po re zhig rgyud thams cad gsang ba'i rang bzhin du kun du gnas so //
analyzed: dang po re zhig rgyud thams cad gsang ba'i rang bzhin du kun du gnas so //
translated: First, all tantras abide as the nature of the secret.

original: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam par @95b bsgom pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam par @95b bsgom pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the thought of expressing, the expressed, and the generation of the mind of enlightenment abides.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po bri ba'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po bri ba'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the thought of drawing the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm abides.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i brda'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i brda'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the Vajradaka symbolic thought is present everywhere.

original: spyod pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the thought of conduct is present everywhere.

original: dpyid kyi thig le zhes pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //🔽las thams cad dang bsam gtan 'byung ba zhes pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: dpyid kyi thig le zhes pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so // las thams cad dang bsam gtan 'byung ba zhes pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the thought called the Spring Drop is present everywhere.🔽The nature of the thought called the Arising of All Actions and Meditations is present everywhere.

original: bya ba thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //🔽bya ba'i de kho na nyid kyi rgyal po'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so // bya ba'i de kho na nyid kyi rgyal po'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the thought called the Arising of All Actions is present everywhere.🔽The nature of the thought called the King of the Essences of Action is present everywhere.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i rtog pa'i rgyal po'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i rtog pa'i rgyal po'i rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the King of Thoughts called the Introduction to All Tantras is present everywhere.

original: rtog pa thams cad kyi gleng gzhi thig le thabs sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad kyi gleng gzhi thig le thabs sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin de kun du gnas so //
translated: The nature of the Spring Drop of All Thoughts, the Introduction to the Various Methods, is present everywhere.

original: 'di ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is to be expressed.

original: 'di'i ming brjod pas rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dag gi smra bya dang / smra byed kyi mtshan nyid rab tu byed pa sum cu'i bdag nyid ni 'brel ba'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di'i ming brjod pas rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dag gi smra bya dang / smra byed kyi mtshan nyid rab tu byed pa sum cu'i bdag nyid ni 'brel ba'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: The connection is the nature of the thirty chapters, which is the nature of the expression and the expressed, and the nature of the speaker and the spoken.

original: dang po re zhig rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / byang chub sems la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / de kho na nyid man ngag gi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
analyzed: dang po re zhig rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / byang chub sems la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / de kho na nyid man ngag gi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
translated: Thus, first, the nature of the expression and the expressed, the nature of the entity of generating the mind of enlightenment, and so on, the nature of the entity of engaging the mind of enlightenment, the nature of the entity of the intimate instruction of reality,

original: byang chub sems kyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / shes rab dang thabs kyi don bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos pos dang / 'khor lo thams cad kyi rnam 'phrul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / he ru ka bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / shes rab dang thabs kyi don bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos pos dang / 'khor lo thams cad kyi rnam 'phrul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / he ru ka bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
translated: the nature of the entity of the empowerment of the mind of enlightenment, the nature of the entity of the meditation on the meaning of wisdom and method, the nature of the entity of the emanation of all wheels, the nature of the entity of generating Heruka,

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / bdag med pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / ngag gi brda'i yi ge'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / lus srul po'i mtshan ma dang phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / bdag med pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / ngag gi brda'i yi ge'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / lus srul po'i mtshan ma dang phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
translated: the nature of the means of accomplishment of the dakini of Timeless Awareness, the nature of the means of accomplishment of Nairatmya, the nature of the characteristics of the symbolic syllables of verbal symbols, the nature of the characteristics of the signs and mudras of the body of the rakshasa,

original: l'a ma'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma dang / phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / 'dus pa'i gnas kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi @96a * //
analyzed: l'a ma'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma dang / phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / 'dus pa'i gnas kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi @96a * //
translated: the nature of the characteristics of the signs of the lamas, the nature of the mudras, the nature of the gathering places, the nature of the purity of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: dngos pos dang / spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / yi ge bcu drug mtshon bya dang / mtshon byed kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / rtsa ba'i gnas dgod pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
analyzed: dngos pos dang / spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / yi ge bcu drug mtshon bya dang / mtshon byed kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / rtsa ba'i gnas dgod pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang /
translated: the nature of the entity of the sixteen syllables, the object of illustration and the illustration; the nature of the entity of the arrangement of the fundamental places; the nature of the entity of the body maṇḍala and the fire offering; the nature of the entity of the arising of omniscient gnosis; the nature of the entity of the rite of the fire offering; the nature of the entity of all the assemblies of activities and the arising of the cakra;

original: sbyin sreg gi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / sbyin sreg gi cho ga'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / las tshogs thams cad dang / 'khor lo 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / sbyin sreg gi cho ga'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / las tshogs thams cad dang / 'khor lo 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
translated: and the nature of the entity of the arising of the gnosis of the four joys.

original: dril ba'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / sngags kyi bzlas pa dang / bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / mu stegs pa'i rnam par shes pa bsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
analyzed: dril ba'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / sngags kyi bzlas pa dang / bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / mu stegs pa'i rnam par shes pa bsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang /
translated: the nature of generating all tathāgatas,🔽the nature of offering bali,🔽the nature of establishing the painted image and the volume,🔽the nature of the master’s great sādhana,

original: gtor ma dbul ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / bris sku dang glegs bam gtan la dbab pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / slob dpon gyi sgrub thabs chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / bde ba chen po'i dngos grub dang /
analyzed: gtor ma dbul ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / bris sku dang glegs bam gtan la dbab pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / slob dpon gyi sgrub thabs chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / bde ba chen po'i dngos grub dang /
translated: the nature of the siddhi of great bliss,🔽the nature of offerings and respect,

original: mchod pa dang / bkur sti'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgyu ma'i rnam 'phrul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos por de kun du gnas so /
analyzed: mchod pa dang / bkur sti'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgyu ma'i rnam 'phrul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos por de kun du gnas so /
translated: and the nature of the magical emanations of the buddhas.

original: rtog pa thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i thig le rtog pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid rab tu byed pa sum cu'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por de kun du gnas so //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i thig le rtog pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid rab tu byed pa sum cu'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por de kun du gnas so //
translated: The reality of the thirty chapters is the reality of the eleven concepts, the bindu of the nidāna of all concepts.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dpal he ru ka zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dpal he ru ka zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: That is also related to the glorious Heruka, the Bhagavān Vajrasattva.

original: da ni dgos pa brjod pa brjod de /
analyzed: da ni dgos pa brjod pa brjod de /
translated: Now, the purpose is stated.

original: 'di skad bdag gis la sogs pa ni rgyud mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par ston par byed pa'i tshig phrad do //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis la sogs pa ni rgyud mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par ston par byed pa'i tshig phrad do //
translated: This is the statement of the introductory phrase, “Thus have I heard,” which is the expression that teaches the entire tantra.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i nang nas /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i nang nas /
translated: Here, from among the 8,400,000 bodhisattvas,

original: rdo rje snying po gsol ba 'debs pa pos /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po gsol ba 'debs pa pos /
translated: Vajra garbha, the petitioner,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid las bdag gis thos kyi gzhan las brgyud pa ma yin zhing su zhig las 'ongs pa dang / ma thos pa dang / dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig las thos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid las bdag gis thos kyi gzhan las brgyud pa ma yin zhing su zhig las 'ongs pa dang / ma thos pa dang / dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig las thos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: says, “I heard it from the Bhagavān himself, not from another, not from anyone else, not from anywhere, not from any time, and not from anything not heard.”

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ston pa po dang / @96b bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ston pa po dang / @96b bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One Vajradhara is the teacher, and I heard at one time is the connection.

original: dus ni dus mang ste /
analyzed: dus ni dus mang ste /
translated: Time is many times.

original: de yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is mundane and supramundane.

original: 'dir re zhig 'jig rten pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig 'jig rten pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, the mundane is of four types:

original: chags pa dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / stongs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / stongs pa'o //
translated: creation, destruction, persistence, and void.

original: de bzhin du lhar yang skyes pa'i mtshan nyid gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhar yang skyes pa'i mtshan nyid gnas so //
translated: Similarly, the characteristics of birth as a god persist.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa gsum gyi dbye bas lus dang ngag dang / sems kyi bdag nyid sgo nga las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang mngal las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa gsum gyi dbye bas lus dang ngag dang / sems kyi bdag nyid sgo nga las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang mngal las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the division of the three consciousnesses, the body, speech, and mind are of the nature of the egg-born, the moisture-born, the womb-born, and the spontaneously born.

original: de yang lus kyi dbang gis mtshungs so //
analyzed: de yang lus kyi dbang gis mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, they are similar by the power of the body.

original: slar yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /🔽bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: slar yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te / bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: Again, there are four types:🔽the words of the teaching.

original: lhar bshad pa brjod de /
analyzed: lhar bshad pa brjod de /
translated: The explanation of the gods is stated.

original: dus de nyid ni 'phags pa rnams brtan zhing sems can gyi don rgyun chags pa thar pa ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus de nyid ni 'phags pa rnams brtan zhing sems can gyi don rgyun chags pa thar pa ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: That very time is the liberation that bestows the benefit of sentient beings, which is stable for the āryas.

original: de bzhin du byis pa rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / phrag dog gi dbang gis ngan 'gro ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / phrag dog gi dbang gis ngan 'gro ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for the childish, it bestows the lower realms due to the power of desire, anger, ignorance, and envy.

original: ci 'phags pa rnams kyi dang / ci byis pa rnams kyi las /
analyzed: ci 'phags pa rnams kyi dang / ci byis pa rnams kyi las /
translated: What is the time of the āryas? What is the time of the childish?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi dus gcig mi nyams pa'i mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi dus gcig mi nyams pa'i mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
translated: The time of the āryas is the characteristic of the nondegeneration of the single time, free from subject and object.

original: smra bya dang smra byed las 'das pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / don dam pa dang / 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: smra bya dang smra byed las 'das pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / don dam pa dang / 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the dharmakāya, which is beyond speech and speaker, the limit of reality, emptiness, nonduality, the perfection of wisdom, the ultimate, and the nature of luminosity.

original: byis pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'i phyir sems nyams shing sad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'i phyir sems nyams shing sad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis /
translated: The time of the childish is the characteristic of the degeneration and awakening of the mind due to movement.

original: rgas pa dang / na bas 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba ster bar byed pa sdig pa'i dbang gis dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgas pa dang / na bas 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba ster bar byed pa sdig pa'i dbang gis dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The fear of hell arises through the power of sin, which brings about old age, sickness, and death.

original: bsod nams kyi dbang gis mtho ris kyi 'bras bu 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi dbang gis mtho ris kyi 'bras bu 'thob bo //
translated: Through the power of merit, the fruit of heaven is obtained.

original: de de bzhin du yang rnam pa bzhi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du yang rnam pa bzhi zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, there are four kinds of ages.

original: de la rdzogs ldan dang / gsum ldan dang gnyis ldan dang ; rtsod pa'i dus 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rdzogs ldan dang / gsum ldan dang gnyis ldan dang ; rtsod pa'i dus 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The age of completeness, the age of three parts, the age of two parts, and the age of conflict.

original: der tshe rabs snga ma'i tshogs gnyis kyi dbang gis /
analyzed: der tshe rabs snga ma'i tshogs gnyis kyi dbang gis /
translated: In that age, through the power of the two collections of merit and knowledge from previous lives,

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: those who are Buddhists become Buddhas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not Hearers and so forth.

original: bdag dang / bdag gi dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang @97a * //
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gi dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang @97a * //
translated: Because of the power of the concepts of self, self-possession, subject, and object,

original: gis 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: gis 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: they wander in cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin du 'chad bzhin pa las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chad bzhin pa las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: This should be explained in detail from the Tantra of the Wheel of Time.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa yang gcig gi rnam pa skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid dus bzhi rnams kyis yongs su shes pa smra bya dang smra byed kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa yang gcig gi rnam pa skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid dus bzhi rnams kyis yongs su shes pa smra bya dang smra byed kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
translated: Likewise, the supramundane is also to be described as the characteristic of the single moment of the single aspect of manifest enlightenment, by means of the four times, free from the characteristic of the speaker and the spoken.

original: bskyed bya dang / skyed byed rjes su mthun par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed bya dang / skyed byed rjes su mthun par gnas pa'o //
translated: The object of generation and the generator are in harmony.

original: 'di yongs su shes pas sems can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yongs su shes pas sems can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By knowing this, all sentient beings will be liberated.

original: 'di ni dus gcig gi mtshan nyid dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dus gcig gi mtshan nyid dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning of the characteristic of a single time.

original: de nas 'dir 'di skad bdag gis thos pa nges par gzung zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nas 'dir 'di skad bdag gis thos pa nges par gzung zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, here, it is said to be ascertained as thus have I heard.

original: 'on kyang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas kha sbyor las byung ba'i rgyud ces pa 'di'i mthar thug pa'i ngag dang pos brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa nye bar dgod pa ni nyan pa po rnams gzhug pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas kha sbyor las byung ba'i rgyud ces pa 'di'i mthar thug pa'i ngag dang pos brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa nye bar dgod pa ni nyan pa po rnams gzhug pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: However, from thus have I heard up to the tantra that arises from union, the subject matter and purpose expressed by the first statement at the end of this are taught in order to engage the listeners.

original: gzhan du gal te brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa 'dir ma brjod na /
analyzed: gzhan du gal te brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa 'dir ma brjod na /
translated: Otherwise, if the subject matter and purpose were not stated here,

original: ji ltar sems can rnams mnyan pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams mnyan pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: how would sentient beings engage in listening?

original: thams cad du dgos pa la 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: thams cad du dgos pa la 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur mod /
translated: They would engage everywhere, since they would have a desire for the purpose.

original: ji srid gsum du dgos pa nges par ma bzung ba de srid du skyes bu su zhig 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji srid gsum du dgos pa nges par ma bzung ba de srid du skyes bu su zhig 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: But until the purpose is ascertained in three ways, who would engage in it?

original: de yang skyes bu'i don gyi dgos pa la sbyor bas thabs dang bcas par gal te 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'jug go //
analyzed: de yang skyes bu'i don gyi dgos pa la sbyor bas thabs dang bcas par gal te 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'jug go //
translated: If it were connected with the means of attaining the human goal, then one would engage in it.

original: de yang 'dir yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang 'dir yod pa nyid de /
translated: And that is present here.

original: 'di ltar yang 'chad bzhin pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de kho na nyid don dam pa skyes bu'i don du dgos pa de'i don du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'chad bzhin pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de kho na nyid don dam pa skyes bu'i don du dgos pa de'i don du bstan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the ultimate reality characterized by nondual wisdom, which is being explained in this way, should be taught for the sake of the human goal, which is the purpose.

original: de'i phyir 'dir brjod par bya ba ni he ru ka la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir brjod par bya ba ni he ru ka la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the subject matter here is that reality characterized by Heruka and so on.

original: dgos pa yang de yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa yang de yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the thorough understanding of that.

original: de'i phyir de yongs su shes pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yongs su shes pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob ste /
translated: Therefore, through the thorough understanding of that, one attains nirvana.

original: shin tu rab tu grub pa 'di ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rab tu grub pa 'di ni dgos pa'o //
translated: This is the purpose of the thorough establishment.

original: gal te yang sgra'i don gyi rgyun med pa'i phyir tshad med de /
analyzed: gal te yang sgra'i don gyi rgyun med pa'i phyir tshad med de /
translated: If, however, there is no measure because there is no continuity of the meaning of the words,

original: de ltar na yang don la the tshom za bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang don la the tshom za bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: then there will be doubt about the meaning.

original: de la rtog pa dang ldan par 'jug go //
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang ldan par 'jug go //
translated: One engages in that with conceptual thought.

original: dbang po rnon po 'jug ste gzhan gyi rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po 'jug ste gzhan gyi rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One engages with a sharp faculty, because there is no other aspect.

original: dbang po @97b rnon pos skyes bu'i don de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po @97b rnon pos skyes bu'i don de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should engage in the reality that is the meaning of the person with a sharp faculty.

original: 'di ltar yang rang gi ngo bos de kho na nyid de la brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rang gi ngo bos de kho na nyid de la brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i dngos po med do //
translated: In this way, there is no entity of the expressed and the expresser in that reality by way of its own nature.

original: der bla mas brjod pa las kyang rang gis rig pa med de /
analyzed: der bla mas brjod pa las kyang rang gis rig pa med de /
translated: There is no self-awareness from the expression of the guru in that,

original: de kho na nyid ni ngag thams cad kyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni ngag thams cad kyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that reality is beyond all verbal conventions.

original: de lta mod kyi yang dag pa'i rigs pa can gyis bla ma'i ngag las des lam 'ga' zhig rnyed de phyi nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yongs su spong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam nye bar dmigs pa'i rim gyis dad pa la sogs pa'i yon
analyzed: de lta mod kyi yang dag pa'i rigs pa can gyis bla ma'i ngag las des lam 'ga' zhig rnyed de phyi nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yongs su spong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam nye bar dmigs pa'i rim gyis dad pa la sogs pa'i yon
translated: Still, those who possess correct reasoning find some path through the guru's speech and later, through the process of observing the path characterized by the abandonment of the view of the transitory collection and so on, they generate the wisdom that is the antidote to the afflictions.🔽

original: tan dang ldan pa'i slob ma'i bsgom pa brgyud pa las de kho na nyid des rang nyid byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: tan dang ldan pa'i slob ma'i bsgom pa brgyud pa las de kho na nyid des rang nyid byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, the one who is endowed with right reasoning, having found some path from the words of the guru, later, by the process of observing the path characterized by the abandonment of the view of the transitory composite and so on, the disciple who is endowed with the qualities of faith and so on, by the process of meditation, is blessed by that suchness itself.

original: rigs pas thams cad kyi shes pa ngan pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su gtang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas thams cad kyi shes pa ngan pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su gtang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the characteristics of all wrong knowledge by reasoning.

original: de'i phyir ma lus pa'i shes pas ngan pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma lus pa'i shes pas ngan pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of the abandonment of all wrong knowledge,

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes gang don dam pa de rang nyid kyis rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes gang don dam pa de rang nyid kyis rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: one finds that suchness itself, which is right pristine wisdom, is found by oneself.

original: snang ba mun pa sel ba bzhin dang / nyi mas mun pa sel ba bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba mun pa sel ba bzhin dang / nyi mas mun pa sel ba bzhin no //
translated: Like light dispelling darkness, like the sun dispelling darkness.

original: der 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes pa 'dis rdo rje snying po thos pa mang ba dang ldan par gsal bar bstan te /🔽dus gcig gi tshe na bdag gis de kho na nyid 'di thos la /
analyzed: der 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes pa 'dis rdo rje snying po thos pa mang ba dang ldan par gsal bar bstan te / dus gcig gi tshe na bdag gis de kho na nyid 'di thos la /
translated: Here, the words thus have I heard indicate that the vajra essence is endowed with much learning.

original: gzhan du ni de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan las kun rdzob du ma dang don dam pa'i dbye bas so //🔽du ma'i dbye bas bcom ldan 'das gcig pu bzhugs te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan las kun rdzob du ma dang don dam pa'i dbye bas so // du ma'i dbye bas bcom ldan 'das gcig pu bzhugs te /
translated: At one time, I heard this reality, but at another time, I heard it from another Tathagata, by way of the division of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas dang ; de bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas dang ; de bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The Bhagavat abides by way of the division of the many, by way of the division of the conventional and the ultimate, by way of the division of the animate and inanimate, of women and men, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kun rdzob kyi gzugs kyang yin la don dam pa'i gzugs kyang de yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kun rdzob kyi gzugs kyang yin la don dam pa'i gzugs kyang de yin no //
translated: That Bhagavat is the conventional form and the ultimate form.

original: 'dis de kho na nyid sgrib par byed pas kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: 'dis de kho na nyid sgrib par byed pas kun rdzob bo //
translated: It is the conventional because it obscures reality.

original: don yang yin la dam pa yang yin pas don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don yang yin la dam pa yang yin pas don dam pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate because it is the object and the supreme.

original: dam pa'i sgra ni phul du byung ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: dam pa'i sgra ni phul du byung ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The word “sublime” is a synonym for “excellent.”

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gcig pu'i gzugs nyid ji ltar de so so'i dbye bas gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin dga' @98a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gcig pu'i gzugs nyid ji ltar de so so'i dbye bas gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin dga' @98a * //
translated: Therefore, how could the form of the Blessed One alone be established by its individual divisions? This is the meaning.

original: ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i yid kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i yid kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the form of the Blessed One should be known by the mind that is of the nature of innate joy, with uninterrupted joy.

original: 'dis ni phyag rgya chen po gsal bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyag rgya chen po gsal bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This clarifies the Great Seal.

original: 'di ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: This is the purpose of the purpose.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs zhes pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'bras bu la rgyur nye bar btags pas gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs zhes pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po 'bras bu la rgyur nye bar btags pas gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the perfection of the place by the Blessed One's statement in the phrase the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Great Seal that is taught is figuratively designated as the cause of the result.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathagata and so on is stated.

original: bha ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: bha ni srid pa ste /
translated: Bha is existence.

original: rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i nye bar btags pas kun rdzob kyi bden par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i nye bar btags pas kun rdzob kyi bden par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conventional truth is taught by the designation self-consecration.

original: ga b'an zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ga b'an zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Gaṇanā means going to nirvāṇa.

original: su zhig 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: su zhig 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Who goes?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs so // de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin te /
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs las byung ba rnams so ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs las byung ba rnams so ;
translated: They are tathāgatas and all, and they arise from the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: /'dir sku las byung ba rnams ni dgongs bshad gzhan gyis gsungs pa 'jug pa'i tshogs drug gi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: /'dir sku las byung ba rnams ni dgongs bshad gzhan gyis gsungs pa 'jug pa'i tshogs drug gi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: Here, those arising from the body are the consciousnesses of the six sense bases, as stated by the intention of the commentary.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: And they are as follows:

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyams su myong bas re re yang grangs med pa de rnams su snang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyams su myong bas re re yang grangs med pa de rnams su snang ste /
translated: Therefore, by the experience of the grasped and grasper, each of them appears as countless.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang yul 'khor dang rgyal po'i pho brang dang ljon shing dang gel ba dang / lcug ma la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du grong dang grong khyer dang lam dang tshong dus la sogs pa na gnas pa'i sems can sna tshogs pa rnams yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid do //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dang yul 'khor dang rgyal po'i pho brang dang ljon shing dang gel ba dang / lcug ma la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du grong dang grong khyer dang lam dang tshong dus la sogs pa na gnas pa'i sems can sna tshogs pa rnams yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid do //
translated: Because they are seen as the various sentient beings abiding in the stable and moving, in the country, in the king's palace, in the trees, in the vines, in the bushes, and so on, and likewise in the villages, cities, roads, markets, and so on, they are the Tathagatas themselves.

original: 'on kyang mu stegs la sogs pa ni mi shes pa'i sgrib pas g-yogs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mu stegs la sogs pa ni mi shes pa'i sgrib pas g-yogs so //
translated: However, the tirthikas and so on are covered by the obscurations of ignorance.

original: sangs rgyas pa snying rje can rnams ni yang dag par yongs su shes pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa snying rje can rnams ni yang dag par yongs su shes pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The compassionate Buddhists have the correct understanding. Therefore, it is said of them.

original: de bzhin du gsungs las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: The Tathagata arises from the teachings.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rang bzhin ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dri mas bsgribs pa rnams ni 'khor ba nas 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rang bzhin ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dri mas bsgribs pa rnams ni 'khor ba nas 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: Those who are obscured by the stains of ignorance, etc., which are the nature of the afflicted mind, revolve in cyclic existence.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi don la chags shing brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams skye bas sna tshogs @98b par sprul cing rang gi las kyi srid pa len to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi don la chags shing brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams skye bas sna tshogs @98b par sprul cing rang gi las kyi srid pa len to //
translated: However, the bodhisattvas, who are attached to the welfare of others and are diligent, emanate various bodies for the sake of sentient beings and take up existence through their own karma.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa cung zad tsam gyis bsgribs mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa cung zad tsam gyis bsgribs mod /
translated: Therefore, they are obscured by only a little of the afflictions.

original: rang gi dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not obscured by their own power.

original: de bzhin du thugs las byung ba ni sngon gyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs las byung ba ni sngon gyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the emanations arise from the Tathāgata’s mind through the power of his former aspirations, like dependent origination.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: And they are the tathāgatas.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rig pa tsam la chags pa'i 'tsho ba lus las skye ba dgos dang lcags sgrog bzhin 'khor bar bcings pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rig pa tsam la chags pa'i 'tsho ba lus las skye ba dgos dang lcags sgrog bzhin 'khor bar bcings pa rnams te /
translated: However, those who are attached to mere consciousness, who are bound in cyclic existence by the need for the body to arise, like an iron chain,

original: brgya lam na mtshan mo'i glog bzhin dge ba'i grogs dang phrad pas grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgya lam na mtshan mo'i glog bzhin dge ba'i grogs dang phrad pas grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if, by chance, like a flash of lightning at night, one meets a spiritual friend, one will be liberated.

original: de ltar yang rang dbang thob pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnam par spangs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang rang dbang thob pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnam par spangs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one will become a tathāgata, because one has attained independence and abandoned the eight worldly concerns.

original: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sems can bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnams sku dang gsung dang thugs las skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sems can bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnams sku dang gsung dang thugs las skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the sentient beings of the three realms, women, men, and so forth, are born from the body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa mthong ba dang / dge ba'i grogs mchog mnyes pa dang / pho nya dang pho nya mo rnams kyi mchod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i nye bar spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa mthong ba dang / dge ba'i grogs mchog mnyes pa dang / pho nya dang pho nya mo rnams kyi mchod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i nye bar spyod pa dang /
translated: The nature of these [beings] is to be known, the conventional truth is to be seen, the supreme spiritual friend is to be pleased, and the enjoyments of the worship of the messengers and the female messengers are to be experienced.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi pha rol tu 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa dang bral ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa dang 'dod pa'i lha mnyes pa dang / theg pa gsum gyi cho ga dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi pha rol tu 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa dang bral ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa dang 'dod pa'i lha mnyes pa dang / theg pa gsum gyi cho ga dang /
translated: It is the perfection of the Tathāgata’s speech, the absence of enjoyment of the five sense objects, the pleasing of the desired deities such as the maṇḍala wheel, the rites of the three vehicles,

original: theg pa mchog rtogs pa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul yongs su rdzogs pa dang / gnyis su med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas so //
analyzed: theg pa mchog rtogs pa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul yongs su rdzogs pa dang / gnyis su med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas so //
translated: the realization of the supreme vehicle, the abiding in the stage of devoted conduct, the complete perfection of the method of the ten perfections, nonduality, suchness, and abiding in the luminosity samādhi.

original: 'di mtha' dag rnam par mi rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: 'di mtha' dag rnam par mi rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: All of these are the Tathāgata’s body, speech, and mind, which are connected with nonconceptuality.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dbyer med par byas shing ro gcig par 'gyur ba bde ba chen po bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba gsum bsdus pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang he ru kar bshad do //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dbyer med par byas shing ro gcig par 'gyur ba bde ba chen po bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba gsum bsdus pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang he ru kar bshad do //
translated: Having made body, speech, and mind inseparable, he becomes of one taste, the great bliss, the Bhagavān Vajradhara Heruka, the nature of the collection of the three secrets of body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: gang du bzhugs she na /
analyzed: gang du bzhugs she na /
translated: Where does he dwell?

original: rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la //
analyzed: rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la //
translated: In the bhaga of Vajra Queen.

original: zhes so // rdo rje btsun mo ni spyan ma la sogs pa ste /🔽de rnams kyi bha ga'i padma la bye ba @99a * //
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje btsun mo ni spyan ma la sogs pa ste / de rnams kyi bha ga'i padma la bye ba @99a * //
translated: The Vajra Queen is Locanā and so forth.

original: phrag brgyad cu'i 'dab ma'i bdag nyid rang gi 'khor 'dus pa dang lhan cig pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bo rol pa dang ldan par bzhugs zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: phrag brgyad cu'i 'dab ma'i bdag nyid rang gi 'khor 'dus pa dang lhan cig pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bo rol pa dang ldan par bzhugs zhes sbyar ro //
translated: In the bhaga lotus of those, with his own retinue assembled, he dwells in the nature of eighty-four hundred thousand petals, the Bhagavān, the nature of gnosis, endowed with play.

original: padma ni mdor bsdus na lus so //
analyzed: padma ni mdor bsdus na lus so //
translated: The lotus is the body, in brief.

original: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag bcom pa'i phyir bha ga'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag bcom pa'i phyir bha ga'o //
translated: The bhaga is because all conceptuality is destroyed.

original: bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni 'dab ma rnams so //
analyzed: bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni 'dab ma rnams so //
translated: The nature of eighty million is the petals.

original: shes bya'i mchog nyid 'di shes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rdo rje snying po'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i mchog nyid 'di shes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rdo rje snying po'o //
translated: The supreme object of knowledge is the vajra essence, because it is the knowledge of this.

original: rdo rje yang yin la snying po yang yin pas na rdo rje snying po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin la snying po yang yin pas na rdo rje snying po ste /
translated: It is a vajra and it is an essence, thus it is a vajra essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Bhagavān’s form is the nature of a reflection, the characteristic of the emanation body.

original: de ltar yang ;
analyzed: de ltar yang ;
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rang nyid byed cing rang nyid 'phrog / rang nyid rgyal po rang nyid gtso //🔽de ni ston pa rang nyid de //
analyzed: rang nyid byed cing rang nyid 'phrog / rang nyid rgyal po rang nyid gtso // de ni ston pa rang nyid de //
translated: One acts oneself, one steals oneself, one is the king oneself, one is the chief oneself.🔽One is the teacher oneself.

original: bstan bya yang ni rang nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bya yang ni rang nyid do //
translated: One is the object of teaching oneself.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dis ni sdud pa po'i nges pa spang ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sdud pa po'i nges pa spang ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the abandonment of the restriction of the compiler.

original: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of this is clarified:

original: bzhugs zhes pa ni rdo rje btsun mo rnams kyi bha ga rnams la ste /
analyzed: bzhugs zhes pa ni rdo rje btsun mo rnams kyi bha ga rnams la ste /
translated: “Resides” in the vaginas of the vajra women.

original: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi gsang ba'i bu ga rnams su rol pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi gsang ba'i bu ga rnams su rol pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The seventy-two thousand channels are the secret openings.

original: su zhig ce na /
analyzed: su zhig ce na /
translated: Who?

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes sku'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes sku'o //
translated: The Bhagavān, the jñānakāya.

original: rtsa 'di rnams kyi dbus su khong stong gi bdag nyid aa wa dh'u t'i'i rnam pa rang gi ngo bos 'bar ba srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams sdud pa phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams rang bzhin med par byed cing thig le'i gnas su son pa mi shigs pa dang 'khyud pa ro gcig pa'i dngos po byang chub kyi sems ye shes mi 'dzag pa las rang rig pa'i ye shes skye ba ni phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: rtsa 'di rnams kyi dbus su khong stong gi bdag nyid aa wa dh'u t'i'i rnam pa rang gi ngo bos 'bar ba srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams sdud pa phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams rang bzhin med par byed cing thig le'i gnas su son pa mi shigs pa dang 'khyud pa ro gcig pa'i dngos po byang chub kyi sems ye shes mi 'dzag pa las rang rig pa'i ye shes skye ba ni phyag rgya ste /
translated: In the middle of these channels, in the form of the avadhūtī, which is the nature of an empty interior, the life-force vāyu, and so on, are gathered. The aggregates, dhātus, and āyatanas are rendered devoid of intrinsic existence. Arriving at the location of the bindu, the indivisible and embracing single taste is the bodhicitta of pristine consciousness. The pristine consciousness of one’s vidyā arises from the undiminishing pristine consciousness.

original: phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The mudra is the mahāmudrā.

original: 'on kyang srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams rnam ba gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams rnam ba gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: However, the life-force vāyu, and so on, are transformed into three.

original: re zhig las dang / dbyings dang rdo rje lta bu rim pa bzhin du dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye bas gnas pa ni las so //
analyzed: re zhig las dang / dbyings dang rdo rje lta bu rim pa bzhin du dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye bas gnas pa ni las so //
translated: The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i lus kyi rtsa la gnas pa ni dbyibs so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i lus kyi rtsa la gnas pa ni dbyibs so //
translated: The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.

original: de bzhin du ye shes dang rnam par shes pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rdo rje lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes dang rnam par shes pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rdo rje lta bu'o //
translated: The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.

original: de yongs su shes pa ni bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi stobs dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag drug khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa ni bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi stobs dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag drug khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.

original: de la yan lag drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.

original: so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog dang rtsol ba de bzhin gzung //🔽rjes su dran dang ting 'dzin rnams //
analyzed: so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog dang rtsol ba de bzhin gzung // rjes su dran dang ting 'dzin rnams //
translated: The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag 'dod //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag 'dod //
translated: The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the life-force because the life-force is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the elements because the elements are located in the body.🔽The body is the place of the vajra because the vajra is located in the body.🔽The body is the place of

original: ces so // @99b dgongs bshad gzhan gyis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces so // @99b dgongs bshad gzhan gyis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is also taught in other explanatory tantras, such as the glorious Guhyasamaja.

original: de yang du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid dang / stong pa'i sku mthong ba'i phyir dang / ji srid du yan lag drug cur 'gyur gyi bar ro //
analyzed: de yang du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid dang / stong pa'i sku mthong ba'i phyir dang / ji srid du yan lag drug cur 'gyur gyi bar ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the characteristic of the signs such as smoke and so forth, and the vision of the empty form, and it is as long as there are sixty branches.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the Lord has also taught in the Magical Net:

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug mgon po ste //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug mgon po ste //
translated: The lord of the ten grounds, the protector,

original: sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: Is well-established on the ten grounds.🔽The self of the ten knowledges is pure,

original: shes bcu rnam par dag pa'i bdag / shes bcu rnam par dag pa 'chang //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam par dag pa'i bdag / shes bcu rnam par dag pa 'chang //
translated: And the ten knowledges are pure.

original: rnam pa bcu po don gyi don //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po don gyi don //
translated: The ten aspects are the meaning of the meaning,🔽The lord of the ten powers of the lord of the sages,

original: thub dbang khyab bdag stobs bcu'i bdag / ma lus sna tshogs don byed pa //
analyzed: thub dbang khyab bdag stobs bcu'i bdag / ma lus sna tshogs don byed pa //
translated: The one who acts for the sake of all varieties,

original: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //
analyzed: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //
translated: The great one who possesses the ten powers.

original: zhes so // 'di'i don ni rgyud sna tshogs kyi dgongs pas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di'i don ni rgyud sna tshogs kyi dgongs pas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood by the intention of the various tantras.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i rgya cher 'grel las nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i rgya cher 'grel las nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it should be illustrated in the commentary composed by the Bodhisattva.

original: bdag gis kyang rgyud 'di'i don cung zad rang gi blo'i dbang gis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rgyud 'di'i don cung zad rang gi blo'i dbang gis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: I will also compose a little of the meaning of this tantra according to the power of my own intellect.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the Yoga Tantra.

original: kha sbyor thig le zhes pa rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa yang dag par lta ba'i dran pa'i snang ba zhes pa las rjod byed dang / brjod bya la sogs pas rgyud la 'jug pa bstan pa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: kha sbyor thig le zhes pa rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa yang dag par lta ba'i dran pa'i snang ba zhes pa las rjod byed dang / brjod bya la sogs pas rgyud la 'jug pa bstan pa ste dang po'o /
translated: In the commentary on the king of tantras called the Heruka Galpo, called the Light of the Remembrance of the Correct View, the introduction to the tantra by means of the expression, the expressed, and so forth, is the first.

original: // / da ni sdud pa po'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni sdud pa po'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the words of the compiler,

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu rnams kyi dbus su rdo rje snying po la gzigs te 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu rnams kyi dbus su rdo rje snying po la gzigs te 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Then, the Bhagavān, in the midst of eight hundred million lords of yoga, looked at Vajra Heart and smiled.”

original: der zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: “There” means “for that reason.”

original: rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi khang pa brtsegs ma'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa sku'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi khang pa brtsegs ma'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa sku'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: In the center of a multi-storied palace made of various jewels, the Blessed One is the nature of the Enjoyment Body, Vajradhara.

original: 'di la bcom pa yod pas na bcom ldan no //
analyzed: 'di la bcom pa yod pas na bcom ldan no //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he is the destroyer of the afflictions.

original: yang na mchog tu gsang ba'i rnal 'byor gyi bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs pa'i phyir bha ga rim las bzlog pa'i 'od zer gyi phreng bas khams gsum pa bskyed bya skyed byed 'brel pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bstan te /
analyzed: yang na mchog tu gsang ba'i rnal 'byor gyi bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs pa'i phyir bha ga rim las bzlog pa'i 'od zer gyi phreng bas khams gsum pa bskyed bya skyed byed 'brel pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bstan te /
translated: Or else, he is the Blessed One because he is the destroyer of the three worlds, since he is the source of the rain of the nectar of the supreme secret yoga, by the garland of light rays that reverse the bhaga stage.

original: yang zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The word also is for emphasis.

original: de bzhin du b'an zhes pa ni bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du b'an zhes pa ni bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, vāṇ means endowed with an entourage of 8,400,000.

original: der ci lhag pa dang chad pa ma brjod de brgyad cu nges par smos /
analyzed: der ci lhag pa dang chad pa ma brjod de brgyad cu nges par smos /
translated: What remains there is not stated, but 80 is definitely mentioned.

original: 'dir gsungs pa sems can thams cad kyi dpral ba nas rkang pa'i mthe bong gi bar la rang gi lag pa'i sor brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa sems can thams cad kyi dpral ba nas rkang pa'i mthe bong gi bar la rang gi lag pa'i sor brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
translated: Here it is said that the forehead to the toes of all sentient beings is eighty finger-widths.

original: gtsug @100a * //
analyzed: gtsug @100a * //
translated: The crown

original: tor la sor bzhi'i tshad do //
analyzed: tor la sor bzhi'i tshad do //
translated: is four finger-widths.

original: de'i phyir sor re re la bye ba'i grangs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sor re re la bye ba'i grangs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams gnas so //
translated: Therefore, in each finger-width there are ten million yoginīs.

original: de ci zhe na dbugs phyir rgyu ba dang / nang du rgyu ba bcings pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ci zhe na dbugs phyir rgyu ba dang / nang du rgyu ba bcings pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: What are they? They are the nature of the yoga of the exhalation and inhalation of the breath.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na /
translated: Therefore, because there is yoga here,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug ste /
translated: it is the lord of yogins.

original: pha dang bu bzhin no //
analyzed: pha dang bu bzhin no //
translated: It is like a father and son.

original: rnal 'byor ni rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba'i ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba'i ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Yoga is the meaning of the clear light of the nature of self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they are the nature of the yoginīs.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not anything else.

original: de yang byis pa rnams la sdug bsngal ster bar byed de /
analyzed: de yang byis pa rnams la sdug bsngal ster bar byed de /
translated: Moreover, they give suffering to the childish.

original: rgyud dang bras bu dang bral ba'i phyir du 'bod la sogs par ltung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud dang bras bu dang bral ba'i phyir du 'bod la sogs par ltung ba'o //
translated: Because of being devoid of cause and effect, one falls into the hells and so forth.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is cause and what is effect?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni rgyu'o //
translated: The ten perfections such as generosity are the cause.

original: 'bras bu ni rang rig pa'i ye shes stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang rig pa'i ye shes stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The effect is the gnosis of self-awareness, characterized by the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: de ltar dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, those of pure nature are to be taught.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan nyid ni bcom ldan 'das ston pa po'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan nyid ni bcom ldan 'das ston pa po'o //
translated: The characteristic of the reflection is the Blessed One, the teacher.

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i chos //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i chos //
translated: Therefore, illusory phenomena

original: bden pa ma yin brdzun pa min //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin brdzun pa min //
translated: are neither true nor false.

original: brtan dang g-yo ba sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: brtan dang g-yo ba sna tshogs pa //
translated: The various things, animate and inanimate,

original: rang sems rgyu las 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: rang sems rgyu las 'byung ba yi //
translated: arise from the cause of one's own mind.

original: sgyu ma 'di ni mi shes pas //
analyzed: sgyu ma 'di ni mi shes pas //
translated: This illusion is not understood

original: 'gro ba drug ni nyid du 'khor //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug ni nyid du 'khor //
translated: by the ignorant, who wander in the six realms.

original: de bzhin sgyu ma gang rig pas /
analyzed: de bzhin sgyu ma gang rig pas /
translated: Likewise, by realizing the illusion

original: sangs rgyas 'gyur ro gzhan du min //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'gyur ro gzhan du min //
translated: one becomes a buddha, not otherwise.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug rnams kyi dbus su rdo rje snying po la gzigs te zhes pa la rdo rje ni dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug rnams kyi dbus su rdo rje snying po la gzigs te zhes pa la rdo rje ni dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Vajra is the wisdom of inseparability.

original: snying po ni de shes pa ste /
analyzed: snying po ni de shes pa ste /
translated: Essence is the knower of that,

original: rnam par shes zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes zhes pa'i don to //
translated: meaning consciousness.

original: yul dang yul can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni gzigs pa'o //
translated: Looking is the observation of object and subject, apprehended and apprehender, and so on.

original: de nyid sems can la gzigs pa'i snying rje'i dbang gis 'dzum pa mdzad pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems can la gzigs pa'i snying rje'i dbang gis 'dzum pa mdzad pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is the smile made by the power of compassion looking at sentient beings. It is called that.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu zhes pa ni 'dir chos bdag med pa la gnas pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nang du yang dag 'jog pas chos la dmigs pa mngon du byed pa ni 'dzum
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu zhes pa ni 'dir chos bdag med pa la gnas pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nang du yang dag 'jog pas chos la dmigs pa mngon du byed pa ni 'dzum
translated: Immediately after smiling means that here, the tathāgata, the arhat, the completely perfect buddha, endowed with abiding in the objective selflessness, manifests the observation of phenomena through correct meditative equipoise.

original: pa mdzad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa mdzad ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he smiles.

original: 'dir zhes pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ji srid du gang zag la bdag med pa la chags par mi byed pa de srid du skyes rabs sna tshogs pa rnams la yang sprul pa'i skus 'jug par mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ji srid du gang zag la bdag med pa la chags par mi byed pa de srid du skyes rabs sna tshogs pa rnams la yang sprul pa'i skus 'jug par mi 'gyur ro
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas, in order to benefit sentient beings, as long as they do not cling to the selflessness of persons, they do not enter into various life stories with the emanation body.

original: // de'i @100b phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gcig dang du ma'i lus kyi dbang gis gang zag la bdag med pa grub bo //
analyzed: // de'i @100b phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gcig dang du ma'i lus kyi dbang gis gang zag la bdag med pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the selflessness of persons is established by the power of the single and multiple bodies of the Tathāgatas.
