original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa med pa'i snying rjes kyang sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa med pa'i snying rjes kyang sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by the compassion that is without reference point, they teach the Dharma by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sna tshogs pa ni med do zhes pa'i tshig ni gsung rab kha cig las gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sna tshogs pa ni med do zhes pa'i tshig ni gsung rab kha cig las gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The Tathāgata is not manifold” is stated in some scriptures.🔽Thus:

original: de ltar / stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: de ltar / stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: The inseparability of emptiness and compassion

original: byang chub sems zhes brjod pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes brjod pa yin //
translated: is called the thought of awakening.

original: shes rab thabs dag ye shes ni //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dag ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom of method and wisdom

original: snying rje chen po zhes su gsungs //
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes su gsungs //
translated: is called “great compassion.”

original: rang gi stan las langs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi stan las langs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having risen from one’s seat, etc.

original: shes rab dang thabs dag gi rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dag gi rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: The yogi/nī of wisdom and means

original: rgyu rdo rje 'dzin gyi drung nas sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan bzhin nam /
analyzed: rgyu rdo rje 'dzin gyi drung nas sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan bzhin nam /
translated: arises from the presence of the causal Vajradhara, like an illusion or a reflection,

original: nam mkha' las skar ma bzhin langs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las skar ma bzhin langs pa'o //
translated: or like a star in the sky.

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas zhes pa la bla gos ni theg pa gsum las sngags kyi theg pa chen po gong mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas zhes pa la bla gos ni theg pa gsum las sngags kyi theg pa chen po gong mar gyur pa'o //
translated: Having thrown the upper robe over one shoulder, the upper robe is the Great Vehicle of Mantra, which is superior to the three vehicles.

original: de'i gzar ba ni de la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzar ba ni de la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Throwing it over is entering it.

original: dran pa yang rung gzar nas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dran pa yang rung gzar nas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply “having thrown” to “having remembered.”

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te zhes pa la /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te zhes pa la /
translated: Having placed the right knee on the ground,

original: pus mo g-yas pa ni dang po lam bstan pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa ni dang po lam bstan pa'i dus su'o //
translated: the right knee is the time of teaching the path at the beginning.

original: pus mo'i lha nga ni phyag rgya chen por 'gro ba la brtson pa'i sems so //
analyzed: pus mo'i lha nga ni phyag rgya chen por 'gro ba la brtson pa'i sems so //
translated: The knee is the mind striving to go to the great seal.

original: de nyid sa la btsugs pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi gzhi ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid sa la btsugs pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi gzhi ma rig pa yin te /
translated: The phrase he planted it in the ground means that ignorance is the ground of all phenomena.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because [the world] arises from that [ignorance].

original: sa la btsugs pa ni des bcom pas ro gcig par byed do //
analyzed: sa la btsugs pa ni des bcom pas ro gcig par byed do //
translated: The phrase planted in the ground means that [the world] is made of one taste by that [ignorance].

original: thal mo sbyor ba byas pa ni dngos po thams cad ro mnyam par rtogs pa'i sems de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyor ba byas pa ni dngos po thams cad ro mnyam par rtogs pa'i sems de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase he joined his palms means that the mind that realizes the equal taste of all things is called that [joined palms].

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni 'di ltar bstan te brag ca bzhin dmigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni 'di ltar bstan te brag ca bzhin dmigs pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase he said this to the Blessed One means that [the world] is an object of observation like an echo.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi gsang chen kha sbyor las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ye shes dbang phyug la nyan par 'tshal lo zhes pa ni 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi gsang chen kha sbyor las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ye shes dbang phyug la nyan par 'tshal lo zhes pa ni 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: The phrase I wish to hear the characteristics of the wisdom lord that arise from the great secret union, the nidāna of all tantras is stated here.

original: sngon gyi las dag pa'i stobs kyis bag chags kyi dbang gis gzung ba nyid ni nyan pa'o /
analyzed: sngon gyi las dag pa'i stobs kyis bag chags kyi dbang gis gzung ba nyid ni nyan pa'o /
translated: The phrase I wish to hear means that [the world] is apprehended by the power of traces through the power of pure previous karma.

original: sems can sna tshogs pa rnams la chos bstan pa 'dzin pa ni 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs pa rnams la chos bstan pa 'dzin pa ni 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The phrase I wish to hold the teaching of the Dharma for various sentient beings means [the world].

original: ye shes kyi dbang phyug ces pa la ye shes ni mngon par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang phyug ces pa la ye shes ni mngon par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The lord of intuition is the characteristic of the six superknowledges.

original: khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams la mngon par shes pa 'di rnams med pa'i phyir dbang phyug go //
analyzed: khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams la mngon par shes pa 'di rnams med pa'i phyir dbang phyug go //
translated: Since Vishnu, Ishvara, and so forth do not have these superknowledges, they are not lords.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs gcig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs gcig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why? Because they are not partial,

original: thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since they pervade everything.

original: @101a * // de'i phyir rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi gsang chen kha sbyor las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: @101a * // de'i phyir rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi gsang chen kha sbyor las byung ba'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, please explain the characteristic of the Great Secret Union, which is the nidana of all tantras.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung bstan te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung bstan te /
translated: That is the teaching of the Tathagata.

original: ae ma ho //
analyzed: ae ma ho //
translated: Amazing!

original: rdo rje snying po brtse ba chen po legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po brtse ba chen po legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The great compassion of the vajra essence is excellent, excellent!

original: 'dir sems can thams cad mi shes pa gsum gyis nyes pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal rnams kyis 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir sems can thams cad mi shes pa gsum gyis nyes pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal rnams kyis 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, all sentient beings revolve in cyclic existence due to the three non-virtues of karma, afflictions, and suffering.

original: sems can de rnams la sangs rgyas kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis brgya lam na skad cig thang cig tsam bsod nams bsags pa'i tshul gyis sems bskyed de bsod nams des sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de rnams la sangs rgyas kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis brgya lam na skad cig thang cig tsam bsod nams bsags pa'i tshul gyis sems bskyed de bsod nams des sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of the Buddha’s former aspirations, those sentient beings sometimes, for a moment, generate the thought of awakening by accumulating merit. By that merit, they become like the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: de nas 'phos nas slar yang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba lngar skye'o //
analyzed: de nas 'phos nas slar yang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba lngar skye'o //
translated: Then, after transmigrating, they are born again in the five types of transmigrators, such as humans.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis lta ba drug rnams la 'jug par byad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis lta ba drug rnams la 'jug par byad de /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the latent propensities of their former karma, they engage in the six views.

original: lta ba de rnams kyang dus kyi dbang gis sems can rang rang gi sems las byung ngo //
analyzed: lta ba de rnams kyang dus kyi dbang gis sems can rang rang gi sems las byung ngo //
translated: Those views also arise from the minds of individual sentient beings by the power of time.

original: de ltar lta ba po'i sems can sna tshogs pa grangs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba po'i sems can sna tshogs pa grangs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are countless varieties of sentient beings who are view-holders.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: In this way,

original: 'gro ba thams cad bdag las byung //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bdag las byung //
translated: all transmigrators arise from me.

original: srid pa gsum yang bdag las byung //
analyzed: srid pa gsum yang bdag las byung //
translated: The three existences also arise from me.

original: bdag gis 'di dag thams cad khyab //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag thams cad khyab //
translated: I pervade all of these.

original: bdag las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba med //🔽ces gsungs so //
translated: There are no transmigrators other than me.

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid dang de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyis rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyis mi shes pa gsum
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid dang de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyis rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyis mi shes pa gsum
translated: However, the bodhisattvas who are endowed with the nature of love, compassion, joy, and impartiality, and similarly with the qualities of generosity, ethics, and so forth, by means of their own purpose and the purpose of others,

original: ring du byed do //
analyzed: ring du byed do //
translated: they distance themselves from the three ignorances.

original: de 'ba' zhig byed par ma zad kyis mi 'dod bzhin du sku gsum mngon du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig byed par ma zad kyis mi 'dod bzhin du sku gsum mngon du byed pa'i don to //
translated: Not only that, they also manifest the three buddha bodies unwillingly.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ae ma ho zhes pa'i ngo mtshar dang / legs so zhes pa'i lan gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ae ma ho zhes pa'i ngo mtshar dang / legs so zhes pa'i lan gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān spoke two exclamations of Amazing! and Excellent!

original: gang gi phyir /🔽rig pa bde ba ster bar byed //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rig pa bde ba ster bar byed //
translated: For what reason?

original: ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the knowledge that bestows bliss.

original: yon tan gyi 'byung gnas zhes pa la /🔽yon tan rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na /
analyzed: yon tan gyi 'byung gnas zhes pa la / yon tan rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na /
translated: As for the source of qualities,

original: yon tan 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas so //
translated: it is the source of qualities because it is the source of qualities.

original: yon tan ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The qualities are fivefold:

original: de la sa'i yon tan lnga grangs bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la sa'i yon tan lnga grangs bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The five qualities of earth are, in order, the natures of earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de bzhin du chu'i yon tan bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i yon tan bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, the four qualities of water are

original: de yang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: the natures of water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de bzhin du @101b me'i khams kyi yon tan ni gsum ste me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du @101b me'i khams kyi yon tan ni gsum ste me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the three qualities of the fire constituent are the natures of fire, wind, and space.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi yon tan ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi yon tan ni gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, the two qualities of the wind constituent are

original: rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: the natures of wind and space.

original: de bzhin du stong pa'i khams kyi yon tan ni gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa'i khams kyi yon tan ni gcig ste /
translated: Similarly, the one quality of the space constituent is

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: the nature of space.

original: de bzhin du ye shes kyi khams thams cad kyi bdag nyid gcig pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa snod kyi 'jig rten du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes kyi khams thams cad kyi bdag nyid gcig pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa snod kyi 'jig rten du bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the one quality of the consciousness constituent, which is the nature of all the constituents, is taught as the world of the container.

original: de ltar 'gro ba lnga'i mi la sogs pa'i sems can rnams rim pa bzhin lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi yon tan gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba lnga'i mi la sogs pa'i sems can rnams rim pa bzhin lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi yon tan gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, sentient beings of the five types, humans and so on, become the nature of five, four, three, two, and one quality, respectively.

original: de yang gong du rdul phra rab kyi chos can brdzun par gnas so //
analyzed: de yang gong du rdul phra rab kyi chos can brdzun par gnas so //
translated: Moreover, the subject, the subtle particle, is false.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa la sogs pas bsgribs shing log pa'i chos la chags pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas gos pa rnams sngon bzhin bag chags kyi dbang gis 'gro ba sna tshogs pa rnams su 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa la sogs pas bsgribs shing log pa'i chos la chags pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas gos pa rnams sngon bzhin bag chags kyi dbang gis 'gro ba sna tshogs pa rnams su 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: However, those obscured by ignorance and so on, attached to false phenomena, and tainted by the faults of encountering nonvirtuous friends and so on, cycle in the various realms through the power of traces, as before.

original: / de bzhin du yang ye shes kyi khams khams drug gi bdag nyid skyes bu chen po'i gang zag 'di nyid dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid chos sku'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi bdag nyid
analyzed: / de bzhin du yang ye shes kyi khams khams drug gi bdag nyid skyes bu chen po'i gang zag 'di nyid dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid chos sku'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi bdag nyid
translated: Similarly, this person, the great being, the element of wisdom, the nature of the six elements, is the nature of all things, the nature of emptiness, the characteristic of the dharmakāya, the perfect limit, and suchness.

original: can gang la bsam pa 'di lta bu yod pa'am de'i rigs can no //
analyzed: can gang la bsam pa 'di lta bu yod pa'am de'i rigs can no //
translated: One who has such a thought, or who is of that type, is one who has such a thought.

original: de nyid kyis na legs so legs so zhes pa lan gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na legs so legs so zhes pa lan gnyis gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, Excellent! Excellent! is said twice.

original: 'di ni rdo rje snying po'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje snying po'i don bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching of the meaning of the vajra essence.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi gsang chen gang yin pa de dag thams cad nyan par 'dod pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi gsang chen gang yin pa de dag thams cad nyan par 'dod pa zhes pa la /
translated: Those who desire to hear all the great secrets of all the tantras are those who desire to hear all of them.

original: 'dod pa zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po'i byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po'i byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word desire is a causal verb of the vajra essence.

original: ae ma ho zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: ae ma ho zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with Amazing!

original: 'on kyang 'dir sngags kyi theg pa chen por rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma kha sbyor ba de ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang / rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir sngags kyi theg pa chen por rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma kha sbyor ba de ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang / rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud ces brjod do //
translated: However, here, the yoga and yoginī union in the Great Vehicle of Mantra is called yoga tantra and yoginī tantra.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the yoga tantra has the nature of the previously stated characteristics.

original: da ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi dbye ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi dbye ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, the division of the yoginī tantra is stated:

original: rgyud thams cad kyi gsang chen gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi gsang chen gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “the great secret of all tantras” is as follows.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi gsang ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi gsang ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud do //
translated: The secret of the thirty-six yogin tantras is the yoginī tantra.

original: rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug po de yang 'chad bzhin pa'i rtsa ba'i rnal 'byor ma bskyed pa rnam pa mang pos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug po de yang 'chad bzhin pa'i rtsa ba'i rnal 'byor ma bskyed pa rnam pa mang pos bshad par bya'o //
translated: Those thirty-six aspects are explained by the many aspects of the creation stage of the root yoginī tantra that is being explained.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud @102a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud @102a * //
translated: Thus, the yoginī tantra is the great secret hidden of all yogin tantras.

original: thams cad kyi gsang chen sbas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gsang chen sbas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “the great secret of all tantras.”

original: de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has this is called that.

original: gang yin pa de dag thams cad zhu ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud shes rab dang thabs dang stong pa dang / snying rje dbyer med pa rnams la zhu ba ste khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa de dag thams cad zhu ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud shes rab dang thabs dang stong pa dang / snying rje dbyer med pa rnams la zhu ba ste khong du chud pa'o //
translated: “ All of that” refers to the knowledge of the yogin and yoginī tantras, the indivisibility of wisdom and method, emptiness and compassion.

original: sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i lam ston pa'i 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i lam ston pa'i 'dod pa de ni /
translated: The desire to teach the true path to all sentient beings is

original: de ltar smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Tathāgata.

original: da ni 'khor ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'khor ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the words of cyclic existence are stated:

original: de nas rdo rje snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then the great bodhisattvas beginning with Vajra Essence, etc.

original: de nas zhes pa ni zhus pa'i rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni zhus pa'i rjes thogs su'o //
translated: There means immediately after the request.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gang dag gis dang po na yod pa de ni rdo rje snying po la sogs pa ye shes dang rnam par shes pa dag gcig tu 'dres pa'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gang dag gis dang po na yod pa de ni rdo rje snying po la sogs pa ye shes dang rnam par shes pa dag gcig tu 'dres pa'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: The great bodhisattvas are those who have the vajra body, etc. at the beginning. They are called Vajra Essence, etc., meaning the essence of the indivisible nature of the consciousnesses and wisdoms.

original: yang na sgyu ma'i sprul pa bzhin du gtso bo'o //
analyzed: yang na sgyu ma'i sprul pa bzhin du gtso bo'o //
translated: Or, like an illusory emanation, they are the principal ones.

original: de'i snying po ni dbyer med pa'i dngos po'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de'i snying po ni dbyer med pa'i dngos po'i phyir rdo rje'o //
translated: Their essence is vajra because of being the indivisible entity.

original: der khyad par gyi bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
analyzed: der khyad par gyi bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
translated: Those who arise from the power of special habitual tendencies there are the great bodhisattvas.

original: de nyid kyis na rab tu dga' zhing mig gdangs pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rab tu dga' zhing mig gdangs pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “with wide-open eyes” is that he is delighted and has the nature of the wisdom body.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan dang sha'i spyan dang ; lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan dang sha'i spyan dang ; lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: Thus, there are the eye of the tathāgatas, the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the eye of gnosis, and the eye of the buddhas.

original: de'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i mig gdangs kyi so so skye bo'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i mig gdangs kyi so so skye bo'i ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eyes are wide open with delight, but not so for ordinary beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhus zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhus zhes 'brel to //
translated: Thus, it is connected with “the great bodhisattva asked.”

original: yang dang yang du phyag byas te //
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyag byas te //
translated: He bowed again and again

original: 'dir rang gi the tshom gyi phyir zhus zhes pa'i rigs pas ye shes dang rnam shes gcig tu 'dres pa'i bdag nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi the tshom gyi phyir zhus zhes pa'i rigs pas ye shes dang rnam shes gcig tu 'dres pa'i bdag nyid du grub bo //
translated: Here, because of his own doubt, he asked. By the logic of “thus,” the nature of gnosis and consciousness is established as a single unity.

original: 'on kyang gang gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad de dgongs bshad gzhan gyi skal pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams nye bar spyod par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad de dgongs bshad gzhan gyi skal pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams nye bar spyod par 'gyur gyis /
translated: However, all the characteristics that were taught are for the sake of those fortunate sentient beings who are to be trained by the explanations of the implied meaning.

original: da lta'i gdul bya rnams la ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: da lta'i gdul bya rnams la ni ma yin no ;
translated: Not for the present disciples.

original: / gang gi spyir bstan bya dang ston byed dang bstan pa rnams la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gang gi spyir bstan bya dang ston byed dang bstan pa rnams la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the general teaching, the teacher, and the teaching would not occur.

analyzed: de'i tshe gdul bya dka' ba bems po'i sems can rnams 'dul bar mi 'gyur ro // rgyu des na sprul pa'i lus can dbyer med pa la nye bar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rab tu dgyes shing @102b mig gdangs la gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams kyis yang dang yang du phyag byas nas rang gi the tshom gyi phyir kha sbyor las
translated: At that time, the difficult to tame, dull-minded sentient beings would not be tamed.

original: byung ba'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid zhus te /
analyzed: byung ba'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid zhus te /
translated: For that reason, the great bodhisattva who enjoys the inseparable emanated body, with wide-open eyes, having repeatedly bowed like a reflection, for the sake of his own doubts, asked about the nature that arises from the union.

original: 'dir zhes pa ni tshig 'dir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni tshig 'dir gsungs pa'o //
translated: Here means spoken in this verse.

original: rgyud rnams thams cad gang la bgyi //
analyzed: rgyud rnams thams cad gang la bgyi //
translated: What is the cause of all tantras?

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to

original: der ni mtshan nyid ji lta bu ;
analyzed: der ni mtshan nyid ji lta bu ;
translated: What is the characteristic there?

original: / zhes pa'i bar ni zhes zhus pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: / zhes pa'i bar ni zhes zhus pa'i tshig go /
translated: These are the words of the request.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gyi tshig gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gyi tshig gsungs te /
translated: That is the Bhagavān’s reply.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Bhagavān” and so forth.

original: sdud pa po'i nyes pa yongs su spang pa'i don du gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdud pa po'i nyes pa yongs su spang pa'i don du gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is said for the purpose of abandoning the faults of the compiler.

original: rgyud kyang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdu ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgyud kyang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdu ba'i tshig go //
translated: “The tantra is also that” and so forth are the words of the summary.

original: yang thabs kyi sbra ni 'dus pa la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang thabs kyi sbra ni 'dus pa la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Further, the tent of method should be understood from the Guhyasamāja and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bya ba dang spyod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bya ba dang spyod pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words “and so forth” include the kriyā and caryā tantras.

original: 'dir bya ba ni de nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bya ba ni de nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the kriyā tantras are the Tattvasamgraha and so forth.

original: de bzhin du spyod pa ni sgrol ma byung ba dang / 'byung po 'dul byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyod pa ni sgrol ma byung ba dang / 'byung po 'dul byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the caryā tantras are the Tārā’s Origin, Bhūtaḍāmara and so forth.

original: 'di dag thams cad rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du nye bar btags pa'i mtshan nyid can du brjod de /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du nye bar btags pa'i mtshan nyid can du brjod de /
translated: All of these are described as having the characteristic of being designated as yoga tantras.

original: slob dpon rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyi'o //
translated: They are the masters’.

original: gleng gzhi ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pa'ang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi bar dus kyi rtsa sum cu rtsa drug gi snang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pa'ang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi bar dus kyi rtsa sum cu rtsa drug gi snang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The basis is the net of illusion and so forth, up to the thirty-six yoga tantras, which are the characteristics of the appearances of the thirty-six channels of time.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That is also threefold:

original: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du rten du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du rten du shes par bya'o //
translated: the appearance, the increase of appearance, and the culmination of appearance, which should be known as the basis in the yoga tantras.

original: 'od gsal brten par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal brten par shes par bya'o //
translated: The clear light should be known as the supported.

original: 'di ni sdud pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rim pa las bzlog pas 'od gsal ba ni rten no //🔽brten pa ni snang ba gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sdud pa'i mtshan nyid do // sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rim pa las bzlog pas 'od gsal ba ni rten no // brten pa ni snang ba gsum ste /

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The clear light is the basis of the buddhas, and the three appearances are the supported because they are the holders of the great illusion.

original: de ltar yang sgyu 'phrul dra bar bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang mkhas pa //🔽sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don 'grub par //
analyzed: de ltar yang sgyu 'phrul dra bar bcom ldan 'das kyis / sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang mkhas pa // sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don 'grub par //
translated: Thus, in the Net of Illusion, the Bhagavān says:🔽The one who holds the great illusion🔽accomplishes the meaning of the great illusion

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga' //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga' //
translated: with the joy of the great illusion.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can //
translated: The great magic show, the one with magical eyes,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: rgyud ces pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal du bying ba'i sems can rnams la skyob pas na rgyud do //
analyzed: rgyud ces pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal du bying ba'i sems can rnams la skyob pas na rgyud do //
translated: The tantra is the continuum, because it protects sentient beings who are sinking in the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyi gleng gzhi yang dag par spros pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyi gleng gzhi yang dag par spros pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The nidāna of those is the characteristic of the elaboration of the thirty-six yoginī tantras.

original: de las byung ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs sam rnal 'byor gyi tshogs so //🔽'di gnyis bsdus pa'i dbang gis brjod bya dang @103a * //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs sam rnal 'byor gyi tshogs so // 'di gnyis bsdus pa'i dbang gis brjod bya dang @103a * //
translated: That which arises from that is the assembly of yoginīs or the assembly of yogins.

original: rjod byed dang bral bar nges pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rjod byed dang bral bar nges pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By the power of the collection of those two, the meaning of “definite” is free from the expressed and the expresser.

original: yang sngon du gsungs pa'i dus la sogs pa ste de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni kha sbyor du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang sngon du gsungs pa'i dus la sogs pa ste de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni kha sbyor du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the previous time and so on are the nidāna of those, which is the union.

original: nges pa ni ma 'khrul ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni ma 'khrul ba'o //
translated: “Definite” is nonerroneous.

original: yang na kha sbyor las byung ba'i thig le sad pa la sogs pa bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa dang bral ba lhan cig skyes pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang na kha sbyor las byung ba'i thig le sad pa la sogs pa bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa dang bral ba lhan cig skyes pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Or else, it is the innate, which is free from the fourfold classification of the arousal of the bindu that arises from the union, and so on, and it is the characteristic of perfect enlightenment.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyu med pa //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyu med pa // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The primordial buddha is without cause.

original: nges par zhes pa ni gsungs shing bstan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges par zhes pa ni gsungs shing bstan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “certainly” means “is taught” and “is indicated.”

original: seng ge dang 'phrog byed ces pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: seng ge dang 'phrog byed ces pa la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to “lion,” “Rahu,” and so on,

original: 'dir lus la lam drug tu song ba'i rtsa drug go //
analyzed: 'dir lus la lam drug tu song ba'i rtsa drug go //
translated: here there are six nāḍīs that go to the six paths in the body.

original: de la lte ba'i steng du gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lte ba'i steng du gsum ste /
translated: Three of them are above the navel:

original: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
translated: lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti.

original: de bzhin 'og tu gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin 'og tu gsum ste /
translated: Three are below:

original: bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: the feces, urine, and semen.

original: 'di rnams kyi ming rnams rim pa las bzlog pas dbyig gi snying po ni bshang pa'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi ming rnams rim pa las bzlog pas dbyig gi snying po ni bshang pa'i rtsa'o //
translated: Their names are reversed: Śrīgarbha is the feces nāḍī.

original: 'dir seng ge ni khu ba'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: 'dir seng ge ni khu ba'i rtsa'o //
translated: Here the lion is the semen nāḍī.

original: 'phrog byed ni dri chu'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: 'phrog byed ni dri chu'i rtsa'o //
translated: Rahu is the urine nāḍī.

original: de bzhin du steng du ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan 'bab pa'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du steng du ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan 'bab pa'o /
translated: In the same way, above, the moon, sun, and Rāhu descend.

original: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid can dus kyi khyad par gyi dus kyi pho nya'am dus kyi rtsar brjod do //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid can dus kyi khyad par gyi dus kyi pho nya'am dus kyi rtsar brjod do //
translated: Moreover, they are messengers of time, or the nāḍīs of time, which are of the nature of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Mahāyāna.

original: 'di rnams las skad cig thang cig yud tsam gyi dbye bas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yul dang yul can gyi dbye bas rnam shes tshogs drug sems kyi 'phrul pa'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las skad cig thang cig yud tsam gyi dbye bas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yul dang yul can gyi dbye bas rnam shes tshogs drug sems kyi 'phrul pa'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: From those, the consciousnesses of the six intellects arise, such as the eye consciousness, and so on, by the divisions of instants, moments, and seconds, and the divisions of the sense organs and objects.

original: de las skyes nas rang rang gi las kyi dbang gis sems las byung ba'i dngos pos lta ba drug rnams 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de las skyes nas rang rang gi las kyi dbang gis sems las byung ba'i dngos pos lta ba drug rnams 'jug par byed do //
translated: After that, the six views arise from the mind through the power of one’s individual karma.

original: de ltar lta ba rnams kyi nang du chud pa ni sems can rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba rnams kyi nang du chud pa ni sems can rnams te /
translated: Thus, sentient beings are included within the views.

original: sems can gyi nang du chud pa yang lta ba rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ji srid grangs med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags dang / grangs med pa'i lus kyi rtsa rnams dang / grangs med pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi nang du chud pa yang lta ba rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ji srid grangs med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags dang / grangs med pa'i lus kyi rtsa rnams dang / grangs med pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The views and so forth of those who are included among sentient beings are the habitual tendencies of innumerable concepts, the innumerable channels of the body, and the innumerable yoginīs.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang chen zhes pa'i sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang chen zhes pa'i sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, because they are not the domain of those, the meaning of the great secret is the nature of the yoga and yoginī tantras of the Great Vehicle of mantra.

original: yang na gsang chen zhes pa ni sbas pa ste dus kyi pho nya rnams rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gsang chen zhes pa ni sbas pa ste dus kyi pho nya rnams rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Alternatively, the great secret is hidden, and because it pervades the messengers of time, it is the nature of the pervader.

original: gang skad cig bzhis mtshon pa yang dag pa'i lam ngag gi lam @103b las 'das pa'i spyod yul gnyis gnyis pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang skad cig bzhis mtshon pa yang dag pa'i lam ngag gi lam @103b las 'das pa'i spyod yul gnyis gnyis pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: That which is illustrated by the four moments is the true path, the domain that is beyond the domain of speech, free from all duality.

original: de'i phyir spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang ba ni mi slob pa'i lam zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang ba ni mi slob pa'i lam zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the term “secret” is the path of no more learning, because it is not the domain of those on the learner’s path.

original: da ni yang dag par sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor du byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni yang dag par sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor du byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the yoga of correct application is stated.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kha sbyor de nyid las byung ba zhes pa la kha sbyor zhes pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dngos po gcig tu byed pa dang / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid mi phyed pa dang / stong pa dang snying rje sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kha sbyor de nyid las byung ba zhes pa la kha sbyor zhes pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dngos po gcig tu byed pa dang / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid mi phyed pa dang / stong pa dang snying rje sbyor ba dang /
translated: The term “union” refers to the mind and mental factors becoming a single entity, the indivisibility of the outer and inner natures, the union of emptiness and compassion,

original: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba dang / spro ba dang bsdu ba sbyor ba dang / dpal he ru ka dang bdag med ma snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba rnam par 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba dang / spro ba dang bsdu ba sbyor ba dang / dpal he ru ka dang bdag med ma snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba rnam par 'dres pa dang /
translated: the union of the vajra and lotus, the union of emanation and reabsorption, the union of glorious Heruka and Nairātmya, the characteristic of union, the mixing of passion and passionlessness,🔽and the union of the two truths.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po dbyer med pa dang / skyes ma dang skyes pa'i gzugs gnyis med pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa mi phyed pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid gnyis su med pa ni kha sbyor gyi don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po dbyer med pa dang / skyes ma dang skyes pa'i gzugs gnyis med pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa mi phyed pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid gnyis su med pa ni kha sbyor gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of union is the inseparability of the things of cyclic existence and nirvana, the nonduality of the forms of women and men, the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate, the pristine wisdom that is naturally radiant, and the nonduality of the nature of cause and result.

original: de ltar gzhan yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ma gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the nondual pristine wisdom, consciousness, and so forth, and the nature of wisdom and method are not taught here,

original: gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because of fear of verbosity.

original: / de'i phyir bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa rnam par bcom pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lam yang skye'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa rnam par bcom pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lam yang skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the path of the inconceivable also arises through the force of the wisdom of hearing, contemplation, and meditation in the sequence of the guru's lineage, by destroying the exhalation and inhalation.

original: de yang thig le zhes brjod de dpral bar thig le gzung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang thig le zhes brjod de dpral bar thig le gzung ba bzhin no //
translated: That is also called a drop, like a drop held on the forehead.

original: de ltar yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
translated: Thus, in the Shri-Guhyasamaja🔽it is said by the Lord:

original: dngos po med pa sgom pa'i dngos //
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgom pa'i dngos //
translated: The reality of meditation is the reality of the non-existent.

original: bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba bsgom pa min //
translated: The object of meditation is not meditation.

original: de ltar dngos po dngos med pas //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dngos med pas //
translated: Thus, because of the reality of the non-existent,

original: bsgom pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgom pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: meditation does not become an object.

original: de'i phyir kha sbyor ni snyoms par 'jug pas zhes pa'i don ston pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha sbyor ni snyoms par 'jug pas zhes pa'i don ston pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word “union” indicates the state of meditative equipoise.

original: slar yang 'di'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang 'di'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Again, in order to clarify the meaning of this, it is said:

original: kha sbyor zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba dbyer med pa'i nye bar spyod pa la 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: kha sbyor zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba dbyer med pa'i nye bar spyod pa la 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The union is the state of meditative equipoise in the enjoyment of the union of the noble ones, which is the indivisible union of the Dharma and the enjoyment body.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba rtogs @104a * //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba rtogs @104a * //
translated: The realization of the supreme immutable

original: pa ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: is the meaning of the innate.

original: de yang 'phags pa rnams kyi brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa rnams kyi brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of what is to be expressed by the noble ones.

original: slar yang 'byung ba ni skyes pa zhes pa la mchog tu mi 'gyur bas bsgrub pa'i rang rig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: slar yang 'byung ba ni skyes pa zhes pa la mchog tu mi 'gyur bas bsgrub pa'i rang rig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Again, arising is the self-awareness wisdom that is accomplished by the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de las byung ba ni sna tshogs pa stong pa nyid kyi sku snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni sna tshogs pa stong pa nyid kyi sku snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That which arises from that is the kāya of the emptiness of variety, the nature of nonappearance.

original: de'i skyes pa de ni ma dang pha yang dag par sbyor bas dang sngon gyi skye po'i bag chags kyi dbang gis sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i rgyur 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de'i skyes pa de ni ma dang pha yang dag par sbyor bas dang sngon gyi skye po'i bag chags kyi dbang gis sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i rgyur 'jug par byed do //
translated: That arising of that [wisdom] is engaged as the cause of liberating all sentient beings by the power of the latent tendencies of previous births and the union of the pure father and mother.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: That itself is the characteristic of the Bhagavān’s nirmāṇakāya.

original: de yang mtshon bya dang mtshon byed kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mtshon bya dang mtshon byed kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Moreover, that is the nature of the object of demonstration and the demonstrator.

original: 'dir de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dir de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here, “such” and so on are as follows.

original: de lta bu zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i don te /
analyzed: de lta bu zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i don te /
translated: “ Such” means “similar.”

original: snga ma'i tshig gces pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i tshig gces pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: It is also a word for “former.”

original: gyur pa zhes pa ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gyur pa zhes pa ni skyes pa'o //
translated: “ Become” means “arisen.”

original: de ci zhe na brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de ci zhe na brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ces gsungs te /
translated: What is that? It is said to be the nature of the entities of the animate and inanimate.

original: brtan pa ni snod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni snod la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inanimate is the vessel, etc.

original: g-yo ba ni mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The animate is the human, etc.

original: de rnams skyes pa de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams skyes pa de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The nature of those that are born is the nature of the Bhagavān Vajradhara.

original: de yang bskyed bya dang skyed byed rjes su mthun par yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bskyed bya dang skyed byed rjes su mthun par yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he is the one who is perfectly situated in accordance with the one who is to be generated and the one who generates.

original: 'dis mtshon pas na mtshan nyid des zhes pa ni bdun pa'i don la gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon pas na mtshan nyid des zhes pa ni bdun pa'i don la gsum pa'o //
translated: Since he is indicated by this, it is said to be the characteristic. The seventh case is the third.

original: mtshon bya dang mtshon byed rnams la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi sku bzhugs pa 'dis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon bya dang mtshon byed rnams la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi sku bzhugs pa 'dis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The one who is to be indicated and the one who indicates are situated in the body of the Bhagavān Vajradhara. This should be understood.

original: yang na mtshon pas zhes pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas sangs rgyas rnams gus pa dang bcas pas rgyun mi 'chad par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pas khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par nye bar spyod pa'i tshul ni mtshan nyid
analyzed: yang na mtshon pas zhes pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas sangs rgyas rnams gus pa dang bcas pas rgyun mi 'chad par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pas khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par nye bar spyod pa'i tshul ni mtshan nyid
translated: Or else, “by the symbol” means by the practice of the supreme unchanging bliss, the Buddhas, with devotion, continuously cultivate calm abiding and insight, and thereby perfectly enjoy the sentient beings of the three realms.🔽This is the characteristic of the symbol.

original: do // de ltar dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshon bya dang mtshon byed dag gis yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir skad cig ma cig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: do // de ltar dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshon bya dang mtshon byed dag gis yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir skad cig ma cig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshon pa'o //
translated: Thus, in order to teach the correct path by the symbolized and the symbolizing of the Tathagatas dwelling in the three times, the characteristic of the instantaneous perfect enlightenment is the symbol.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyur nye bar btags pa'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyur nye bar btags pa'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because the effect is figuratively designated as the cause, the characteristic of the focus on sentient beings is the expression.

original: de ltar gzhung nye bar btags pa'i tshig ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhung nye bar btags pa'i tshig ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: Thus, the text figuratively designated is the connection.

original: da ni phyogs gzhan gyi dgos pa brjod de /
analyzed: da ni phyogs gzhan gyi dgos pa brjod de /
translated: Now, the purpose of the other side is stated.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Or else, etc.

original: yang na @104b zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i lam rtogs par bya ba dang / da ltar gyi sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na @104b zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i lam rtogs par bya ba dang / da ltar gyi sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, the word “or” is for the sake of understanding the path that was previously taught and for teaching the true path to sentient beings of the present.

original: rgyud ces pa'i sgra ni skyes par brjod do //
analyzed: rgyud ces pa'i sgra ni skyes par brjod do //
translated: The word “tantra” is said to be “birth.”

original: de bzhin du rgyud can gyi bud med du brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud can gyi bud med du brjod do //
translated: Likewise, a woman with a tantra is said to be a woman.

original: thams cad ces pa ni bud med dang skyes pa dag gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa ni bud med dang skyes pa dag gcig pa nyid do //
translated: “ All” means that women and men are the same.

original: de ltar bud med dang skyes pa dag ni kha sbyor gyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bud med dang skyes pa dag ni kha sbyor gyi sgras bstan to //
translated: Thus, women and men are taught by the word “union.”

original: de'i gleng gzhi zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i gleng gzhi zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'o //
translated: “ Its nidāna” is great bliss.

original: de yang 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Moreover, it is Vajrasattva, whose nature is the five great elements.

original: rdo rje yang yin la sems dpa' yang yin pas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin la sems dpa' yang yin pas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Since he is a vajra and a hero, he is Vajrasattva.

original: de las byung ba ni sems can thams cad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni sems can thams cad ces pa'i don to //
translated: “ From that” means “from all sentient beings.”

original: 'on kyang mi shes pa'i dri mas bsgribs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi shes pa'i dri mas bsgribs par 'gyur te /
translated: However, they are obscured by the stain of ignorance.

original: de yang skyes pa dang bud med dang / lang tshom dang nu ma dang skar dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ming du ma'o //
analyzed: de yang skyes pa dang bud med dang / lang tshom dang nu ma dang skar dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ming du ma'o //
translated: Moreover, it is a multitude of names, such as man, woman, youth, breast, star, etc.

original: gang gi phyir bsam du med pa la sogs pa las bsam pa'i chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam du med pa la sogs pa las bsam pa'i chos 'byung ste /
translated: Because the Dharma of reflection arises from the Dharma of meditation, etc.,🔽it should be understood as being like a river and the ocean.

original: chu bo dang rgya mtsho bzhin du rtogs par bya'o /'on kyang chu'i zla ba bzhin du mtshon par bya bzhin pa rnams sangs rgyas rnams las mi 'byung gis sems can rnams 'ba' zhig las de 'byung ba'i phyir rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas
analyzed: chu bo dang rgya mtsho bzhin du rtogs par bya'o /'on kyang chu'i zla ba bzhin du mtshon par bya bzhin pa rnams sangs rgyas rnams las mi 'byung gis sems can rnams 'ba' zhig las de 'byung ba'i phyir rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas
translated: However, since the Buddhas do not arise from the elements, but from sentient beings alone, the Buddhas arise from one's own mental propensities.

original: bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: One sees the Blessed Buddhas.🔽One hears the teaching in various languages, and one attains nirvana.

original: skad sna tshogs kyis bstan pa nyan pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar byed de skar ma 'phro ba bzhin gang nas byung ba de nyid du song zhes ma gsungs kyang de bzhin gshegs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skad sna tshogs kyis bstan pa nyan pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar byed de skar ma 'phro ba bzhin gang nas byung ba de nyid du song zhes ma gsungs kyang de bzhin gshegs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Although it is not said that one goes to where one came from, like a shooting star, one should see the Tathagata.

original: 'di ni sems kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi ming ngo //
translated: This is the name of the mind.

original: da ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi tha snyad kyi phyir ming gsungs @109a * //
analyzed: da ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi tha snyad kyi phyir ming gsungs @109a * //
translated: Now, for the sake of the conventions of mental factors, the names are stated.

original: pa ; yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: pa ; yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then and so forth.

original: de nas zhes pa ni sems can gyi ming gi rjes su'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni sems can gyi ming gi rjes su'o //
translated: After the name of sentient beings.

original: yang na phyogs gzhan no //
analyzed: yang na phyogs gzhan no //
translated: Or, another position.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi kha sbyor gyi sgras zhes pa /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi kha sbyor gyi sgras zhes pa /
translated: The nidana of all tantras is the sound of union.

original: thams cad ni gang sngon du bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ni gang sngon du bstan pa rnams so //
translated: All is what was previously taught.

original: rgyud ni 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud ni 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Tantra is the collection and so forth.

original: gleng gzhi zhes pa ni dang po ni rnal 'byor gyi lugs bstan te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi zhes pa ni dang po ni rnal 'byor gyi lugs bstan te /
translated: The nidana is the first, teaching the yoga system.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: kha sbyor zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kha sbyor zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be union.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi chos stong pa dang / snying rje dbyer med cing gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi chos stong pa dang / snying rje dbyer med cing gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The dharma of the nature of wisdom and method is emptiness and compassion inseparable and nondual.

original: sgras zhes pa ni rgyud sna tshogs pa'i lung rnams kyis de'i don tshig tu brjod pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgras zhes pa ni rgyud sna tshogs pa'i lung rnams kyis de'i don tshig tu brjod pas bstan pa'o //
translated: Sound is the expression of that meaning in words by various tantra scriptures.

original: rdo rje sems dpar brjod ces pa ni chos de nyid sems can gang dang gang gis rjes su dran pa dang / nyan pa dang / 'chad pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa de dang / de ni rdo rje sems dpar brjod par 'dir som nyid med do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar brjod ces pa ni chos de nyid sems can gang dang gang gis rjes su dran pa dang / nyan pa dang / 'chad pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa de dang / de ni rdo rje sems dpar brjod par 'dir som nyid med do //
translated: It is called Vajrasattva means that this very Dharma is called Vajrasattva, without any doubt here, for whatever sentient beings recollect it, listen to it, explain it, read it, and meditate on it.

original: de yang sems las byung pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de yang sems las byung pa'i chos so //
translated: Moreover, it is a mental phenomenon.

original: slar yang sku gsum du rnam par gzhag par sems can rnams la ston to //
analyzed: slar yang sku gsum du rnam par gzhag par sems can rnams la ston to //
translated: Again, it is taught to sentient beings as being established as the three bodies.

original: gang gi phyir yang zhes pa ni phyogs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang zhes pa ni phyogs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And again means because of the connection with another section.

original: 'on kyang thams cad ces pa ni thams cad rnams kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dus rnams so //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad ces pa ni thams cad rnams kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dus rnams so //
translated: However, all means all of them, throughout beginningless and endless time.

original: rgyud ces pa ni chos rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: rgyud ces pa ni chos rnam par gnas te /
translated: The tantra is the abiding of phenomena.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mtshan yang dag par brjod pa la sogs pa rnams bstan nas yang nub po //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mtshan yang dag par brjod pa la sogs pa rnams bstan nas yang nub po //
translated: In the past, future, and present, the buddhas have taught the perfection of wisdom, the recitation of the names, and so forth, and then disappeared.

original: de'i gleng gzhi zhes pa ni gdod nas mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gleng gzhi zhes pa ni gdod nas mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nidana is so called because it is primordially fearless.

original: kha sbyor zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyi sbyor ba mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: kha sbyor zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyi sbyor ba mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The union is fearless in the application of wisdom and means.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzung ba'o //
translated: Because it is held by all the buddhas.

original: de yang sgras brjod do //
analyzed: de yang sgras brjod do //
translated: That is also expressed by the word.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The vajra is the indivisible gnosis.

original: de'i nye bar spyod pa'i tshul ni sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar spyod pa'i tshul ni sems dpa'o //
translated: The way of its enjoyment is the sattva.

original: yang na rdo rje zhes pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje zhes pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: Alternatively, the vajra is compassion.

original: de'i 'byung gnas ni stong pa nyid de //
analyzed: de'i 'byung gnas ni stong pa nyid de //
translated: The source of that is emptiness.

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the characteristic endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pas na rdo rje sems dpar brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pas na rdo rje sems dpar brjod de /
translated: Therefore, because it pervades, it is called vajrasattva.

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Here, however, it is the Lord's.

original: yang na aa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na aa zhes pa ni /
translated: Or else, the letter A

analyzed: snang ba med las rnam kun 'byung //
translated: is the source of all things from non-appearance.

analyzed: zhes so // de nas chos thams cad gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa'i sgo'o zhes gsungs @109b pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dzra zhes pa ni /

original: sa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sa zhes pa ni /

analyzed: yang dag pa yi bla ma yi //

original: tva zhes pa ni khyod chos kyis //
analyzed: tva zhes pa ni khyod chos kyis //

original: bi zhes pa ni mngon par snod //
analyzed: bi zhes pa ni mngon par snod //

original: dh'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dh'i zhes pa ni /

analyzed: blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' rnams //

original: ya zhes pa ni gang gi phyir //
analyzed: ya zhes pa ni gang gi phyir //

original: te zhes pa ni de rnams bstan pa 'di la 'grub //🔽de'i phyir khyod kyang da ltar ni //
analyzed: te zhes pa ni de rnams bstan pa 'di la 'grub // de'i phyir khyod kyang da ltar ni //
translated: The syllable te is the accomplishment of those in this teaching.🔽Therefore, you should have no doubt

original: 'grub par 'gyur bar som nyi med //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur bar som nyi med //
translated: that you will be accomplished now.

original: da ni 'di'am da lta'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas lam gyi man ngag brjod de /
analyzed: da ni 'di'am da lta'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas lam gyi man ngag brjod de /
translated: Now, following the teaching for these, i.e., present, sentient beings, the esoteric instructions of the path are stated.

original: gsang chen zhes bya 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsang chen zhes pa ni sbas pa ste /
analyzed: gsang chen zhes bya 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsang chen zhes pa ni sbas pa ste /
translated: By this, which is called great secret, etc. The great secret is the hidden.

original: rgyu'i rgyud de chos kyi sku dang / 'bras bu'i phyir ye shes kyi sku zhes pa'i don to zhes pa 'dis zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dis so //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud de chos kyi sku dang / 'bras bu'i phyir ye shes kyi sku zhes pa'i don to zhes pa 'dis zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dis so //
translated: The causal continuum, the dharma-body, and the resultant wisdom-body, the meaning of by this is by this cause and effect.

original: man ngag can gis zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i bla mas lung rgyas pa'i tshul las de 'di'i don bstan to //🔽sngags btu ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: man ngag can gis zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i bla mas lung rgyas pa'i tshul las de 'di'i don bstan to // sngags btu ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The one who has the esoteric instructions is the true guru, and the meaning of this is taught by him from the manner of the extensive transmission.

original: dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid ces pa'i bar du ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid ces pa'i bar du ni go sla'o //
translated: The mantra extraction, etc., up to the characteristics of the consecration are easy to understand.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the concise teaching.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni las tshogs la sogs pa dang sgrub thabs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni las tshogs la sogs pa dang sgrub thabs gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the collection of rites, etc., and the means of achievement.

original: man ngag gis zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam sa dab dang rmi lam dang nyal ba dang bzhi ba dang bral ba @110a * //
analyzed: man ngag gis zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam sa dab dang rmi lam dang nyal ba dang bzhi ba dang bral ba @110a * //
translated: The instruction is the path of the Tathagata, free from the four: the stage, the dream, sleep, and the fourth.

original: 'chad bzhin pa las bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad bzhin pa las bshad par bya'o //
translated: It will be explained in the course to be expounded.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ces pa ni de ltar gsungs pa'i tshig nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ces pa ni de ltar gsungs pa'i tshig nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar ram /
translated: The essence of wisdom and means is the text beginning with thus have I heard up to the end.

original: gleng gzhi ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyud dang stong pa dang / snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi chos so //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyud dang stong pa dang / snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi chos so //
translated: The nidana is the Dharma of the essence of wisdom and means, the essence of emptiness and compassion, and the tantra.

original: rgyud ces pa ni thabs te /
analyzed: rgyud ces pa ni thabs te /
translated: The tantra is the means.

original: 'dir gzhung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung gi tshogs so //
translated: Here it is the collection of texts.

original: de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs sbyor ba nyid ni kha sbyor zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs sbyor ba nyid ni kha sbyor zhes brjod de /
translated: Similarly, the union of wisdom and means is called union,

original: thabs kyi rgyud ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud ces pa'i don to //
translated: meaning the means tantra.

original: de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbrul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbrul pa'i sku'o //
translated: And that is the emanation body of the Buddhas.

original: de ni bdag gis bshad kyis zhes pa ni bdag sh'akya thub pas kha sbyor gyi rgyud de bshad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis bshad kyis zhes pa ni bdag sh'akya thub pas kha sbyor gyi rgyud de bshad ces pa'i don to //
translated: I will explain means that I, Shakyamuni, will explain the tantra of union.

original: nyon zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag gis sbrul pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams gzhug pa'i phyir nyon zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag gis sbrul pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams gzhug pa'i phyir nyon zhes gsungs te /
translated: The word listen is spoken for the sake of engaging future sentient beings in the characteristics of the emanations of the bodhisattvas, such as Vajra Essence.

original: tshig 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This word is the definitive statement of the Tathagata.

original: de ni dang po stong pa nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams la stong pa'i byang chub bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni dang po stong pa nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams la stong pa'i byang chub bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach sentient beings the emptiness of enlightenment through the door of the initial teaching of emptiness,🔽it is said:

original: dang po stong pa nyid bsams pas //
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid bsams pas //
translated: First, thinking of emptiness,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'dir sems can thams cad 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos 'khor bar bcings te /
analyzed: 'dir sems can thams cad 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos 'khor bar bcings te /
translated: Here, all sentient beings are bound in samsara by the six consciousnesses that engage and by the entities of percepts and perceivers.

analyzed: gzugs khams zhes bya stong pa ste //

analyzed: gzugs khams zhes pa ni dang po'i don la grub pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang dri dang ro dang re bya dang yid kyi khams rnams kyang stong par bya ba ste /

analyzed: @110b gsol ba gdab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan gyi tshig gi tshul gyis so //

analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa ni rnam pa gang gis 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: 'gro ba zhes pa ni gzhan du 'gro ba la 'jug pa'o //
