translated: The mind of conceptual thought goes to the path of its own desire, etc.

original: bsam zhes pa ni sems las byung ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam zhes pa ni sems las byung ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: “Thinking” means that it becomes a mental factor.

original: rtog pa zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyis lta ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyis lta ba ste /
translated: “Conceptual thought” means that its nature is view,

original: de'i sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de'i sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: because it is under the power of its previous latent propensities.

original: rang 'dod la sogs zhes pa ni rang nyid kyi las kyi rjes su 'brangs pas so //
analyzed: rang 'dod la sogs zhes pa ni rang nyid kyi las kyi rjes su 'brangs pas so //
translated: “Its own desire, etc.” means that it follows its own karma.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyis gang byas pa'i las des 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyis gang byas pa'i las des 'gro ba'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the sense bases such as the eyes. It goes by the karma that it has created.

original: lam zhes pa ni lam der bgrod par @113b bya ba yin pas na de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lam zhes pa ni lam der bgrod par @113b bya ba yin pas na de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Path” means that it is to be traversed on that path.

original: yang na ye shes kyis zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: yang na ye shes kyis zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Or, “by consciousness” means by the consciousness of the store-consciousness.

original: shes bya ba lta zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shes bya ba lta zhes pa ni /
translated: “By the objects of consciousness” means

original: gang phyi rol sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams la mig la sogs pas blta ba'o //
analyzed: gang phyi rol sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams la mig la sogs pas blta ba'o //
translated: by the forms of external objects such as blue, yellow, etc., which are seen by the eye, etc.

original: shes bya rnams kyis zhes pa ni dngos po mtha' dag pa de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: shes bya rnams kyis zhes pa ni dngos po mtha' dag pa de rnams kyi'o //
translated: “By all objects of consciousness” means by all those things.

original: 'gro ba zhes pa ni de rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes pa ni de rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: “By the world” means by the store-consciousness entering into them.

original: lta ba zhes pa ni lha'i dbang po'i sgo nas lta bas khyab par byed pa khams gsum mthong ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba zhes pa ni lha'i dbang po'i sgo nas lta bas khyab par byed pa khams gsum mthong ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “By seeing” means by seeing the three worlds pervaded by the eye of the Lord.

original: de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis sems las byung ba'i dngos por brjod de bag chags mang po'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis sems las byung ba'i dngos por brjod de bag chags mang po'i dbang gis so //
translated: Moreover, it is said to be a mental state with a nature that is both one and many, because of the influence of many habitual tendencies.

original: 'gro ba ni de'i bgrod pa ste dngos po so so tha dad pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni de'i bgrod pa ste dngos po so so tha dad pa mthong ba'o //
translated: “By the world” means by its movement, by the seeing of the individual things.

original: de'i phyir rang gi 'dod pas rang rang gi las dang rjes su mthun pas lam la 'jug cing lam la sogs pa la bgrod de de la brten zhes zhen pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi 'dod pas rang rang gi las dang rjes su mthun pas lam la 'jug cing lam la sogs pa la bgrod de de la brten zhes zhen pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, by one's own desire, one enters the path in accordance with one's own karma, and having traversed the path, etc., one relies on that. The meaning is: one is attached.

original: de ltar dge ba'i las can bden pa gnyis la brten pa dge ba'i grogs bzang po dang phrad pa'i dbang gis 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i las can bden pa gnyis la brten pa dge ba'i grogs bzang po dang phrad pa'i dbang gis 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, one who has virtuous karma is accomplished by the power of meeting with good virtuous friends who rely on the two truths.

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i nang du 'ga' zhig dge ba'i dbang gis 'grub pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i nang du 'ga' zhig dge ba'i dbang gis 'grub pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that some are accomplished by the power of virtue among those previously mentioned.

original: 'on kyang 'chad bzhin pa'i tshul gyis bar bar du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'chad bzhin pa'i tshul gyis bar bar du bshad par bya'o //
translated: However, it should be explained from time to time in the manner that is being explained.

original: da ni sngon du gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi lus kyi rim las byang chub sems kyi sgom pa'i thabs kyi de kho na nyid brjod de /
analyzed: da ni sngon du gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi lus kyi rim las byang chub sems kyi sgom pa'i thabs kyi de kho na nyid brjod de /
translated: Now, from the sequence of the body of emptiness that was previously mentioned, the reality of the method of cultivating bodhicitta is described.

original: ye shes lnga zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ye shes lnga zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: The five pristine consciousnesses and so on.

original: 'dir ye shes lnga'i dngos po de nyid ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga 'am khams lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dir ye shes lnga'i dngos po de nyid ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga 'am khams lnga'o //
translated: Here, the reality of the five pristine consciousnesses refers to the five tathagatas or the five elements.

original: de yang srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga rnams so //
analyzed: de yang srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga rnams so //
translated: The five winds are the life-force wind, and so on.

original: de kho na nyid ces pa ni h'um ye shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces pa ni h'um ye shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The reality is the syllable hūṃ, the aggregate of pristine awareness.

original: yungs kar sbom po'i tshad tsam ste //
analyzed: yungs kar sbom po'i tshad tsam ste //
translated: The size of a mustard seed

original: zhes pa ni 'dir ma gsungs kyang gtum mo'i sbyor bar brjod de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir ma gsungs kyang gtum mo'i sbyor bar brjod de /
translated: is not mentioned here, but is taught in the practice of fierce woman.

original: 'dir lte ba 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pas sprul pa'i 'khor lo kha dog ser po'o //
analyzed: 'dir lte ba 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pas sprul pa'i 'khor lo kha dog ser po'o //
translated: Here, the emanation wheel is at the navel, with sixty-four spokes and a yellow color.

original: de'i dbus kyi lte bar aa 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte bar aa 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin 'phro ba'o //
translated: In its center is the syllable aṃ, the nature of five-colored light rays.

original: snying gar 'dab ma brgyad pa chos kyi 'khor lo kha dog sngon po 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: snying gar 'dab ma brgyad pa chos kyi 'khor lo kha dog sngon po 'phro ba'o //
translated: The dharma wheel is at the heart, with eight spokes and a blue color.

original: de'i lte bar h'um kha dog sngon po kha 'og tu blta ba'o //
analyzed: de'i lte bar h'um kha dog sngon po kha 'og tu blta ba'o //
translated: In its center is the syllable hūṃ, blue in color and facing downward.

original: de bzhin du mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug pa kha dog dmar po 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug pa kha dog dmar po 'phro ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the enjoyment wheel is at the throat, with sixteen spokes and a red color.

original: de'i dbus kyi lte bar aom mdog dmar po kha steng du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte bar aom mdog dmar po kha steng du bltas pa'o //
translated: In its center is the syllable oṃ, red in color and facing upward.

original: spyi bor bde ba chen po'i 'khor @114a * //
analyzed: spyi bor bde ba chen po'i 'khor @114a * //
translated: The great bliss wheel is at the crown, with thirty-two spokes and a white color.

original: lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa kha dog dkar po 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa kha dog dkar po 'phro ba'o //
translated: The leaves radiate white light and number thirty-two.

original: de'i dbus kyi lte bar mi shigs pa zla ba'i 'od 'phro ba kha 'og tu bltas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte bar mi shigs pa zla ba'i 'od 'phro ba kha 'og tu bltas pa'o //
translated: In the center of that is the indestructible moon, radiating light, facing downward.

original: spyi gtsug tu nam mkha'i 'khor lo 'dab ma lnga pa ljang gu'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu nam mkha'i 'khor lo 'dab ma lnga pa ljang gu'o //
translated: At the crown of the head is the green celestial wheel with five spokes.

original: de'i dbus kyi lte bar kham gi sa bon ljang sngon no //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte bar kham gi sa bon ljang sngon no //
translated: In the center of that is the green seed syllable kṣa.

original: de bzhin du gsang bar ye shes kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang bar ye shes kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, at the secret place is the multicolored gnosis wheel with thirty-two spokes.

original: de'i dbus su ho dkar po dang dmar por snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su ho dkar po dang dmar por snang ba'o //
translated: In the center of that is the white and red syllable ho.

original: de ltar 'khor lo drug la rim pa bzhin rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / 'od dpag med dang / don yod grub pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo drug la rim pa bzhin rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / 'od dpag med dang / don yod grub pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Thus, the six wheels are, in order, Vairocana, Akṣobhya, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, Ratnasambhava, and Vajrasattva.

original: de bzhin du khams kyi dbye bas spyan ma dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang / bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams kyi dbye bas spyan ma dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang / bdag med ma'o //
translated: Likewise, by the division of the elements, they are Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Tārā, Vajradhātvīśvarī, and Nairātmya.

original: de rnams kyi dbus su rtsa gsum te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus su rtsa gsum te /
translated: In the middle of those, there are three nāḍīs.

original: la la n'a dang / ra sa n'a dang / aa wa dh'u t'i rnams so //
analyzed: la la n'a dang / ra sa n'a dang / aa wa dh'u t'i rnams so //
translated: They are the lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti.

original: de'i phyir yungs kar zhes pa ni 'khor lo lnga'i nang du chud pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yungs kar zhes pa ni 'khor lo lnga'i nang du chud pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Therefore, “mustard seed” refers to the three nāḍīs, which are the nature of body, speech, and mind, contained within the five cakras.

original: de'i nang nas kyang byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i nang nas kyang byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ste /
translated: And from among those, the dripping of bodhicitta is called the avadhūti,

original: sems kyi gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the form of mind.🔽As it is said:

original: gang phyir chos rnams thams cad la //
analyzed: gang phyir chos rnams thams cad la //
translated: Because all phenomena

original: sems kyis khyab par byed pa'i phyir //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyis khyab par byed pa'i phyir // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are pervaded by mind.

original: de ltar yi ge gsum gyi nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yi ge gsum gyi nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to explain the etymology of the three syllables,

original: yungs kar zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yungs kar zhes gsungs te /
translated: “mustard seed” is stated.

original: sarsha ba zhes pa'i yi ge dbus ma phyi ba'i phyir sarba zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sarsha ba zhes pa'i yi ge dbus ma phyi ba'i phyir sarba zhes 'brel to //
translated: The middle letter of sarva is erased, so it is connected with sarva.

original: de ltar sarba bstir zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sarba bstir zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is said to be sarva-bhas.

original: sbom po zhes pa ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams la khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbom po zhes pa ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams la khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: The word thick means pervading the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: tshad tsam zhes pa ni aa tsam mo //
analyzed: tshad tsam zhes pa ni aa tsam mo //
translated: The word measure means just a.

original: ci phyir aa'i gug skyed tsam zhe na /
analyzed: ci phyir aa'i gug skyed tsam zhe na /
translated: Why is it just the shape of a?

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:🔽A is the best of all letters,

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don che nyi ge dam pa ste /
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don che nyi ge dam pa ste /
translated: the great meaning, the supreme syllable,

original: srog chen po ni skye ba med //
analyzed: srog chen po ni skye ba med //
translated: the great life, unborn,

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: free from verbal expression.

original: de bzhin dursha zhes pa ni chags pa chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin dursha zhes pa ni chags pa chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, ṛṣa means the nature of great passion,

original: harsha zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi rnam pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: harsha zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi rnam pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: and harṣa means the nature of innate joy, the aspect of the relative.

original: gsang ba zhes pa ni 'khor lo lnga po rnams kyi bar bar du khyab par byed pa nyid kyis na gsang ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa ni 'khor lo lnga po rnams kyi bar bar du khyab par byed pa nyid kyis na gsang ba ste /
translated: Secret means secret by pervading the intervals between the five wheels.

original: sbas pa zhes pa'i @114b don to //
analyzed: sbas pa zhes pa'i @114b don to //
translated: The meaning of hidden is the meaning of secret.

original: de'i phyir ye shes kyi 'khor lo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes kyi 'khor lo zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the wheel of wisdom.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam par gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam par gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is said to be both conventional and ultimate.

original: de bzhin du 'dir don dam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir don dam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, here, in order to teach the ultimate,

original: de'i dbus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: it is said, “In its center,” and so forth.

original: de'i zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i bde ba chen po'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i bde ba chen po'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: Its means the previously mentioned great bliss in the center.

original: de ci zhe na /🔽lha zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ci zhe na / lha zhes pa ste /
translated: What is that?

original: snang ba med pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The deity is nonappearing wisdom, naturally luminous.

original: mi gsal gsal ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: mi gsal gsal ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: The nature of clarity is unclear.

original: zhes pa ni de nyid ye shes chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid ye shes chen po ste /
translated: That is the great wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid dbang po'i sgo rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa de'i phyir mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid dbang po'i sgo rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa de'i phyir mi gsal ba'o //
translated: Because it is not the domain of the sense faculties, which have the characteristic of fully awakening in a single instant of the buddhas, it is therefore unclear.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir gsal ba ste /
translated: Because it is its very nature, it is clear.

original: des na de'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na de'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it means “its nature.”

original: gug skyed phyed pa mchog phra ba //
analyzed: gug skyed phyed pa mchog phra ba //
translated: The half-vowel is the supreme subtlety,

original: thig le'i gzugs can yid lta bu //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thig le'i gzugs can yid lta bu // zhes pa ni /
translated: having the form of a drop, like the mind.

original: 'dir kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is because the relative and the ultimate are inseparable.

original: gug skyed phyed pa zhes pa bsgom pa rtogs pas mthong ba'i rnam pa tsam gyi sgra zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gug skyed phyed pa zhes pa bsgom pa rtogs pas mthong ba'i rnam pa tsam gyi sgra zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The half-vowel is the mere aspect of the seen through the realization of the meditation.

original: phul du byung bas na mchog go //
analyzed: phul du byung bas na mchog go //
translated: The meaning of the word is supreme because it is the best.

original: phra ba zhes pa ni dmigs pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: phra ba zhes pa ni dmigs pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Subtle means free from reference points.

original: thig le zhes pa ni yi ge lta bu'o //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa ni yi ge lta bu'o //
translated: Drop means like a syllable.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'dzag pa'i phyir yi ge ste rtsa'i khong stong nas steng du 'gro ba'i phyir 'dzag pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i pha rol tu son pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'dzag pa'i phyir yi ge ste rtsa'i khong stong nas steng du 'gro ba'i phyir 'dzag pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i pha rol tu son pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is a syllable because it does not drip, i.e., because it moves upward in the hollow of the channel. It is said to be the one who has gone beyond the nectar of the dripping intuition.

original: rtag tu snying gi dbus na gnas //
analyzed: rtag tu snying gi dbus na gnas //
translated: It always abides in the middle of the heart.

original: gzi byin chen po'i 'od bzhi ldan //🔽zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzi byin chen po'i 'od bzhi ldan // zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: It has the four lights of great splendor.

original: 'dir snying zhes pa ni snying po'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir snying zhes pa ni snying po'i don to //
translated: Here, “heart” means “essence.”

original: 'on kyang dbus ma aa wa dh'u t'i la brten pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbus ma aa wa dh'u t'i la brten pa'i sems so //
translated: However, it is the mind based on the central channel, the avadhūtī.

original: de yang dbang po dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang bral ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is free from the sense organs,

original: sgo dgu 'gog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgo dgu 'gog pa'i phyir /
translated: because it stops the nine doors.

original: de'i phyir spyi gtsug la sogs pa las 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le de'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi gtsug la sogs pa las 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le de'i dbus su'o //
translated: Therefore, it is in the middle of the drop of bodhicitta that comes from the crown of the head, etc.

original: rtag tu gnas zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: “Always abides” means the body of truth.

original: de'i gzi brjid chen po ni chos thams cad snang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gzi brjid chen po ni chos thams cad snang ba ste /
translated: Its “great splendor” is the illumination of all things.

original: ye shes dang shes bya dag gcig cing stong pa dang snying rje gnyis me dpa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang shes bya dag gcig cing stong pa dang snying rje gnyis me dpa'o //
translated: It is the unity of intuition and the knowable, and the nonduality of emptiness and compassion.

original: de bzhin du 'od ldan zhes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od ldan zhes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: Likewise, the one called “luminous” is the enjoyment body.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin bsam gtan bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin bsam gtan bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the four meditative stabilizations, love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: yang na snang ba bzhi'i bdag nyid de /🔽de yang snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob @115a * //
analyzed: yang na snang ba bzhi'i bdag nyid de / de yang snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob @115a * //
translated: Or else, it is the nature of the four illuminations.

original: pa dang 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: pa dang 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: They are the illumination, the great illumination, the supreme illumination, and the universal illumination.

original: de ni 'od zer bzhi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni 'od zer bzhi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the four light rays.

original: bcu gnyis mtha' dang dgu yi mtha' //
analyzed: bcu gnyis mtha' dang dgu yi mtha' //
translated: The end of twelve and the end of nine🔽from the feet up to the head.

original: rkang pa nas ni spyi mthar thug / ces pa ni 'dir sngon du gsungs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin dbugs te /
analyzed: rkang pa nas ni spyi mthar thug / ces pa ni 'dir sngon du gsungs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin dbugs te /
translated: Here, the breath is the nature of the five pristine awarenesses that were previously mentioned.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor lnga'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu rgyu pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor lnga'i rang bzhin gyis rab tu rgyu pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that it moves by the nature of the five maṇḍalas.

original: 'dir g-yon dang g-yas kyis na'i bu ga dag las spro ba dang sdud pa'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor lnga lnga rgyu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir g-yon dang g-yas kyis na'i bu ga dag las spro ba dang sdud pa'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor lnga lnga rgyu bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the five maṇḍalas move by the division of exhalation and inhalation through the left and right nostrils.

original: g-yon nas nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon nas nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: on the left, space, etc.

original: de bzhin du g-yas nas sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas nas sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, on the right, earth, etc.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bcu rgyu ba'i rim pas srog gi rlung du brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bcu rgyu ba'i rim pas srog gi rlung du brjod de /
translated: Thus, the life-force wind is described as the movement of the ten mandalas.

original: de yang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: And that is the nature of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: de ltar yang 'dus pa phyi ma las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dus pa phyi ma las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān says in the Later Guhyasamāja:

original: ye shes lan gyi rang bzhin dbugs //
analyzed: ye shes lan gyi rang bzhin dbugs //
translated: The breath has the nature of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: yungs kar sngom po'i tshad tsam ste //🔽sna yi rtse mor nan tan du //
analyzed: yungs kar sngom po'i tshad tsam ste // sna yi rtse mor nan tan du //
translated: The size of a mustard seed,🔽the yogi/nī should always meditate

original: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu bsgom //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu bsgom // zhes gsungs so //
translated: with awareness on the tip of the nose.

original: de nyid 'chad bzhin pa las bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'chad bzhin pa las bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in the commentary.

original: de bzhin du 'dir bcu gnyis mtha' zhes pa ni 'dir dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa'i sbyor ba dag las gang gi phyir 'gro ba'i srog de ni sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad tsam du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir bcu gnyis mtha' zhes pa ni 'dir dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa'i sbyor ba dag las gang gi phyir 'gro ba'i srog de ni sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad tsam du 'byung ngo //
translated: Similarly, here “the end of twelve” means that the life-force that moves out in the union of exhalation and inhalation occurs for twelve finger lengths.

original: dgu'i mtha' zhes pa ni srog de nyid 'jug pa'i lam nas sor gsum mi tshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgu'i mtha' zhes pa ni srog de nyid 'jug pa'i lam nas sor gsum mi tshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The end of nine is when that life-force is incomplete by three finger-widths in the path of entry.🔽From the feet up to the crown of the head is the bow shape, which is half of the coil.

original: rkang pa nas ni spyi mthar thug / ces pa ni spyi gtsug nas mthe bo'i bar du bla ma'i man gnag gi tshul gyis gzhu'i rnam pa lta bu ni gug skyed phyed pa'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir brtan pa las ni khyab par byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa nas ni spyi mthar thug / ces pa ni spyi gtsug nas mthe bo'i bar du bla ma'i man gnag gi tshul gyis gzhu'i rnam pa lta bu ni gug skyed phyed pa'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir brtan pa las ni khyab par byed do //
translated: Since it is said that the stable [wind] pervades,

original: de'i phyir 'gog par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gog par brjod do //
translated: therefore it is called the obstruction.

original: yang na mgrin pa nas dpral ba dang mgo bo'i mtshams kyi mthar thug pa ni phyi'o //
analyzed: yang na mgrin pa nas dpral ba dang mgo bo'i mtshams kyi mthar thug pa ni phyi'o //
translated: Or, from the throat up to the forehead and the end of the head is the outside.

original: nang du de tsam du srog 'gro ba'i phyir bcu gnyis kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: nang du de tsam du srog 'gro ba'i phyir bcu gnyis kyi mtha'o //
translated: Since the life-force moves that much on the inside, it is the end of twelve.

original: slar la de nyid smin ma'i dbus nas mgrin pa'i mthar thug par 'ong ba de ni dgu'i mtha'o //
analyzed: slar la de nyid smin ma'i dbus nas mgrin pa'i mthar thug par 'ong ba de ni dgu'i mtha'o //
translated: Again, that [wind] coming from the middle of the eyebrows up to the throat is the end of nine.

original: de bzhin du yang gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying ga'i 'khor lo rnams su sngon du gsungs pa'i rigs pas rnal 'byor gyi lam la dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pas thun tshod kyis dus kyi khyad par gyis sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying ga'i 'khor lo rnams su sngon du gsungs pa'i rigs pas rnal 'byor gyi lam la dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pas thun tshod kyis dus kyi khyad par gyis sam /
translated: Likewise, in the wheel of the secret place, navel, and heart, the yogi who delights in the path of yoga should meditate on the four joys by the distinctions of the time of the periods.🔽

original: yang na rgyun mi 'chad par goms par bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dang dgu'i mtha' nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyun mi 'chad par goms par bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dang dgu'i mtha' nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in the cakras of the secret place, navel, and heart, the yogi/nī who delights in the path of yoga should practice for a period of time, either by the distinctions of the periods of the day, or else without break, as indicated by the end of twelve or nine.

original: de'i phyir ji skad du gsungs pa de la de @115b skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du gsungs pa de la de @115b skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called that, as it was said.

original: 'khor lo 'di rnams kyi bsgom pa'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di rnams kyi bsgom pa'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special meditation of these cakras is stated:

original: stsal ma gcig ni yang dag 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽cha lnga pa yi tshad dang ldan //
analyzed: stsal ma gcig ni yang dag 'byung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / cha lnga pa yi tshad dang ldan //
translated: The single nāḍī arises perfectly.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir sngon du gsung pa'i ha'i gdan au'i ming can na //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir sngon du gsung pa'i ha'i gdan au'i ming can na //
translated: Here, the five-part measure is endowed with the seat of the haṃ, which is called the “au seat.”

original: 'on kyang klu dbang rnam par rab rgyas pa ;
analyzed: 'on kyang klu dbang rnam par rab rgyas pa ;
translated: However, the nāḍī of the powerful nāgas is fully expanded.

original: / zhes pa lte ba'i sting du khung du 'khyil pa'i rnam pa skor phyed dang bzhi'i bdag nyid de'i snal ma gcig yang dag par byung zhing spyi gtsug gi mthar thug par song ba'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa lte ba'i sting du khung du 'khyil pa'i rnam pa skor phyed dang bzhi'i bdag nyid de'i snal ma gcig yang dag par byung zhing spyi gtsug gi mthar thug par song ba'o //
translated: The navel is the place of the navel. Coiled is the form of a coil. Half-circle is the nature of half a circle. One thread is the one thread that arises from that. Extending to the crown of the head is the thread that reaches the crown of the head.

original: de yang gtum mo zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de yang gtum mo zhes brjod de /
translated: That is also called candālī.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽lte bar gtum mo sbar ba yis //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / lte bar gtum mo sbar ba yis //
translated: Because

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing //
translated: the five tathāgatas are burned🔽by the fire of candālī at the navel,

original: spyan ma la sogs pa ni bsregs //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa ni bsregs //
translated: and Locanā, and so on, are burned,

original: bsregs pas ri bong can ham 'dzag / ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bsregs pas ri bong can ham 'dzag / ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: the rabbit-holder [moon] drips haṃ.

original: cha de yang ni phyed nas su //🔽rdo rje dbus su nges par byung //
analyzed: cha de yang ni phyed nas su // rdo rje dbus su nges par byung //
translated: That part is also half,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: and the vajra definitely arises in the middle.

original: klu dbang las byung ba snal ma gcig po de mi shigs pa rdo rje sems dpa' la 'khyud cing ro gcig par byas pa bum pa gang ba bzhin bdud rtsi'i rgyun 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: klu dbang las byung ba snal ma gcig po de mi shigs pa rdo rje sems dpa' la 'khyud cing ro gcig par byas pa bum pa gang ba bzhin bdud rtsi'i rgyun 'dzag pa'o //
translated: The single thread that arises from the nāga lord embraces Akṣobhya Vajrasattva and becomes of one taste, dripping a stream of amṛta like a full vase.

original: de'i phyir yang 'ongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'ongs te /
translated: Again, it comes

original: gang gi phyir dz'a landha ra'i sgo ru song nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dz'a landha ra'i sgo ru song nas /
translated: Because, having gone to the door of Jalandhara,

original: ao dyan gyi sgor yang 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: ao dyan gyi sgor yang 'ong ba'o //
translated: it also comes to the door of Oddiyana.

original: de'i phyir dbyer med cing gcig tu 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyer med cing gcig tu 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it becomes inseparable and mixed into one.

original: rdo rje'i dbus su zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbus su zhes pa ni /
translated: In the middle of the vajra means

original: de bzhin du aa wa dh'u t'i'i dbus su rtsa gnyis byung ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid khong stong gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du aa wa dh'u t'i'i dbus su rtsa gnyis byung ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid khong stong gnyis te /
translated: that, likewise, because the two channels arise in the middle of the avadhūti, there are two voids, which are the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de ltar aa wa dh'u t'i'i steng dang 'og tu 'bab pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar aa wa dh'u t'i'i steng dang 'og tu 'bab pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two that fall above and below the avadhūti.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is called the vajra.

original: gang gi phyir sems rdo rje rdo rje der song nas rdo rje de las kyang 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems rdo rje rdo rje der song nas rdo rje de las kyang 'ong ba'o //
translated: Because the mind vajra goes to that vajra and also comes from that vajra.

original: de bzhin du dbus su nges par byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbus su nges par byung ste /
translated: Likewise, it definitely arises in the middle.

original: zhig nas slar yang snying rje chen po'i dbang gis rang rig pa skye'o //
analyzed: zhig nas slar yang snying rje chen po'i dbang gis rang rig pa skye'o //
translated: Having dissolved, again, by the power of great compassion, it is self-knowing.

original: phyag rgya chen po bde ba'i dbang gis dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes brjod de /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bde ba'i dbang gis dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes brjod de /
translated: By the power of the bliss of the great seal, it is called the pledge seal.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i khyad par can zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i khyad par can zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is special to the Enjoyment Body.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dus pa'i dus des chos thams cad 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dus pa'i dus des chos thams cad 'dus pa'o //
translated: Just as the time of the assembly of all Buddhas is the assembly of all dharmas.

original: dam tshig dang chos 'di dag phyag rgya snyoms par 'jug pa de ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig dang chos 'di dag phyag rgya snyoms par 'jug pa de ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: These pledges and dharmas are the pledge seal of that meditative absorption of the seal.

original: 'di dag gi rab kyi mthar thug pa'i phyag rgya chen po thob pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rab kyi mthar thug pa'i phyag rgya chen po thob pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
translated: The one who attains the great seal that is the culmination of these is called Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rdo rje mi phyed ces gsungs pa /🔽srid gsum @116a * //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed ces gsungs pa / srid gsum @116a * //
translated: Vajra is said to be indivisible,

original: gcig pa sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa sems dpa'o //
translated: the hero is the one reality of the three existences.

original: shes rab rig pa 'di yi ni //
analyzed: shes rab rig pa 'di yi ni //
translated: This knowledge wisdom

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes su brjod //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes su brjod //
translated: is called Vajrasattva.

original: ces so // sa bon skye gnas dbus su gnas //
analyzed: ces so // sa bon skye gnas dbus su gnas //
translated: The seed is located in the middle of the birthplace.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du sngon du gsungs pa ni ao rgyan gyi sgo las kyang 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le skye gnas dbus su gnas pa zhes pa lte ba'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du sngon du gsungs pa ni ao rgyan gyi sgo las kyang 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le skye gnas dbus su gnas pa zhes pa lte ba'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: Just as previously stated, the bindu of bodhicitta that comes from the door of Oḍḍiyāna is located in the middle of the birthplace, that is, located in the middle of the navel.

original: sa bon zhes pa ni ji ltar dngul chu gsad pa dang gzags pa'i rim pas gsad pa dang 'dzag pa las byed de brgya stong phrag du ma dang ji srid grangs med par 'byed do //
analyzed: sa bon zhes pa ni ji ltar dngul chu gsad pa dang gzags pa'i rim pas gsad pa dang 'dzag pa las byed de brgya stong phrag du ma dang ji srid grangs med par 'byed do //
translated: The seed is like quicksilver, which is killed and flows in the process of killing and flowing, dividing into many hundreds of thousands and so on up to countless [parts].

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rdzogs pa'i rim pas sa bon gyi gzugs su gnas pa ni ye shes chen po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rdzogs pa'i rim pas sa bon gyi gzugs su gnas pa ni ye shes chen po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Likewise, here also, the seed that exists in the form of the stage of completion is called “great gnosis.”

original: de chos kyi dbyings su zhu bar byas shing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la thim par gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de chos kyi dbyings su zhu bar byas shing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la thim par gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That dissolves into the dharmadhātu and dissolves into the all-base consciousness.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa zad par nges par gsungs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa zad par nges par gsungs pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that obscurations such as ignorance are definitely exhausted.

original: de ltar dngul chu bzhin kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsad cing de bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang / de bzhin du las kyi dbang po drug dang de'i bya ba drug kyang bsad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar dngul chu bzhin kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsad cing de bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang / de bzhin du las kyi dbang po drug dang de'i bya ba drug kyang bsad ces pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, like mercury, the foundation consciousness is killed. Likewise, the twelve sense-spheres of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres are killed. Likewise, the six sense faculties and their six actions are killed.

original: 'dis ni rang dbang thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang dbang thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This means that one becomes a Tathagata who has attained independence.

original: rang dbang thob pa de ni gang dang gang du 'gro 'dod pa de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang thob pa de ni gang dang gang du 'gro 'dod pa de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: One who has attained independence goes wherever one wishes to go, and not otherwise.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: de yi rim gyis 'pho bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi rim gyis 'pho bar 'gyur //
translated: one gradually moves through them.

original: zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas ye shes kyi dbang gis sgo dgu nas gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas ye shes kyi dbang gis sgo dgu nas gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar byed de /
translated: One who abides in samadhi moves through them wherever one wishes through the power of wisdom, through the nine doors.

original: de yang mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi sgo nas 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi sgo nas 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one goes through the doors of the sense-spheres of the eyes and so forth.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar sgra brnyan dang sna tshogs nor bu bzhin sngon gyi dngos pos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar sgra brnyan dang sna tshogs nor bu bzhin sngon gyi dngos pos so //
translated: However, it is like an echo and a variegated jewel, through a previous entity.

original: thams cad du zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyis so //
translated: “Everywhere” means in every way.

original: tshangs pa'i me ni 'di de bzhin //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i me ni 'di de bzhin //
translated: The fire of Brahmā is just like that.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: Here,

original: me zhes pa ni chags pa chen po'o //
analyzed: me zhes pa ni chags pa chen po'o //
translated: “fire” is great passion.

original: des ni tshangs pa zhes pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: des ni tshangs pa zhes pa ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: “Brahmā” is the Buddha.

original: 'di zhes pa ni rang gi gnas kyi sems rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin zhes pa ni mchog gi go 'phang rtogs pa'i phyir tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni rang gi gnas kyi sems rtogs pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin zhes pa ni mchog gi go 'phang rtogs pa'i phyir tshangs pa'am /
translated: “This” is one’s own place, because of the realization of the mind.

original: rang bzhin gyis sdud pa'i phyir me ste gtum mo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdud pa'i phyir me ste gtum mo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Just like that” is the realization of the supreme state, or Brahmā, because of the natural gathering, which is the meaning of “fire” and “Caṇḍālī.”

original: yang na me zhes pa ni dus me ste dbang po thams cad sreg @116b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na me zhes pa ni dus me ste dbang po thams cad sreg @116b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, “fire” is the fire of time, because it burns all the senses.

original: de'i phyir tshangs pa 'di ni bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshangs pa 'di ni bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this Brahmā is the knowledge of the reality of no-self.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'chad bzhin pa'i sgo'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'chad bzhin pa'i sgo'i dbye ba las so //
translated: The Tathāgata is from the division of the door that is being explained.

original: 'dir sgo'i dbye bas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir sgo'i dbye bas gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the division of the door is stated:

original: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The earth, and so on.

original: 'dir sgo dgu rnams la bu ga bcu drug nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir sgo dgu rnams la bu ga bcu drug nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the nine doors become sixteen holes.

original: 'di rnams la dgu ni gsal lo //
analyzed: 'di rnams la dgu ni gsal lo //
translated: These are the nine clear [vowels].

original: de bzhin du bdun ni mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdun ni mi gsal ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the seven [vowels] are unclear.

original: de yang rim pa bzhin mgrin pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du dpung pa'i rtsa ba dag dang / snying ga dang / lce'i rtsi bdag dang / de bzhin du khu ba'i bu ga'o //
analyzed: de yang rim pa bzhin mgrin pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du dpung pa'i rtsa ba dag dang / snying ga dang / lce'i rtsi bdag dang / de bzhin du khu ba'i bu ga'o //
translated: They are, in order, the two throats, the two roots of the arms, the heart, the root of the tongue, and similarly, the urethra.

original: 'di rnams kyis dgag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams brjod do //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis dgag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams brjod do //
translated: In order to block these, the naturally existing seed syllables are stated.

original: de las yi sa bon gnyis //
analyzed: de las yi sa bon gnyis //
translated: From that, the two seed syllables of ya.

original: zhes pa ni spyir la l'a'i sa bon gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyir la l'a'i sa bon gnyis so //
translated: The two seed syllables of la la are in general.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi sa bon ya y'a'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi sa bon ya y'a'o //
translated: Similarly, the seed syllables of ya ra la va are of wind.

original: nam mkha'i ha h'a'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ha h'a'o //
translated: The seed syllables of ha ha are of space.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni me'i sa bon ra r'a'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni me'i sa bon ra r'a'o //
translated: The seed syllables of ra ra are of fire.

original: bdud rtsi'i ksham ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i ksham ngo //
translated: The seed syllable of kṣaṃ is of nectar.

original: chu'i ni bam mo //
analyzed: chu'i ni bam mo //
translated: The seed syllable of vaṃ is of water.

original: 'phyang ba dag gi au a'u'o //🔽glo ba'i hu h'u'o //🔽snying gi gong bu'i h'u'o //
analyzed: 'phyang ba dag gi au a'u'o // glo ba'i hu h'u'o // snying gi gong bu'i h'u'o //
translated: The seed syllables of au and ū are of the hanging [vowels].🔽The seed syllables of hu and hū are of the lungs.

original: 'khyil ba can gyi aa a'a'o //
analyzed: 'khyil ba can gyi aa a'a'o //
translated: The seed syllable of hū is of the heart lump.🔽The seed syllables of a and ā are of the coiled one.

original: nges pa'i tshig can gyi yi ge gsungs pa /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig can gyi yi ge gsungs pa /
translated: The syllables with etymologies are stated.

original: aa ai ri au li zhes pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: aa ai ri au li zhes pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: are of space and so on.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: aa ku ha kam tsheg drag mgrin pa can //
analyzed: aa ku ha kam tsheg drag mgrin pa can //
translated: A, ku, ha, ka, with visarga, and throat,

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid do //
translated: are of the nature of space.🔽I, cu, ya, sha, with palate,

original: ai tsu ya sha rkan can zhes pa ni rlung gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ai tsu ya sha rkan can zhes pa ni rlung gi bdag nyid do //
translated: are of the nature of wind.🔽Ri, tu, ra, sha, with fire, and head,

original: ri tu ra sha me ste spyi bo can zhes pa ni me'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ri tu ra sha me ste spyi bo can zhes pa ni me'i bdag nyid do //
translated: are of the nature of fire.🔽U, pu, va, pa, with lips,

original: au pu wa pa mchu can zhes pa ni chu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: au pu wa pa mchu can zhes pa ni chu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: are of the nature of water.

original: li tu la sa so can sa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: li tu la sa so can sa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: Li, ti, la, sa, with teeth, are of the nature of earth.🔽 Thus it is by reasoning.

original: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the seed syllables of earth and so on are stated.🔽Li, la, i, ai, i, u, u,

original: li l'i ai a'i aam aa: ri r'i wa wa a'u dhri dhr''i hum h'um dum aam aa:o //
analyzed: li l'i ai a'i aam aa: ri r'i wa wa a'u dhri dhr''i hum h'um dum aam aa:o //
translated: Ri, ri, wa, wa, au, dhrī, dhrī, huṃ, hūṃ, duṃ, aṃ, aḥ, o.

original: yang na 'jigs ma dang gtum mo dang drag mo la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams gzhan du go sla ba nyid kyi phyir ma bris so //
analyzed: yang na 'jigs ma dang gtum mo dang drag mo la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams gzhan du go sla ba nyid kyi phyir ma bris so //
translated: Or else, the seed syllables of Bhima, Caṇḍī, Rudrā, and so on, are not written elsewhere because they are easy to understand.

original: de ltar 'di rnams kyi sa bon rnams bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di rnams kyi sa bon rnams bsam par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the seed syllables of these should be imagined.

original: rim pa bzhin nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin nges par bzung ste /
translated: and the others in order.

original: bsam zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should think I am the essence of all the Buddhas.

original: de ltar sa bon de rnams la srog dang thur sel 'gog pas dbang po thams cad dang mig la sogs pa yang thim par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa bon de rnams la srog dang thur sel 'gog pas dbang po thams cad dang mig la sogs pa yang thim par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by stopping the life and downward winds in those seeds, one should dissolve all the sense organs, the eyes and so forth.

original: bdud rtsi zhes pa ni gsang ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi zhes pa ni gsang ba'o //
translated: The nectar is the secret place.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dri chen dang dri chu'i bu ga dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dri chen dang dri chu'i bu ga dag gzung ngo //
translated: The word and so forth includes the anus and the urethra.

original: dbang phyug gtso @117a * //🔽zhes pa ni bsrub cing bsrub pa'i sbyor bas lce gnyis dang rkan gnyis kyi bdag nyid bde ba ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug gtso @117a * // zhes pa ni bsrub cing bsrub pa'i sbyor bas lce gnyis dang rkan gnyis kyi bdag nyid bde ba ste /
translated: The lord is the supreme lord.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of lord of the world is the bliss of the two tongues and the two palates by the yoga of churning and being churned.

original: mgrin par zhes pa ni lce chung gnyis so //
analyzed: mgrin par zhes pa ni lce chung gnyis so //
translated: The meaning of throat is the two uvulae.

original: dpung par zhes pa ni dpung pa'i bu ga'i rtsa ba nas mchan khung gi lam du song zhing glo ba'i mthar thug par song ba'o //
analyzed: dpung par zhes pa ni dpung pa'i bu ga'i rtsa ba nas mchan khung gi lam du song zhing glo ba'i mthar thug par song ba'o //
translated: The meaning of arm is the path of the armpit, which goes from the root of the armhole to the end of the lungs.

original: snying ga'i phyogs su skyong ba zhes pa ni padma'i rtsa ba'i snal ma lta bu'i rtsa des mdud pas mdud pa thams cad du khyab pa ste /
analyzed: snying ga'i phyogs su skyong ba zhes pa ni padma'i rtsa ba'i snal ma lta bu'i rtsa des mdud pas mdud pa thams cad du khyab pa ste /
translated: “Sustained in the region of the heart” means that this channel, like the root of a lotus, pervades all the knots.

original: mgo bo dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i sor mo rnams su yang khyab pa'i don to //
analyzed: mgo bo dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i sor mo rnams su yang khyab pa'i don to //
translated: It also pervades the fingers of the head, arms, and legs.

original: phyugs zhes pa ni 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyugs zhes pa ni 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: “Cattle” is explained here:

original: gang du skyes pa'i phyugs thams cad //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa'i phyugs thams cad //
translated: All cattle born

original: khu ba ltung ba'i rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: khu ba ltung ba'i rgyu yis ni //
translated: from the cause of the fall of semen

original: gsang ba'i gnas su 'di gsal te //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas su 'di gsal te //
translated: are clear in the secret place,

original: rang nyid sems ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang nyid sems ni med par 'gyur //
translated: and their own minds are absent.

original: gang gi phyir pha dang ma yang dag par sbyor bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig brgyal brgyal ba de'i phyir don med par byed pa de'i phyir phyugs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha dang ma yang dag par sbyor bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig brgyal brgyal ba de'i phyir don med par byed pa de'i phyir phyugs zhes brjod do //
translated: Because the father and mother are united, the alaya consciousness and the six consciousnesses are all lost. Therefore, because they are rendered useless, they are called “cattle.”

original: de bzhin du khu ba dang bu ga'i gnas de dag gsad pa 'dir chags pa dang bral ba skyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du khu ba dang bu ga'i gnas de dag gsad pa 'dir chags pa dang bral ba skyes pa'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the killing of those places of semen and the holes is the meaning of “arousing freedom from attachment.”

original: lte ba'i rtsa bar zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lte ba'i rtsa bar zhes pa ni /
translated: “At the root of the navel” means

original: gsang ba dang lte ba dag tu gzur ba'i phyir gnyis gnyis dang bral ba'i sbyor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang ba dang lte ba dag tu gzur ba'i phyir gnyis gnyis dang bral ba'i sbyor ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is bent at the secret place and the navel, the union free of the two is generated.

original: yan lag brgyad kyi zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i yan lag brgyad kyi sa bon rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad kyi zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i yan lag brgyad kyi sa bon rnams so //
translated: The eight branches are the seeds of the eight branches mentioned previously.

original: yan lag ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams so //
translated: The branches are the sense bases such as the eyes.

original: de'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa dang dbang po'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa dang dbang po'o //
translated: Their seeds are the consciousnesses and the faculties.

original: de'i 'gog pa ni cho gas yan lag brgyad du dgod pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i 'gog pa ni cho gas yan lag brgyad du dgod pa'o ;
translated: Their cessation is the placement in the eight branches by means of the rite.

original: / de ltar sa bon dang yan lag tu gzung bas so //
analyzed: / de ltar sa bon dang yan lag tu gzung bas so //
translated: Thus, by apprehending the seeds and the branches,

original: cho gas zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: cho gas zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: the rite is the previously mentioned reasoning.

original: slar yang 'bras bu dang rgyu'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'brel pa'i phyir rab kyi mthar son cing nang la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyi'i rten bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'gro ba kun la khyab pa po //
analyzed: slar yang 'bras bu dang rgyu'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'brel pa'i phyir rab kyi mthar son cing nang la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyi'i rten bstan pa'i phyir / 'gro ba kun la khyab pa po //
translated: Again, in order to teach the external supports of the yogis and yoginīs who have attained the culmination of the stage of completion and abide internally, because they are connected with the result and the cause, the samādhi,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, “pervading all migrating beings.”

original: khyab pa po zhes pa ni rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
analyzed: khyab pa po zhes pa ni rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
translated: The pervader is the mind that has the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: 'gro ba zhes pa ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes pa ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: Beings refers to the beings of the three realms.

original: kun zhes pa ni sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang @117b rdzus te skyes pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes pa ni sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang @117b rdzus te skyes pa'o //
translated: All refers to those born from eggs, wombs, heat and moisture, and those that are spontaneously born.

original: brtan pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: brtan pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The stable refers to

original: shing la sogs pa dang / ri dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa dang / ri dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang gzung ngo //
translated: trees and so on, mountains, and the four great elements.

original: g-yo bar bcas pa zhes pa ni rkang gnyis pa dang rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa'i sems can de rnams la yang khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo bar bcas pa zhes pa ni rkang gnyis pa dang rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa'i sems can de rnams la yang khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The moving refers to the two-legged, four-legged, and so on, and those sentient beings.

original: de yi rten du gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de yi rten du gyur pa yin //
translated: It is the support of those.

original: zhes pa ni khyab bya dang khyab par byed pa'i shes bya la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa yan lag bcu gnyis spong ba byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su rtogs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyab bya dang khyab par byed pa'i shes bya la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa yan lag bcu gnyis spong ba byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su rtogs pa /
translated: This verse shows that the Buddha's eighteen distinctive qualities are the support for the perfect realization of the thirty-seven elements that lead to enlightenment, which are the abandonment of the obscurations that are the objects of elimination and their bases, such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa /
translated: He has perfected the transcendent perfections such as generosity.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems gsum gyi dri ma dang bral ba bdag dang bdag gi dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral bar byams pa la sogs pa'i gnas rab tu skyong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de'i rten du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems gsum gyi dri ma dang bral ba bdag dang bdag gi dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral bar byams pa la sogs pa'i gnas rab tu skyong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de'i rten du 'gyur te /
translated: He is endowed with the qualities of protecting the abodes of love and so on, which are free of the stains of body, speech and mind, free of the entities of self and mine and free of the entities of subject and object.

original: de bzhin du tshangs lha dang lha min gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs lha dang lha min gyi yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, he is the support of Brahma, the gods and the demigods.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni khyab 'jug dang drag po dang mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni khyab 'jug dang drag po dang mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes Viṣṇu, Śiva, humans, non-humans, and so on.

original: de ltar khyab bya dang khyab byed nyams su myong bas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyab bya dang khyab byed nyams su myong bas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the illusion-like samādhi should be illustrated by the experience of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: gtso bo gang du spyod pa yi //🔽gnas ni bha ga zhes su gsungs //
analyzed: gtso bo gang du spyod pa yi // gnas ni bha ga zhes su gsungs //
translated: The place where the principal one moves🔽is said to be the bhaga.

original: zhes pa ni gnas zhes brjod de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnas zhes brjod de /
translated: This is said to be the place.

original: de la yang phyi dang nang gi gzugs can no //
analyzed: de la yang phyi dang nang gi gzugs can no //
translated: Moreover, it has a form that is external and internal.

original: de la nang gi lus ni lus la gnas pa'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la nang gi lus ni lus la gnas pa'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: There, the internal body is the seventy-two thousand channels located in the body.

original: rtsa de la bha ga zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rtsa de la bha ga zhes brjod do //
translated: That channel is called the bhaga.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it possesses the qualities of Īśvara and so on.

original: rtsa de rnams la gtso bo gang du spyod pa zhes pa srog gi rlung ye shes kyi bdag nyid rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: rtsa de rnams la gtso bo gang du spyod pa zhes pa srog gi rlung ye shes kyi bdag nyid rgyu ba ste /
translated: The principal one moves in those channels, the life-force wind, which is the nature of wisdom.

original: dus kyi khyad par dang 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par dang 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: The distinction of the special times and the twelve transits is summarized.

original: 'on kyang rtsa'i dbye bas stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsa'i dbye bas stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis brjod do //
translated: However, they are said to be seventy-two thousand due to the division of the channels.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'pho ba'i phyir na 'pho ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'pho ba'i phyir na 'pho ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Why is that? Because of the movement, it is called movement.

original: 'dis ni nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i srog rgyu ba'i phyir zhes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i srog rgyu ba'i phyir zhes pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates that the life force moves twenty-one thousand six hundred times.

original: yang na rtsa ji lta ba bzhin de'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
analyzed: yang na rtsa ji lta ba bzhin de'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
translated: Or else, the yoginīs have the characteristics of those channels.

original: de bzhin du gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang @118a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang @118a * //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the abodes, the neighboring abodes,

original: zhing la sogs pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing la sogs pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: the fields, and so on.

original: ji ltar phyi ru yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang 'og dang steng du 'phyar bar gnas te /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi ru yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang 'og dang steng du 'phyar bar gnas te /
translated: Just as externally, the trichiliocosm, the world systems of various world systems, are arranged in the east, west, south, north, below, and above,

original: slar yang de re re la yang de ltar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: slar yang de re re la yang de ltar 'gyur ro ;
translated: and again, each of those is the same.

original: /'di dag thams cad ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: /'di dag thams cad ni khams gsum pa'o //
translated: All of these are the three realms.

original: de bzhin du nang du rtsa'i dbye bas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang du rtsa'i dbye bas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the inner [body] by the divisions of the channels, such as the abodes and the neighboring abodes.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the characteristics of the Bhagavān's emanation body will be taught.

original: des 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i bya ba yang dag par nye bar spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i bya ba yang dag par nye bar spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the activity of benefiting beings will be perfectly engaged.

original: ji srid lus la gnas kyi bar //
analyzed: ji srid lus la gnas kyi bar //
translated: As long as one abides in the body,

original: de yi las dang las min 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi las dang las min 'gyur //
translated: one's actions and non-actions will be.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is said:

original: 'dir spyir sems can rnams kyi lus la lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid kyi las kyis 'khor bar 'ching ste /
analyzed: 'dir spyir sems can rnams kyi lus la lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid kyi las kyis 'khor bar 'ching ste /
translated: Here in general, sentient beings are bound in saṃsāra by actions of the nature of body, speech, and mind in the body.

original: de yang las ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang las ni gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two types of actions:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: virtuous and non-virtuous.

original: sems can rnams ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Sentient beings become three types.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gsungs pa / dge ba'i las dang mi dge ba'i las dang 'dres pa'i las so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dge ba'i las dang mi dge ba'i las dang 'dres pa'i las so //
translated: It is said: virtuous action, non-virtuous action, and mixed action.

original: de ltar gang dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la chags pa de dag ni dge ba'i las can no //
analyzed: de ltar gang dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la chags pa de dag ni dge ba'i las can no //
translated: Thus, those who are attached to the paths of the ten virtuous actions are those with virtuous actions.

original: de bzhin du gang dag rim pa las bzlog pa la chags pa de dag ni mi dge ba'i las can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag rim pa las bzlog pa la chags pa de dag ni mi dge ba'i las can no //
translated: Likewise, those who are attached to the reverse order of the stages are of nonvirtuous karma.🔽Likewise, those who have both of those are of mixed karma.

original: de bzhin du gnyis po de dag gang la yod pa zhes pa de dag thams cad 'dren ma can no //🔽de'i phyir / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis po de dag gang la yod pa zhes pa de dag thams cad 'dren ma can no // de'i phyir / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //

original: rang byas dge dang mi dge gang //
analyzed: rang byas dge dang mi dge gang //
translated: of body, speech, or mind one has done,

original: 'jig rten de yi 'bras la spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten de yi 'bras la spyod //
translated: one experiences the fruit of that in the world.

original: byed po gzhan ni su yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: byed po gzhan ni su yang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: There is no other agent whatsoever.

original: gang gi phyir 'khor ba las dang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal glo bur ba rnams kyi dang / rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshul gyis 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khor ba las dang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal glo bur ba rnams kyi dang / rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshul gyis 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the adventitious nature of karma, afflictions, and suffering in cyclic existence, one cycles in cyclic existence by way of the twelve factors of dependent origination.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji srid nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga las te /
analyzed: ji srid nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga las te /
translated: It is from the five appropriated aggregates.

original: lus zhes pa ni lus de la gnas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa tshogs brgyad do //
analyzed: lus zhes pa ni lus de la gnas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa tshogs brgyad do //
translated: The body is the eight collections of consciousness, such as the foundation consciousness that abides in that body.

original: 'on kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang skye ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang skye ste /
translated: But the six active consciousnesses and the afflicted mind arise from the store consciousness alone.

original: sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: They arise due to the power of former habitual tendencies.

original: yang @118b dang yang las kyi rnam par smin pas sems bskyed de /
analyzed: yang @118b dang yang las kyi rnam par smin pas sems bskyed de /
translated: Again and again, the store consciousness is generated by the evolution of karma.

original: de'i las dang las ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i las dang las ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: It is karma and the result of karma,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
translated: like the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: blo dang ldan pa'am byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku'i dbang gis las zhes pa ni /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa'am byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku'i dbang gis las zhes pa ni /
translated: The wise one’s magical creation is the transformation body of a wise one, that is, a bodhisattva.

original: sems can sna tshogs pa yongs su smin pa'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs pa yongs su smin pa'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: The magical creation of a wise one teaches the Dharma in order to develop various sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi gang ci yang rung ba'i ngag gi las de ni chos ston pa la gnas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi gang ci yang rung ba'i ngag gi las de ni chos ston pa la gnas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Whatever speech activity there is of the buddhas is based on the teaching of the Dharma.”

original: las min zhes pa ni ston pa de sgra brnyan bzhin te /
analyzed: las min zhes pa ni ston pa de sgra brnyan bzhin te /
translated: It is not non-karma, because that teaching is like an echo.

original: rkan dang lce dang mgrin pa dang mchu rnams kyis brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkan dang lce dang mgrin pa dang mchu rnams kyis brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not expressed by the palate, tongue, throat, or lips.

original: de'i zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i'o //
translated: The his refers to the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: 'gyur zhes pa ni nges par ro //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes pa ni nges par ro //
translated: The will is certain.🔽But, as long as it abides in the body

original: 'on kyang / ji srid lus la rnam gnas par //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang / ji srid lus la rnam gnas par // zhes pa ni /
translated: But as long as one abides in the body,🔽This is the meaning of the verse.🔽🔽

original: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa'i dus su 'khor 'dus pa de ni 'dir sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis theg pa gsum la mos pa rnams dang / bla na med pa'i theg pa la gnas pa rnams kyi rang gi sems bskyed pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston pa'i dus su 'khor 'dus pa de ni 'dir sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis theg pa gsum la mos pa rnams dang / bla na med pa'i theg pa la gnas pa rnams kyi rang gi sems bskyed pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: The assembly of the retinue in the place where the Tathagata teaches the Dharma is here the power of former karma, and the power of the generation of their own minds by those who aspire to the three vehicles and abide in the unsurpassed vehicle.

original: 'di dag thams cad sems kyi nang du 'dus shing sems kyang thams cad kyi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems kyi nang du 'dus shing sems kyang thams cad kyi nang du 'dus so //
translated: All of these are included within the mind, and the mind is included within all of them.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi lus las byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi lus de rnams nyid 'khor 'dus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi lus las byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi lus de rnams nyid 'khor 'dus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the bodies of sentient beings that arise from former karma are themselves the assembly of the retinue, and not anything else.

original: / de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad gsad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad gsad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa /

original: rnal 'byor pa dang sems can kun //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang sems can kun //

original: 'dod dang mi 'dod dngos po yis //
analyzed: 'dod dang mi 'dod dngos po yis //

original: nyon mongs bag chags nges pas bsgos //
analyzed: nyon mongs bag chags nges pas bsgos //

original: lus can nges par 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus can nges par 'khor bar 'gyur //

original: sems gang sdug bsngal de nyid de //

analyzed: skye bo yis ni sdug bsngal gnon //

original: sangs rgyas thams cad gcig 'dus pa //

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid //

original: sangs rgyas sems can sgrol byed pa'o //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya'o //

translated: Application, etc.

analyzed: nga rgyal yongs su spang ba'i don du lha'i nga rgyal 'chang ngo //
translated: Here, the disciple who has obtained empowerment according to the rite being explained is fully authorized. original: de'i sbyor ba zhes pa ni gnas bsrung ba dang bdag bsrung ba dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba dang / dang po'i sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las rgyal po mchog dang / thig le'i rnal 'byor dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //

translated: The application of that is the protection of the site, the protection of oneself, the protection of the yogin, the initial application, the supreme king of mandalas, the supreme king of actions, the yoga of the drop, and the yoga of the subtle.

original: du'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //

translated: The equality is said to be the peace of that, because by that application, the distraction of the mind is abandoned.

original: sbyar bar bya zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sbyar bar bya zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that one should apply to that.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pa ru ni 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pa ru ni 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it is said, it becomes meditation.

original: zhes pa ni dngos po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: It is said, one should meditate on the entity.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs dpal he ru ka'i rnam pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'o //

original: de nyid bsgom par bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom par bya bar 'gyur //
translated: It is said, that very thing becomes the object of meditation.

original: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de rab kyi mthar song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de rab kyi mthar song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By its very nature, that foundation consciousness is the culmination of the highest development.

original: bsgom pa'i dngos po dang sgom pa po gcig tu 'dres pa'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dngos po dang sgom pa po gcig tu 'dres pa'i bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of meditation and the meditator are fused into one.

original: gang tshe las kyi lus zhig na //
analyzed: gang tshe las kyi lus zhig na //
translated: When the body of karma is destroyed,

original: de lta bu yi lus su 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta bu yi lus su 'gyur //
translated: it becomes a body like that.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir gang tshe 'chi ba'i dus su phung po lnga rnams 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i tshe lus dang ngag dang sems kyi las rnams kyang 'jig go //
