translated: Here, when the five aggregates are destroyed at the time of death, the karma of body, speech, and mind is also destroyed.

original: 'on kyang snga ma la ltos pa'i phyir bag chags kyang 'jig pas chos thams cad la dmigs pa dge ba'am mi dge ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma la ltos pa'i phyir bag chags kyang 'jig pas chos thams cad la dmigs pa dge ba'am mi dge ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: However, since it depends on the former, the latent tendencies are also destroyed. Therefore, the result of the virtuous or nonvirtuous observation of all phenomena occurs.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yang dpal he ru ka la sogs pa'i dmigs pas de 'dra ba'i lha ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yang dpal he ru ka la sogs pa'i dmigs pas de 'dra ba'i lha ru 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, here also, by the observation of glorious Heruka and so on, one becomes a deity like that.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pas 'chi ba'i tshe gang dang gang gi gzugs bzang ba de dang de ru snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pas 'chi ba'i tshe gang dang gang gi gzugs bzang ba de dang de ru snang ngo //
translated: Thus, at the time of death, the yogin sees whatever form is good.

original: ji ltar skyes pa'am bud med @120a * //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa'am bud med @120a * //
translated: Just as a man or woman

original: 'ga' zhig gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su chags pa yid la byed pa de nyid kyis gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pas rmi lam du yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su chags pa yid la byed pa de nyid kyis gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pas rmi lam du yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: who is not asleep, by the very attention to passion, experiences it in a dream, in the state of sleep, by conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'ga' zhig gnyid log sad pa na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gnyid log sad pa na //
translated: when someone awakens from sleep

original: reg dang nyams su myong mi rnyed //
analyzed: reg dang nyams su myong mi rnyed //
translated: he does not find the contact and experience,

original: des na de ni brdzun par 'gyur //
analyzed: des na de ni brdzun par 'gyur //
translated: therefore it is false.

original: de 'di sems kyi tho 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di sems kyi tho 'tshams pa'o //
translated: This is the mind’s deception.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i sems nyid lha'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i sems nyid lha'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the yogin’s mind itself becomes the form of the deity.

original: da yi nus pa de tshe des //
analyzed: da yi nus pa de tshe des //
translated: Now, the power of that at that time

original: gang gis brtan dang g-yo ba khyab //
analyzed: gang gis brtan dang g-yo ba khyab //
translated: by which the stable and moving are pervaded.

original: ces pa ni lha de'i gzugs kyi nus pa ni stobs so //
analyzed: ces pa ni lha de'i gzugs kyi nus pa ni stobs so //
translated: This is the power of the form of that deity.

original: de tshe zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de tshe zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: “At that time” is a specification.

original: de'i zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i 'o //
translated: The “his” refers to the practitioner.

original: gang gis khyab ces pa ni stong ka'i nam mkha' nyi ma phyed du snang ba lta bu kun gzhi rnams par shes pa des khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis khyab ces pa ni stong ka'i nam mkha' nyi ma phyed du snang ba lta bu kun gzhi rnams par shes pa des khyab pa'o //
translated: “By what” means that the all-ground consciousness pervades like the light of the sun at noon.

original: brtan g-yo zhes pa ni khyab bya'o //
analyzed: brtan g-yo zhes pa ni khyab bya'o //
translated: “Moving and unmoving” is what is pervaded.

original: brtan pa ni snod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni snod la sogs pa'o //
translated: The unmoving is the environment and so on.

original: g-yo ba ni rkang gnyis pa dang rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rkang gnyis pa dang rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The moving is the two-legged, four-legged, and so on.

original: de ltar thams cad kyis khyab par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad kyis khyab par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which pervades all of that is called that.

original: yang na chos rnams thams cad kyi rtag pa nyid kyis na khyab par byed pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yang na chos rnams thams cad kyi rtag pa nyid kyis na khyab par byed pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Alternatively, since all phenomena are permanent, the pervader is the dharmakāya.

original: rnal 'byor de nyid kyi sems rdo rje 'chang lha'i gzugs des phyi dang nang gi gzugs rnams la khyab pa'o /
analyzed: rnal 'byor de nyid kyi sems rdo rje 'chang lha'i gzugs des phyi dang nang gi gzugs rnams la khyab pa'o /
translated: The mind of that yoga, the form of the deity Vajradhara, pervades all outer and inner forms.

original: de yi kha dog shes par bya //
analyzed: de yi kha dog shes par bya //
translated: One should know that color.

original: lung dang mnyam pa lta bu'o //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lung dang mnyam pa lta bu'o // zhes pa ni /
translated: It is like a scripture.

original: de'i lha'i bdag nyid kyi sems kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i lha'i bdag nyid kyi sems kyi'o //
translated: That is the color of the mind of the deity.

original: kha dog ni dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: The colors are white, yellow, red, black, and green.

original: gang lung dang mnyam pa lta bu zhes pa ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor bla ma dang rnal 'byor bla ma'i rgyud rnams su gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshul gyis shes par bya zhes pa de nyid sgrub pa pos mos pa'i dbang gis lte bar mtshon
analyzed: gang lung dang mnyam pa lta bu zhes pa ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor bla ma dang rnal 'byor bla ma'i rgyud rnams su gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshul gyis shes par bya zhes pa de nyid sgrub pa pos mos pa'i dbang gis lte bar mtshon
translated: What is like the scriptures is to be known by the method of the rites of pacification and so forth, which the Lord taught in the Kriya, Carya, Yoga, Yoga-Uttara, and Yoginl Tantras. That very [mandala] is to be visualized by the adept at the navel, by the power of imagination.

original: par bya'o // yang na kha dog thams cad do //
analyzed: par bya'o // yang na kha dog thams cad do //
translated: Or, it is of all colors.

original: mya ngan 'das nas dpa' bo ni //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das nas dpa' bo ni //
translated: The hero after nirvana,

original: gos pa med cing dri mas sbags //
analyzed: gos pa med cing dri mas sbags //
translated: unstained, is stained by stains.

original: zhes pa'am / mya ngan 'das zhes pa ni chos sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'am / mya ngan 'das zhes pa ni chos sku'o //
translated: Nirvana is the Dharma Body.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
translated: The hero is the Innate Body.

original: mi 'dzag pa'i phyir dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: mi 'dzag pa'i phyir dpa' bo ste /
translated: Because of non-emission, he is a hero.

original: yan lag ma rnams kyis bde ba la reg pas res 'ga' yang 'dzag par @120b mi 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag ma rnams kyis bde ba la reg pas res 'ga' yang 'dzag par @120b mi 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the branches, by the touch of bliss, do not sometimes leak.

original: yang na dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i lhan cig skyes pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par bzhugs pa ni dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: yang na dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i lhan cig skyes pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par bzhugs pa ni dpa' bo ste /
translated: Or else, the heroes are the Tathagatas who dwell to the end of the realm of space by means of the coemergent vajra-like samadhi.

original: mi 'dzag pa'i rgyud ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'dzag pa'i rgyud ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the tantra is not to be leaked.

original: yang na bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir snying rje chen po mngon du byed cing phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: yang na bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir snying rje chen po mngon du byed cing phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir dpa' bo'o //
translated: Or else, the hero is the one who manifests great compassion in order to conquer the four demons, and is the hero in that he does not turn back.

original: yang na dpa' bo rnams thul ba'i phyir dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: yang na dpa' bo rnams thul ba'i phyir dpa' bo'o //
translated: Or else, the hero is the one who tames the heroes.

original: gos pa med ces pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang phrag dog la sogs pas ni gos pa ste /
analyzed: gos pa med ces pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang phrag dog la sogs pas ni gos pa ste /
translated: As for “unstained,” one is stained by passion, aggression, delusion, envy, and so on.

original: nam mkha' la sprin bzhin 'gebs par byed pa de bzhin du sems la ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams kyis 'gebs par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sprin bzhin 'gebs par byed pa de bzhin du sems la ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams kyis 'gebs par byed do //
translated: Just as the sky is covered by clouds, in the same way, the mind is covered by the stains of the adventitious afflictions and subsidiary afflictions such as ignorance.

original: de rnams dang bral ba ni gos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang bral ba ni gos pa med pa ste /
translated: Free from those, it is unstained.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: This is the Enjoyment Body.

original: dri mas sbags zhes pa ni sbrul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: dri mas sbags zhes pa ni sbrul pa'i sku'o //
translated: “Stained by stains” refers to the Emanation Body.

original: de yang ma dang la yang dag par sbyor ba'i dbang gis phung po lnga la sogs pa rnams la rten par byed do //
analyzed: de yang ma dang la yang dag par sbyor ba'i dbang gis phung po lnga la sogs pa rnams la rten par byed do //
translated: Moreover, by the power of the union with the mother, it is supported in the five aggregates, etc.

original: dri ma de rnams kyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes stong pa dang / snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi sems sbags pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma de rnams kyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes stong pa dang / snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi sems sbags pa'o //
translated: Those stains obscure the mind, which is the luminous pristine wisdom, the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: gang gi phyir phung po lnga ma gtogs par sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can gyi don du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po lnga ma gtogs par sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can gyi don du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, apart from the five aggregates, etc., the Buddhas do not benefit sentient beings.

original: rgyu des na skyes rabs sna tshogs pa rnams su 'khrungs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs par yang sbrul pa'i skus cung zad 'dod chags la brten pa'i thugs kyis rten par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu des na skyes rabs sna tshogs pa rnams su 'khrungs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs par yang sbrul pa'i skus cung zad 'dod chags la brten pa'i thugs kyis rten par byed do //
translated: For that reason, because of being born in various previous lives, in the future also, by means of the emanation body, he relies on a mind that is slightly dependent on passion.

original: 'dod chags ni sems kyi dri ma ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sems kyi dri ma ste /
translated: Passion is a stain of the mind.

original: dngos po rnams la chags pa'i dri mas des sbags pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'jug pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la chags pa'i dri mas des sbags pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'jug pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of being stained by the stain of passion for things is the engagement of the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: de ltar sku bzhi go rims bzhin rnal 'byor pa rnams dang 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sku bzhi go rims bzhin rnal 'byor pa rnams dang 'brel par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four bodies should be connected with the yogis in order.

original: da ni phyi dang nang du rtsa'i dbye bas 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbang gis sa bcu gnyis bstan pa dang / rigs kyi rnal 'byor ma rgyu ba'i dam tshig bsten pa'i phyir ma dang sring mo zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni phyi dang nang du rtsa'i dbye bas 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbang gis sa bcu gnyis bstan pa dang / rigs kyi rnal 'byor ma rgyu ba'i dam tshig bsten pa'i phyir ma dang sring mo zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the twelve stages by the power of the twelve transits by means of the divisions of the channels externally and internally, and in order to rely on the commitment of the movement of the yoginis of the clans, mother, sister, and so on are mentioned.

original: 'dir lte bar 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i rang bzhin thun mong du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lte bar 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i rang bzhin thun mong du bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the wheel at the navel is of the nature of twelve spokes, taught in common.

original: 'on kyang tshad ma ni rtsibs bcu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma ni rtsibs bcu'o //
translated: However, the valid spokes are ten.

original: de ci zhe na /🔽'dir phyogs brgyad kyi dbye bas rtsibs brgyad thun brgyad @121a * //
analyzed: de ci zhe na / 'dir phyogs brgyad kyi dbye bas rtsibs brgyad thun brgyad @121a * //
translated: What is that?

original: kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Here, the eight directions are divided into eight spokes, which are the nature of the eight periods.

original: de bzhin du thun tshod gnyis dbye bas gnyis lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thun tshod gnyis dbye bas gnyis lhag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the two periods are divided into two, which are the two extra spokes.

original: de ltar rtsibs bcu dkyil 'khor bcu 'bab pa'i phyir yang bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtsibs bcu dkyil 'khor bcu 'bab pa'i phyir yang bcu'o //
translated: Thus, there are ten spokes because ten cakras descend.

original: de'i 'og dang steng gi dbye bas 'dab ma gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i 'og dang steng gi dbye bas 'dab ma gnyis te /
translated: Below and above that are the two petals,

original: rtsa gnyis khu ba dang khrag 'bab ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa gnyis khu ba dang khrag 'bab ba'o //
translated: which are the two nāḍīs that carry semen and blood.

original: de ltar rtsibs bcu gnyis 'dir rim pa bzhin rtsa rnams 'dus te /
analyzed: de ltar rtsibs bcu gnyis 'dir rim pa bzhin rtsa rnams 'dus te /
translated: Thus, the twelve spokes are the gathering of the nāḍīs in sequence.

original: ma ni ser skya ma'o //🔽sring mo ni yid bzangs ma'o //
analyzed: ma ni ser skya ma'o // sring mo ni yid bzangs ma'o //
translated: The mother is Pīluṇā.🔽The sister is Sumatidā.

original: bu mo ni ai ta'o //
analyzed: bu mo ni ai ta'o //
translated: The daughter is Iḍā.

original: gnyen mo ni snar ma'o //
analyzed: gnyen mo ni snar ma'o //
translated: The female relative is Nāri.

original: bram ze mo ni glang po che'i lce'o //🔽rgyal rigs mo ni rgyal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze mo ni glang po che'i lce'o // rgyal rigs mo ni rgyal zhes pa'o //
translated: The brahmin woman is Hastajihvā.🔽The kṣatriya woman is Jayā.

original: rje'u rigs mo ni rgyal ma'o //
analyzed: rje'u rigs mo ni rgyal ma'o //
translated: The vaiśya woman is Vijayā.

original: dmangs rigs ni ai da'o //🔽gar mkhan ma ni sreg ma'o //
analyzed: dmangs rigs ni ai da'o // gar mkhan ma ni sreg ma'o //
translated: The śūdra woman is Iḍā.🔽The dancer is Marīcī.

original: tshos mkhan ma ni dung can ma'o //
analyzed: tshos mkhan ma ni dung can ma'o //
translated: The dyer is Śaṅkhinī.

original: 'og tu ye shes can te de ni g-yung mo'o //
analyzed: 'og tu ye shes can te de ni g-yung mo'o //
translated: The one below is Jñānavāhinī, who is the yoginī.

original: steng du rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: steng du rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Above is consciousness.

original: de ni gtum mor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gtum mor shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as Caṇḍālī.

original: shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of wisdom and means,

original: zhes pa ni shes rab ni rnal 'byor ma bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab ni rnal 'byor ma bcu gnyis so //
translated: Wisdom is the twelve yoginīs.

original: de rnams kyi thabs ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thabs ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams so //
translated: Their means are the prāṇa and so forth.

original: cho ga yis zhes pa ni dus kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: cho ga yis zhes pa ni dus kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: By the rite is by the special time.

original: mchod par bya zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba'i dus kyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba'i dus kyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: One should worship is indicated by the time of the rite.

original: de nyid rig pas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid tshol zhing rig pa de ni de nyid rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid tshol zhing rig pa de ni de nyid rig pa'o //
translated: By one who knows reality is the yogī who seeks and knows reality.

original: de kho na nyid ces pa ni rang rig pa'i ye shes rab kyi gnas skabs su son pas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sa thob bo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces pa ni rang rig pa'i ye shes rab kyi gnas skabs su son pas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sa thob bo //
translated: That reality is the state of wisdom, self-knowing awareness, and one attains the stage of Great Vajradhara.

original: dus 'di'i cho ga ma gsungs kyang bla ma brgyud pa las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dus 'di'i cho ga ma gsungs kyang bla ma brgyud pa las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Although the rite of this time is not mentioned, it should be understood from the lineage of gurus.

original: de'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The stages are as follows.

original: rtsibs bcu'i dbye ba rnams la rtsibs re re rtsa re re'i bdag nyid kyis 'pho ba bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtsibs bcu'i dbye ba rnams la rtsibs re re rtsa re re'i bdag nyid kyis 'pho ba bcur 'gyur te /
translated: The divisions of the ten spokes are the ten transits, by the nature of each spoke and each channel.

original: 'og dang steng gi rtsa nyid kyis dbye bas thun tshod bzhi dang lhan cig 'pho ba gnyis so //
analyzed: 'og dang steng gi rtsa nyid kyis dbye bas thun tshod bzhi dang lhan cig 'pho ba gnyis so //
translated: By the division of the lower and upper channels, there are two transits together with the four periods.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phyi rol du yang lug dang srang gi 'pho ba'i dus gnyis mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang lug dang srang gi 'pho ba'i dus gnyis mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, externally, the transits of Aries and Libra are the same.

original: de ltar nang du mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir rdo rje lta bur srog dang thur sel 'gog pas rtsa gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nang du mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir rdo rje lta bur srog dang thur sel 'gog pas rtsa gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, internally, by the union of the same, the two channels are to be understood by stopping the vajra and downward voiding winds.

original: de ltar 'pho ba bcu gnyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba bcu gnyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the twelve transits are to be illustrated.

original: ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin nang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin nang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Just as externally, so internally.

original: de yang 'pho ba re re la g-yon dang g-yas kyi sna'i bu ga'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor lnga lnga rgyu par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'pho ba re re la g-yon dang g-yas kyi sna'i bu ga'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor lnga lnga rgyu par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, each transit, by the division of the left and right nostrils, has five mandalas.

original: dkyil 'khor re re la sum brgya drug cu'i srog rnams su @121b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor re re la sum brgya drug cu'i srog rnams su @121b 'gyur ro //
translated: Each mandala has three hundred and sixty life winds.

original: de ltar dbyug tshod drug cu dang rtsa drug cu rnams su yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbyug tshod drug cu dang rtsa drug cu rnams su yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are also sixty-four fingerbreadths.

original: de bzhin du aa wa dh'u t'i'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cha la dkyil 'khor bcu gnyis su brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du aa wa dh'u t'i'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cha la dkyil 'khor bcu gnyis su brjod de /
translated: Similarly, in the part of the mandala of wisdom of the avadhūtī, there are said to be twelve mandalas.

original: de rnams lhan cig bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams lhan cig bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Those together are seventy-two.

original: de rnams las rnal 'byor ma dang // rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams skya ba brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams las rnal 'byor ma dang // rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams skya ba brjod do //
translated: From those, the yoginīs and yogin tantras are said to arise.

original: de la de ltar spro ba dang sdud pa dang g-yon gyi rtsa rnams la rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de ltar spro ba dang sdud pa dang g-yon gyi rtsa rnams la rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the emanation and gathering of the left nāḍīs are the six yoginī tantras.

original: de bzhin du g-yas kyi rtsa la rnal 'byor gyi rgyud drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas kyi rtsa la rnal 'byor gyi rgyud drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the six yogin tantras are on the right nāḍīs.

original: de yang g-yon rnams la 'khor lo sdom pa dang / gdan bzhi pa dang / rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa dang / kun du spyod ma dang / brjod pa bla ma dang / he ru ka mngon par 'byung pa'o //
analyzed: de yang g-yon rnams la 'khor lo sdom pa dang / gdan bzhi pa dang / rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa dang / kun du spyod ma dang / brjod pa bla ma dang / he ru ka mngon par 'byung pa'o //
translated: Further, on the left are Cakrasaṃvara, Catuḥpīṭha, Yoga-Upadeśa, Yoginīsaṃcāra, Parivartabhagavatī, and Herukābhyudaya.

original: de bzhin du g-yas rnams la 'dus pa dang / sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang / rdo rje bdud rtsi dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed dang / gshin rje'i dgra dang dpal mchog dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas rnams la 'dus pa dang / sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang / rdo rje bdud rtsi dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed dang / gshin rje'i dgra dang dpal mchog dang po'o //
translated: Likewise, the right ones are the Guhyasamāja, the Māyājāla, the Vajramṛta, the Vajrabhairava, the Yamāri, and the Śrī Paramadya.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis ni kha sbyor zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis ni kha sbyor zhes brjod de /
translated: Thus, the two aspects are called “embracing,”

original: dus kyi pho nya drug drug gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: dus kyi pho nya drug drug gi dbye bas so //
translated: because of the division of the six messengers of time.

original: de las rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dag 'byung ste /
translated: From that, the Yoginī and Yoga Tantras arise.

original: sum cu gnyis drug cur 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sum cu gnyis drug cur 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Thirty-two times six hundred, it is said.

original: de las dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje 'bum phrag lnga pa zhes rtog pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de las dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje 'bum phrag lnga pa zhes rtog pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: From that, the Śrī Hevajra-pañcaśatika, which has the nature of thirty-two chapters, arises.

original: des na rgyud nyung ngur byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: des na rgyud nyung ngur byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in the short Tantra, the thirty-two channels of the falling bodhicitta are taught.

original: de ni sdud pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni sdud pa'i don to //
translated: That is the condensed meaning.

original: de de ltar mi shes pa'i sems can rnams la kha sbyor thig le las byung ba'i rnal 'byor gtsor bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de de ltar mi shes pa'i sems can rnams la kha sbyor thig le las byung ba'i rnal 'byor gtsor bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: The Lord has taught the yoga of the union of the vital essence to sentient beings who do not know it in that way.

original: slar yang rtsa 'di dag rnams kyi rtsibs bcu gnyis rnams la rlung rnam par gzhag pa brjod de srog dang / thur sel dang / mnyam pa dang / gyen rgyu dang / khyab byed lnga'o //
analyzed: slar yang rtsa 'di dag rnams kyi rtsibs bcu gnyis rnams la rlung rnam par gzhag pa brjod de srog dang / thur sel dang / mnyam pa dang / gyen rgyu dang / khyab byed lnga'o //
translated: Again, the twelve spokes of these channels are said to be the arrangement of the winds: life, downward-voiding, equalizing, upward-moving, and pervasive.

original: klu dang / rus sbal dang / rtsangs pa dang / lha sa byin dang / nor rgyal zhes pa bcu ni rtsibs bcu la'o //
analyzed: klu dang / rus sbal dang / rtsangs pa dang / lha sa byin dang / nor rgyal zhes pa bcu ni rtsibs bcu la'o //
translated: The ten winds, namely, naga, kurma, kRkara, devadatta, and dhananjaya, are in the ten spokes.

original: de bzhin du 'og dang steng du ye shes 'char ba dang / rnam par shes pa 'char pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og dang steng du ye shes 'char ba dang / rnam par shes pa 'char pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the dawning of wisdom and the dawning of consciousness are below and above, respectively.

original: de rnams kyi 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor rgyu ba'i dbang gis dang bla ma'i man ngag gi dbang gis aa wa dh'u t'ir srog rgyu bas 'pho ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor rgyu ba'i dbang gis dang bla ma'i man ngag gi dbang gis aa wa dh'u t'ir srog rgyu bas 'pho ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the force of the movement of the maṇḍala and by the force of the guru’s instruction, the winds move in the avadhūti, and the maṇḍala of the movements is arrested by the division into twelve movements.

original: rgyun du goms @122a * //
analyzed: rgyun du goms @122a * //
translated: Constantly habituated.

original: pa'i sbyor ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rnams 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i sbyor ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rnams 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The twelve branches of yoga are stopped.

original: des na sa bcu rnams kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na sa bcu rnams kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one enjoys the fruits of the ten stages.

original: gang gi phyir ma zhes pa la sogs pa chos mkhan ma'i mthar thug par rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas sa bcu rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma zhes pa la sogs pa chos mkhan ma'i mthar thug par rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas sa bcu rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The ultimate truth of the qualities of samādhi of the ten stages, beginning with the Joyous, is the end of the dharmadhātu, and so on, up to the end of the dhātu of the yoginī.

original: 'di'i rgyu yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa'i rtsa rnam pa bcu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa'i rtsa rnam pa bcu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
translated: The cause of that is the ten nāḍīs, such as the avadhūti, and so on, which are the ten perfections.

original: des rab tu thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa stong pa nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' ni g-yung mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des rab tu thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa stong pa nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' ni g-yung mo zhes brjod do //
translated: The buddhahood that is attained by that is the all-illumination endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, the emptiness of the ultimate limit, which is called the yoginī.

original: dang ni sdud pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang ni sdud pa'i don to //
translated: The word “and” has the meaning of collecting.

original: de dag ni ma gsungs kyang don gyis rtogs par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni ma gsungs kyang don gyis rtogs par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Although they are not mentioned, they should be understood by the meaning.

original: de bzhin du snying rje'i dbang gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje'i dbang gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, the stage of devoted engagement is twelve due to the power of compassion.

original: de yang dang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang dang por 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is the first,

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa'i bsam gtan thams cad kyi dang por snying rje la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa'i bsam gtan thams cad kyi dang por snying rje la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
translated: because the transcendent lords have taught that the first of all the contemplations of the yogi is the contemplation focused on compassion.

original: de yang gtum mo zhes brjod de shin tu gdug cing gtum pa'i log pa'i chos kyis nye bar bsnun pa rnams kyis blo ngan pa rnam par gzhom pa'i phyir drag po la sogs pa'i gzugs dang snying rjes brlan pa'i thugs kyis las tshogs sna tshogs pa de bzhin🔽gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang gtum mo zhes brjod de shin tu gdug cing gtum pa'i log pa'i chos kyis nye bar bsnun pa rnams kyis blo ngan pa rnam par gzhom pa'i phyir drag po la sogs pa'i gzugs dang snying rjes brlan pa'i thugs kyis las tshogs sna tshogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it is called Caṇḍālī, because the transcendent lords have taught the various collections of rites with a mind moistened by compassion and with a form such as that of Caṇḍa Mahāroṣaṇa in order to destroy the evil minds of those who are nourished by the wrong path, which is very cruel and violent.

original: de'i phyir gtum mos gtum po'i las rnams gzhom pa'i phyir steng gi rtsa dgag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtum mos gtum po'i las rnams gzhom pa'i phyir steng gi rtsa dgag go //
translated: Therefore, in order to destroy the rites of Caṇḍālī with Caṇḍālī, the upper channel is blocked.

original: de ltar srog dang thur sel gyi sbyor ba'i shes rab dang thabs kyi cho ga'i sbyor ba des rdo rje lta bu'i sems mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar srog dang thur sel gyi sbyor ba'i shes rab dang thabs kyi cho ga'i sbyor ba des rdo rje lta bu'i sems mchod par bya'o //
translated: By this method of the wisdom and means of the union of life and downward-clearing winds, one should worship the vajra-like mind.

original: yang na dbang gi dus su rnal 'byor ma bcu slob mas slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang gi dus su rnal 'byor ma bcu slob mas slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, at the time of initiation, the ten yoginis should be offered by the disciple to the master.

original: g-yung mo dang gtum mo'i bu mo skye gnas ma nyams pa gnyis khrus kyi don du yang dbul lo //
analyzed: g-yung mo dang gtum mo'i bu mo skye gnas ma nyams pa gnyis khrus kyi don du yang dbul lo //
translated: Two girls, of the Dombi and Chandi castes, who are virgins, should be offered for the sake of bathing.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig slob dpon gyis snyoms par 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig slob dpon gyis snyoms par 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Together with them, the master should enter into union.

original: slob ma la gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i rgyur ro //
analyzed: slob ma la gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i rgyur ro //
translated: This is the cause for bestowing the secret initiation on the disciple.

original: de yang bung ba dang 'dra ba kha phye ba dang dpyang thag dang / bskums pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa 'byed pa'i tshogs 'dod pa'i bstan bcos su gsungs pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bung ba dang 'dra ba kha phye ba dang dpyang thag dang / bskums pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa 'byed pa'i tshogs 'dod pa'i bstan bcos su gsungs pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood by the method taught in the Kama Sutra, such as the opening of the lotus, the swing, the contracted and extended positions, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du bcu'i nang nas gcig dbang phyi ma'i don du slob ma la gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcu'i nang nas gcig dbang phyi ma'i don du slob ma la gtad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one of the ten should be given to the disciple for the sake of the later initiation.

original: gcig @122b kyang 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dbang gis bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig @122b kyang 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dbang gis bcur 'gyur te /
translated: Each one becomes ten by the power of result and cause.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsungs pa / dang po nu ma la reg pa'i phyir ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dang po nu ma la reg pa'i phyir ma zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said: First, because of touching the breast, she is called mother.

original: de yang gdung ba dang bcas pas lta ba ni sring mo'o //
analyzed: de yang gdung ba dang bcas pas lta ba ni sring mo'o //
translated: Moreover, looking with affection is the sister.

original: brtse ba brtan pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sel to //
analyzed: brtse ba brtan pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sel to //
translated: With firm love, the suffering of samsara is removed.

original: da ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: da ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: Now, it is ascertained.

original: de yang thams cad kyi rjes su 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi rjes su 'brel par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be connected to all.

original: de bzhin zhes pa ni ma lta bu dang sring mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa ni ma lta bu dang sring mo lta bu'o //
translated: Thus is like a mother and like a sister.

original: bu mo lta bu zhes pa ni yang dang yang du 'o bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu mo lta bu zhes pa ni yang dang yang du 'o bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Girl is for kissing again and again.

original: de bzhin du gnyen mo ni 'khyud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyen mo ni 'khyud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, female relative is for embracing.

original: bram ze mo ni dam pa'i don rig pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze mo ni dam pa'i don rig pa'o //
translated: The Brahmin woman is the knower of the ultimate.

original: rgyal rigs ma zhes pa ni shin tu chags pa'i sbyor bas res 'ga' yang yongs su mi tshim pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs ma zhes pa ni shin tu chags pa'i sbyor bas res 'ga' yang yongs su mi tshim pa'o //
translated: The female of the warrior caste is never satisfied by the practice of great passion.

original: yang na shin tu gdungs pas kyang mi tshim pa'o //
analyzed: yang na shin tu gdungs pas kyang mi tshim pa'o //
translated: Or, she is not satisfied by great passion.

original: yang na bram ze mo zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas su shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bram ze mo zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas su shes par bya ba ste /
translated: Or, the brahmin woman is to be known as the abode of Brahmā,

original: rang gi lag pas mtshan ma bzung nas rang gi mtshan mar reg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag pas mtshan ma bzung nas rang gi mtshan mar reg par byed pa'o //
translated: who, holding the organ with her hand, touches her organ.

original: de bzhin du rje'u rigs mo zhes pa ni cha lugs sna tshogs pa'am gzugs sna tshogs pas 'dod pa'i bstan bcos kyi tshul gyis srid ces pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rje'u rigs mo zhes pa ni cha lugs sna tshogs pa'am gzugs sna tshogs pas 'dod pa'i bstan bcos kyi tshul gyis srid ces pa'am /
translated: Similarly, the kṣatriya woman is the various modes or various forms of the treatise on love,

original: ha zhes pa 'don pa'o //
analyzed: ha zhes pa 'don pa'o //
translated: or the way of the “ha” sound.

original: de bzhin du dmangs rigs mo ni 'dzag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmangs rigs mo ni 'dzag pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the śūdra woman is the emission,

original: ji ltar ri'i rtse mo nas chu rgyun 'dzag pa de bzhin du padma'i lte ba nas byang chub sems kyi rgyun 'jag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ri'i rtse mo nas chu rgyun 'dzag pa de bzhin du padma'i lte ba nas byang chub sems kyi rgyun 'jag pa'o //
translated: just as a stream of water flows from the peak of a mountain, so a stream of bodhicitta flows from the center of the lotus.

original: de bzhin du gar mkhan ma zhes pa ni yan lag brgyad kyis bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gar mkhan ma zhes pa ni yan lag brgyad kyis bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the dancer is so called because she moves with the eight limbs.

original: de bzhin du chos mkhan ma zhes pa ni chags pa chen po'i bde bas mchod pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa'i bde bas bde ba mi 'tshor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mkhan ma zhes pa ni chags pa chen po'i bde bas mchod pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa'i bde bas bde ba mi 'tshor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the dharma woman is so called because she is not satisfied with various pleasures, since she is worshipped with the bliss of great passion.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i gnas skabs bcu rgyas pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i gnas skabs bcu rgyas pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The ten stages of desire should be known from the extensive [explanation].

original: de nas g-yung mo zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa dga' ba'i dus su ye shes smra med pa dang reg tu med pa'i phyir dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis ngag gi lam dang bral zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nas g-yung mo zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa dga' ba'i dus su ye shes smra med pa dang reg tu med pa'i phyir dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis ngag gi lam dang bral zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, the “caṇḍālī” is at the time of the connate joy, because the inexpressible gnosis and the untouchable are not the domain of the senses, they are free from the path of speech.

original: de nyid gtum mor shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid gtum mor shes par bya ste /
translated: That should be known as caṇḍālī.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shing bsreg pas gtum mo'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shing bsreg pas gtum mo'o //
translated: Because it burns the wood of conceptuality, it is caṇḍālī.

original: dga' ba dang bral ba rnams bral bar byed cing de bzhin bde bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bral ba rnams bral bar byed cing de bzhin bde bar byed pa'o //
translated: It separates those who are separated from joy and makes them blissful.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gi sbyor ba ni dam tshig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gi sbyor ba ni dam tshig ces pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the outer and inner union is the meaning of “pledge.”

original: de ni 'dus pas dam tshig tu blta'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dus pas dam tshig tu blta'o //
translated: That is seen as a pledge through union.

original: de nyid rig pas mchod ces pa ni gnyis te /🔽sgyu ma lta bu dang rnam @123a * //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas mchod ces pa ni gnyis te / sgyu ma lta bu dang rnam @123a * //
translated: That is worship with knowledge, which is twofold.

original: par rig pa'o //
analyzed: par rig pa'o //
translated: It is like an illusion and consciousness.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ni sngon du gsungs pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i tshul gyis sa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ni sngon du gsungs pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i tshul gyis sa la brten pa'o //
translated: The illusory one is based on the stage in the manner of the previously mentioned twelve-spoked wheel.

original: de'i phyir rnam par reg pa ni da lta'i sems can rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi bsam pas las kyi phyag rgya dang sbyar bas sangs rgyas nyid thob pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par reg pa ni da lta'i sems can rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi bsam pas las kyi phyag rgya dang sbyar bas sangs rgyas nyid thob pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the touch is so called because of the attainment of buddhahood by present sentient beings through the union of the karma-mudra in accordance with their own mental disposition.

original: da ni dam tshig bsrungs pa dang nyams pa'i skyon dang yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /🔽ji ltar dbye ba skye med par //
analyzed: da ni dam tshig bsrungs pa dang nyams pa'i skyon dang yon tan bstan pa'i phyir / ji ltar dbye ba skye med par //
translated: Now, in order to teach the faults and virtues of observing and transgressing the commitments,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, just as the divisions are unborn, etc.

original: 'dir sngon du gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin brten pa'i dus su de yang rab tu 'bad pas brten par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngon du gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin brten pa'i dus su de yang rab tu 'bad pas brten par bya'o //
translated: Here, at the time of relying on the previously mentioned samādhi, one should rely on that with great effort.

original: rab tu 'bad pas zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems kyi nyes pas rtsa rgyu ba'i dus su ji ltar sems rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar dus 'jig par byed de skad cig ma gcig la mtshon pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems kyi nyes pas rtsa rgyu ba'i dus su ji ltar sems rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar dus 'jig par byed de skad cig ma gcig la mtshon pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of in a single moment.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe nyes pa skye ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe nyes pa skye ste /
translated: Because of distraction, faults arise.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i sems nyams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i sems nyams so //
translated: The mind of one who is absorbed in concentration deteriorates.

original: sems nyams pa des ji ltar dbye ba zhes pa dus kyi dbye ba skye'o //
analyzed: sems nyams pa des ji ltar dbye ba zhes pa dus kyi dbye ba skye'o //
translated: By that deterioration of the mind, the divisions of time are produced.

original: des na skal ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na skal ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: By that, one becomes unfortunate.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams g-yeng ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams g-yeng ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of distraction is the distraction of the eye consciousnesses, etc.

original: de mthong ba'i nyes pa'i phyir dam tshig nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mthong ba'i nyes pa'i phyir dam tshig nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the fault of seeing that, the vow deteriorates.

original: yang ni dbang la sogs pa'i dus su dam tshig la spyod pa'i dbang gis gsad par mi byed ces pa ni gdul dka' ba'i sems can nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis de mthong bas sdug bsngal zhes pa ni mnar med pa la sogs pa'i dmyal ba rnams🔽su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ni dbang la sogs pa'i dus su dam tshig la spyod pa'i dbang gis gsad par mi byed ces pa ni gdul dka' ba'i sems can nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis de mthong bas sdug bsngal zhes pa ni mnar med pa la sogs pa'i dmyal ba rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Those difficult to tame, such as the hearers, and so on, are said to suffer when they see that, that is, they will go to the hells, such as Avīci.

original: rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa la tho 'tshams pa sbrul la sogs pas bsad nas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir / dam tshig bsrungs pas dngos grub 'thob //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa la tho 'tshams pa sbrul la sogs pas bsad nas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro // de'i phyir / dam tshig bsrungs pas dngos grub 'thob //
translated: Those who harm the conduct of yoga are killed by the nāgas, and so on, and experience suffering.

original: ces pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “siddhi is attained by keeping the pledge” is certain.

original: da ni rnal 'byor ma zhing skyes brgyad kyi rigs rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor ma zhing skyes brgyad kyi rigs rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the eight classes of yoginī and field-born dākinīs,

original: rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “the divisions of the families,” and so on.

original: 'dir zhing dang nye ba'i zhing la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid mtshon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhing dang nye ba'i zhing la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid mtshon par bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the division of the yogins and yoginīs abiding in the field and the adjacent field is distinguished by the division of the families, which is to be illustrated by the nature of the five tathāgatas.

original: des na nye bar mtshon pas sgrub pa po rnams la @123b mchog ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nye bar mtshon pas sgrub pa po rnams la @123b mchog ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by that illustration, the adepts are granted the supreme.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems kyi rigs kyi dbang gis gcig dang du ma'i sems las byung ba'i dngos po'i phyir des na dag pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'khor lo las phyi rol du rnal 'byor ma rnams skye'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rigs kyi dbang gis gcig dang du ma'i sems las byung ba'i dngos po'i phyir des na dag pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'khor lo las phyi rol du rnal 'byor ma rnams skye'o //
translated: By the power of the family of the mind, there is the entity of the single and multiple minds. Therefore, by the nature of purity, the yoginīs are born outside of the wheel.

original: des na yang sgom ba tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis sgrub pa po rnams kyang dus mnyam pa la skye'o //
analyzed: des na yang sgom ba tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis sgrub pa po rnams kyang dus mnyam pa la skye'o //
translated: Moreover, by mere meditation, the adepts are born simultaneously by the power of conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir gcig las gcig mthong bas grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig las gcig mthong bas grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by seeing one another, they are liberated.

original: de ltar zhing brgyad kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams rang gi rigs dang 'khyud pas phyag rgya zhes pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhing brgyad kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams rang gi rigs dang 'khyud pas phyag rgya zhes pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by embracing the yoginis of the eight clans with one's own clan, one will attain the great seal, the accomplishment of the great seal.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ru gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ru gsungs te /
translated: That is also said to be fivefold:

original: bram ze mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: the brahmin woman, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'dod ces pa ni rnam par snang mdzad 'dod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'dod ces pa ni rnam par snang mdzad 'dod ces pa'o //
translated: The desire for the Tathagata is the desire for Vairochana.🔽 The immeasurable vajra is born from the clan of Amitabha.

original: dpag med rdo rje zhes pa ni 'od dpag med pa'i rigs las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dpag med rdo rje zhes pa ni 'od dpag med pa'i rigs las skyes pa'o //
translated: The born of the action clan is born from the clan of Amoghasiddhi.🔽 The shudra woman is the knowledge woman of Locana, and so on.🔽 Vairochana is considered great.🔽 This means the coemergent yoga of one's own clan's form internally.🔽 The vajra is Akshobhya.🔽 The jewel is the clan of Ratnasambhava.🔽 🔽The lotus is the clan of Amitabha.🔽 🔽The action is the clan of Amoghasiddhi.

original: las kyi rigs las skyes pa ni don yod par grub pa'i rigs las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rigs las skyes pa ni don yod par grub pa'i rigs las skyes pa'o //
translated: 🔽The shudra is the knowledge woman of Locana, and so on.🔽

original: dmangs ma mo ni zhi ba mo la sogs pa'i rig ma'o //
analyzed: dmangs ma mo ni zhi ba mo la sogs pa'i rig ma'o //
translated: The brahmin is the knowledge woman of Mamaki, and so on.🔽 🔽The kshatriya is the knowledge woman of Pandara.🔽 🔽The vaishya is the knowledge woman of Tara.🔽 🔽The shudra is the knowledge woman of Mamaki.🔽 🔽The desire for the Tathagata is the desire for Vairochana.

original: rnam snang mdzad ni chen por 'dod //
analyzed: rnam snang mdzad ni chen por 'dod //
translated: 🔽The immeasurable vajra is born from the clan of Amitabha.🔽 🔽The born of the action clan is born from the clan of Amoghasiddhi.🔽 🔽The shudra woman is the knowledge woman of Locana, and so on.🔽

original: ces pa ni nang du rang rigs pa'i gzugs lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ma zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni nang du rang rigs pa'i gzugs lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ma zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Vairochana is considered great means the coemergent yoga of one's own clan's form internally.🔽 🔽The vajra is Akshobhya.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi bskyod rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi bskyod rdo rje'o //
translated: 🔽The jewel is the clan of Ratnasambhava.🔽

original: rin chen zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs so //
analyzed: rin chen zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs so //
translated: The lotus is the clan of Amitabha.🔽 🔽The action is the clan of Amoghasiddhi.🔽

original: phyag rgya rnam pa lngar nges pa'o zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i zhing skyes kyi rnal 'byor ma rigs lnga las skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyag rgya rnam pa lngar nges pa'o zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i zhing skyes kyi rnal 'byor ma rigs lnga las skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The five types of seals are ascertained.

original: de ltar phyag rgya chen po lngar nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya chen po lngar nges pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the five great seals is ascertained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs //
translated: The families of the Tathagatas

original: 'di ni mdo ru bsdus par brjod //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo ru bsdus par brjod //
translated: are expressed in this summary.

original: ces pa ni rigs lnga po 'di dag ni 'dod chags chen po dang / zhe sdang chen po dang / gti mug chen po dang / phrag dog chen po dang / ser sna chen po'i rigs lnga'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rigs lnga po 'di dag ni 'dod chags chen po dang / zhe sdang chen po dang / gti mug chen po dang / phrag dog chen po dang / ser sna chen po'i rigs lnga'o //
translated: These five families are the five families of great desire, great hatred, great delusion, great jealousy, and great miserliness.

original: rigs de rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu song ba de bzhin gshegs pas mdor bsdus te rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rigs de rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu song ba de bzhin gshegs pas mdor bsdus te rab tu bstan to //
translated: The Tathagata taught in summary that those who have become great seal adepts by means of those families🔽are the five families.

original: 'on kyang rigs mtha' yas pas phyag rgya yang mtha' yas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs mtha' yas pas phyag rgya yang mtha' yas te /
translated: However, since the families are infinite, the seals are also infinite.

original: gcig la gcig 'khyud pa'i dbang gis rang gi rigs la mngon par 'grod pas de rnams dang lhan cig 'grub pa la 'dir som nyi med do //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'khyud pa'i dbang gis rang gi rigs la mngon par 'grod pas de rnams dang lhan cig 'grub pa la 'dir som nyi med do //
translated: By the power of embracing each other, they are manifestly present in their own family. Therefore, there is no doubt here that they are accomplished together.

original: su'o zhe na /
analyzed: su'o zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bzhin nyid du song nas zhes bya ba @124a * //🔽la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa stong pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis med pa'i 'od gsal ba grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid dngos po rnams dang ro gcig par byed pa'i phyag rgya
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du song nas zhes bya ba @124a * // la sogs pa gsungs te / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pa stong pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis med pa'i 'od gsal ba grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid dngos po rnams dang ro gcig par byed pa'i phyag rgya
translated: Having gone to suchness, etc.

original: ni phyag rgya chen po zhes brjod de /
analyzed: ni phyag rgya chen po zhes brjod de /
translated: The seal that makes things have the same taste as the path of liberation, which is the nondual clear light of the perfection of wisdom, emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations, the limit of reality, and suchness, is called the great seal.

original: der song ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po gnyis so //
analyzed: der song ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po gnyis so //
translated: Having gone there means the two things, mind and mental factors.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa la /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa la /
translated: Glorious means

original: dpal zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dpal zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: nondual wisdom.

original: ldan zhes pa ni de la rig pa'i sems de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ldan zhes pa ni de la rig pa'i sems de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Endowed means the mind of awareness has the nature of that.

original: de bzhin du slar 'ongs pa zhes pa ni de las yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa bzhin du de nyid las 'ongs pas sprul pa'i sku bzung nas sems can gyi don byed cing slar yang de nyid du song nas sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i chos rjes
analyzed: de bzhin du slar 'ongs pa zhes pa ni de las yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa bzhin du de nyid las 'ongs pas sprul pa'i sku bzung nas sems can gyi don byed cing slar yang de nyid du song nas sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i chos rjes
translated: Likewise, “having returned” means that, having come from that, like dependent origination, having taken up the emanation body, one benefits sentient beings, and having returned to that very place, one recollects the Dharma of the Great Vehicle of Mantra.

original: su dran pa sku bzhi thob pa'o //🔽de ltar / de bzhin gshegs pa slar yang byon //
analyzed: su dran pa sku bzhi thob pa'o // de ltar / de bzhin gshegs pa slar yang byon //
translated: Thus, one attains the four bodies.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, “the Tathāgata comes again” is the meaning.

original: shes rab 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: “This wisdom” and so on are easy to understand.

original: rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir sngar gsungs pa'i rigs lnga po de'i khyad par nyid brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir sngar gsungs pa'i rigs lnga po de'i khyad par nyid brjod pa'o //
translated: “Family” and so on here express the distinction of those five families mentioned previously.

original: mtha' yas zhes pa ni rang bzhin rnams mtha' yas pa des na mtha' yas pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: mtha' yas zhes pa ni rang bzhin rnams mtha' yas pa des na mtha' yas pa'i rigs so //
translated: “Infinite” means that because of the infinite natures, there are infinite families.

original: brgya zhes pa ni rang bzhin de re re las rigs brgyar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgya zhes pa ni rang bzhin de re re las rigs brgyar 'gyur te /
translated: “One hundred” means that from each of those natures, there are one hundred families,

original: dbyug pa dang yud tsam gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang yud tsam gyi dbye bas so //
translated: due to the divisions of staff and moment.

original: de yang stong phrag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang stong phrag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: That is a thousand.

original: de ltar rigs mtha' yas pa ni sems so //
analyzed: de ltar rigs mtha' yas pa ni sems so //
translated: Thus, the infinite family is the mind.

original: de bzhin du rigs brgya ni lus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs brgya ni lus so //
translated: Similarly, the hundred families are the body.

original: rigs stong ni ngag go //
analyzed: rigs stong ni ngag go //
translated: The thousand families are the speech.

original: phyis zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye bas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyis zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye bas zhes pa ste /
translated: Later, by the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i don te //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i don te //
translated: is the meaning of the summary.

original: slar yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyed dkrugs te gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyed dkrugs te gsungs pa /
translated: Again, the half-verse is mixed and taught.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The creation stage is taught by “vajra” and so forth.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje zhes pa ni mi bskyod rdo rje ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje zhes pa ni mi bskyod rdo rje ste /
translated: It is said: “Vajra” is Akṣobhya Vajra,

original: mi phyed pa'i ye shes de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ye shes de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he holds that indivisible gnosis.

original: des sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i phung po bskyed pa ni nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i phung po bskyed pa ni nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: By that, the aggregate of consciousness of the buddhas is generated, which is the space element.

original: rin chen zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: rin chen zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: “Jewel” is Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he holds the perfect gnosis.

original: des sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshor ba'i phung po bskyed de /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshor ba'i phung po bskyed de /
translated: That generates the buddhas’ aggregate of feeling,

original: rigs pa'i ye shes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i ye shes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is called the wisdom of reasoning.

original: @124b padma zhes pa ni 'od dpag med de padma'i rtsa ba'i snal ma lta bu'i rtsa rkang pa nas spyi bor 'dzin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa des sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'du shes kyi phung po bskyed de /
analyzed: @124b padma zhes pa ni 'od dpag med de padma'i rtsa ba'i snal ma lta bu'i rtsa rkang pa nas spyi bor 'dzin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa des sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'du shes kyi phung po bskyed de /
translated: Lotus is Amitābha, because a channel like the root of a lotus is held from the feet to the crown. That perfect mindfulness generates the buddhas’ aggregate of discrimination,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the attainment of perfect meditative concentration.

original: nor bu zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The jewel is Amoghasiddhi.

original: ci'i phyir nor bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nor bu yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it a jewel?

original: aindra n'i la lta bu'i ral gri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aindra n'i la lta bu'i ral gri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it holds a sword like an indranīla.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sna tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sna tshogs pa'am /
translated: Because it conquers the various afflictions and secondary afflictions,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam pa lnga 'joms pa'i phyir des sangs rgyas kyi 'du byed kyi phung po bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam pa lnga 'joms pa'i phyir des sangs rgyas kyi 'du byed kyi phung po bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: or the five types such as desire, it generates the buddhas’ aggregate of compositional factors.

original: 'khor lo zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de rnam par snang mdzad ces pa'i rlung chen po de 'gog pa'i phyir des sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs kyi phung po bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de rnam par snang mdzad ces pa'i rlung chen po de 'gog pa'i phyir des sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs kyi phung po bskyed pa'o //
translated: The “wheel” is Vairocana, because that great wind called Vairocana is stopped, it generates the form aggregate of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams rim pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams rim pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the elements of earth, water, fire, and wind should be understood in order.

original: de'i phyir dkrugs pas sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkrugs pas sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the meaning of the previous half-verse, “agitated,”

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “element,” and so on.

original: 'dir gang gi phyir ye shes lnga rnam par gzung ba'i phyir de'i dus su rigs gcig nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi phyir ye shes lnga rnam par gzung ba'i phyir de'i dus su rigs gcig nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, because of the retention of the five wisdoms, at that time, beginning with the single family,

original: ji srid grangs med pa'i rigs rnams bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid grangs med pa'i rigs rnams bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the innumerable families are generated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsungs pa / phung po lnga'i zhes pa ni srog lnga la sogs pa'i rlung rnams so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / phung po lnga'i zhes pa ni srog lnga la sogs pa'i rlung rnams so //
translated: He says “the five aggregates,” which are the winds such as life.

original: de ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin de ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin de ni brten pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of the five great elements is the support.

original: de rnams kyi rten ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rten ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: The support of those is the five aggregates.

original: de'i rang bzhin khams rnams so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin khams rnams so //
translated: The nature of those is the elements.

original: khams rnams las rigs rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khams rnams las rigs rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: From the elements, the families arise.

original: de'i rigs rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rigs rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
translated: Those families become the families of the bodhisattvas,

original: bya ba byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are connected with the performance of actions.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa las gsungs te /🔽du ba las ni mer shes shing //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa las gsungs te / du ba las ni mer shes shing //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān also taught in the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra:🔽From smoke, one knows fire.

original: chu skyar las ni chu yin te //
analyzed: chu skyar las ni chu yin te //
translated: From ospreys, one knows water.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gyis //
translated: The wise bodhisattvas

original: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams las shes //
analyzed: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams las shes //
translated: know the families from the signs.

original: zhes so // de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyes zhes pa ni phung po lnga dang khams lnga po de'i rang bzhin du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyes zhes pa ni phung po lnga dang khams lnga po de'i rang bzhin du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the buddhas and bodhisattvas are born from the five aggregates and the five elements, which are their nature.

original: de'i phyir rigs zhes pa ni sems can sna tshogs pa'i khams rnams su bskyed pa'o //🔽sems @125a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs zhes pa ni sems can sna tshogs pa'i khams rnams su bskyed pa'o // sems @125a * //
translated: Therefore, the “family” is that which generates the various elements of sentient beings.

original: can thams cad 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / phrag dog dang / dregs pa dang / ser sna dang nga rgyal gyi dri mas bsgribs pa 'gro ba drug tu sdug bsngal nyams su myongs ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: can thams cad 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / phrag dog dang / dregs pa dang / ser sna dang nga rgyal gyi dri mas bsgribs pa 'gro ba drug tu sdug bsngal nyams su myongs ba ma yin nam /
translated: Are not all sentient beings obscured by the stains of desire, hatred, ignorance, envy, pride, and greed, and do they not experience suffering in the six destinies?

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs rnams su skyes /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs rnams su skyes /
translated: Why are they born in the families of the buddhas and bodhisattvas?

original: gang gi phyir gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba tsam gyis kyang ngan 'gror mi 'gro na gzhan lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba tsam gyis kyang ngan 'gror mi 'gro na gzhan lta ci smos /
translated: Because, even by merely going for refuge to the Three, one does not go to the miserable destinies, much less in any other way.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas skyabs 'gro ba //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas skyabs 'gro ba //
translated: Those who go for refuge to the Buddha

original: de dag ngan 'gror mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag ngan 'gror mi 'gro'o //
translated: do not go to the miserable destinies.

original: mi yi lus ni spangs nas su //
analyzed: mi yi lus ni spangs nas su //
translated: Having abandoned the human body,

original: de yis lha yi lus ni rnyed //
analyzed: de yis lha yi lus ni rnyed //
translated: they obtain the body of a god.

original: de bzhin du chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro bas kyang ngo //
translated: And likewise, by going for refuge to the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: khyad par dus bcu'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs rnams su skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi khams rnams dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa 'ga' zhig la yod de /
analyzed: khyad par dus bcu'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs rnams su skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi khams rnams dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa 'ga' zhig la yod de /
translated: In particular, there are some who doubt that all sentient beings born in the families of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who are the lords of the ten times, experience the suffering of the hells and so forth.

original: de'i phyir 'dir lan gsum gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir lan gsum gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the answer is given three times here.

original: bden mod 'on kyang mi shes pa'i dri mas bsgribs pas mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i byis pa rnams log pa'i chos la chags pa mi dge ba'i grogs kyi dbang gis phyin ci log gi chos rnams la yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: bden mod 'on kyang mi shes pa'i dri mas bsgribs pas mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i byis pa rnams log pa'i chos la chags pa mi dge ba'i grogs kyi dbang gis phyin ci log gi chos rnams la yongs su rtog go //
translated: It is true, but because of being obscured by the stain of ignorance, the childish, such as the tirthikas, are attached to false doctrines. By the power of non-virtuous friends, they imagine false doctrines.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi lta ba ngan pa rnams rnam par gzhom pa'i phyir de bzhin gshags pas chos sna tshogs ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi lta ba ngan pa rnams rnam par gzhom pa'i phyir de bzhin gshags pas chos sna tshogs ston par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, in order to conquer their bad views, the Tathagata teaches various doctrines.

original: gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin bar bar du chad pas ji srid du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin bar bar du chad pas ji srid du /
translated: Because of the interruption of samadhi, for as long as

original: sems rab kyi mthar thug par ma gyur pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems rab kyi mthar thug par ma gyur pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind has not reached the ultimate limit,

original: de kho na nyid kyi le'u tshul gyis de kho na nyid bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi le'u tshul gyis de kho na nyid bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan te /
translated: the Blessed One taught the meditation on reality by the method of the chapter on reality.

original: gang dmigs pas sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dmigs pas sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: By observing that, the mind becomes one-pointed.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sgom pa po med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sgom pa po med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is stated: There is no meditator, nothing to meditate on, and so on.

original: sgom pa po med bsgom bya med //
analyzed: sgom pa po med bsgom bya med //
translated: There is no meditator, nothing to meditate on.

original: ces pa ni 'dir sems can rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos dbang po'i sgo nas phyi'i dngos po rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'dir sems can rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos dbang po'i sgo nas phyi'i dngos po rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, sentient beings engage with external things through the doors of the senses by means of the duality of grasped and grasper.

original: de'i phyir phung po lnga'i nga rgyal las slar yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bag chags kyi dbang gis ma dang / pha yang dag par sbyor bas phung po dang khams la sogs pa la brten pa 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lnga'i nga rgyal las slar yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bag chags kyi dbang gis ma dang / pha yang dag par sbyor bas phung po dang khams la sogs pa la brten pa 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, again, based on the pride of the five aggregates, they grasp the aggregates, elements, and so on, by the power of the latent tendencies of virtue and non-virtue through the union of mother and father.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: sems kyi rtog pa'i dngos po las @125b so ;
analyzed: sems kyi rtog pa'i dngos po las @125b so ;
translated: From the entity of mental conception.

original: / sems kyang mi bden pa te /
analyzed: / sems kyang mi bden pa te /
translated: The mind is also untrue.

original: mi bden pa la brten par yongs su brtags pa des 'khor bar 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bden pa la brten par yongs su brtags pa des 'khor bar 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: One is bound in cyclic existence by that imagination which is based on the unreal.

original: mi shes pas so //
analyzed: mi shes pas so //
translated: Because of ignorance.

original: 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: This is contradictory.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is contradictory?

original: der bstan pa ci gang dang gang bstan pas sems ca thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rnams zad par byed do //
analyzed: der bstan pa ci gang dang gang bstan pas sems ca thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rnams zad par byed do //
translated: Whatever is taught, by that teaching the afflictions of all sentient beings are extinguished.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And that is of the nature of imagination.

original: sdud par byed pas gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos sna tshogs pa'i glegs bam gyi tshul gyis de rnams su ngag gi rnam par rtog pas dngos po'i dpe brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud par byed pas gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos sna tshogs pa'i glegs bam gyi tshul gyis de rnams su ngag gi rnam par rtog pas dngos po'i dpe brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the various scriptures of the true Dharma, which are the collections of the Buddha’s words, are in the form of books, and in them the imagination of verbal expressions is used to illustrate things.

original: de 'dir brjod de /
analyzed: de 'dir brjod de /
translated: That is stated here.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi lam bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi lam bskyed do //
translated: Here, the buddhas generate the path which is of the nature of non-imagination in order to abandon all obscurations along with the habitual tendencies of subject and object and the afflictions.

original: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because for the Arhats it is with remainder,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'gyur ro //
translated: and for the Tathagatas it is without remainder.
